title: PepsiCo Chief Corporate Affairs Officer Roberto Azevedo to Retire in June
summary: Roberto Azevedo, PepsiCo's Chief Corporate Affairs Officer, is set to retire in June, with his successor expected to be named in the coming weeks. Azevedo joined PepsiCo in 2020 after serving as the Director-General of the World Trade Organization for seven years. Ramón Laguarta, PepsiCo's Chairman and CEO, acknowledged Azevedo's significant contributions to the company, particularly in external engagement and its pep+ (PepsiCo Positive) transformation agenda.

title: New Starbucks CEO takes reins early from Howard Schultz
summary: Laxman Narasimhan has assumed the role of CEO at Starbucks two weeks earlier than planned, replacing founder Howard Schultz. Narasimhan, who also joined the company's board, brings experience from Reckitt Benckiser and PepsiCo. His appointment comes as Starbucks faces a growing unionization push and prepares for its annual shareholder meeting, which he will lead.

title: Kellanova Paves Way to Less Plastic: A Glimpse Into Innovative Packaging
summary: Kellanova is making significant strides in reducing plastic waste by implementing innovative packaging solutions for its snack brands, resulting in a substantial reduction of plastic and corrugated cardboard. These efforts align with the company's "Kellanova Better Days Promise" to achieve 100% reusable, recyclable, or compostable packaging by 2030, emphasizing a circular economy approach and consumer education on recycling. The company's initiatives reflect a broader industry trend towards sustainable packaging, driven by environmental concerns and consumer demand.

title: 2 million acres and counting: unpacking ADM's regenerative agriculture progress report for North America
summary: Archer Daniels Midland (ADM) has released its first progress report on implementing regenerative agriculture, announcing that it has signed up nearly 2 million acres in North America in 2023, doubling its 2022 achievement. The company aims to reach 4 million acres by 2027 and highlights its efforts to reduce carbon emissions and sequester CO2 through these practices. ADM defines regenerative agriculture based on Indigenous land management principles, focusing on minimizing soil disturbance, maintaining living roots, covering bare soil, maximizing diversity, and responsibly managing inputs.

title: PEPSICO CHICAGO EMPLOYEES GIFT OVER $1 MILLION TO NONPROFITS DURING OCTOBER; COMPANY ANNOUNCES NEW GRANTS TO SUPPORT CHICAGOANS
summary: PepsiCo's Chicago employees donated over $1.2 million to nonprofits in October, matched by the PepsiCo Foundation, and volunteered nearly 1,400 hours as part of their "PepsiCo Gives Back" campaign. The company also announced new grants totaling nearly $90,000 to support community development, education, healthcare, and workforce development initiatives in Chicago. These efforts expand PepsiCo's local partnerships and build on its $5 million investment in the PREP program to enhance career resources for young people in Chicago's South and West Sides.

title: PepsiCo Sets Goals to Further Reduce Sodium and Deliver More Diverse Ingredients in Convenient Foods Portfolio
summary: PepsiCo announced new goals to further reduce sodium and deliver more diverse ingredients in its global convenient foods portfolio. The company aims for at least 75% of its convenient foods to meet or be below category sodium targets by 2030 and to deliver 145 billion portions of diverse ingredients annually by the same year. These initiatives are part of PepsiCo's ongoing commitment to improving the nutritional profile of its products and promoting healthier diets.

title: PepsiCo Names Emerging Snack Startup CHUZA as Winner of the 2023 Greenhouse Accelerator: Juntos Crecemos Edition
summary: PepsiCo announced CHUZA, a San Diego-based Mexican-inspired snack company, as the winner of the 2023 Greenhouse Accelerator: Juntos Crecemos Edition. CHUZA will receive a $100,000 grant and resources to scale its operations after a six-month mentorship program. This program focused on supporting emerging Hispanic businesses, with CHUZA recognized for its significant distribution expansion and collaboration with PepsiCo.

title: LAY'S® and Matt James Celebrate Friendsgiving with Mashed Potatoes Made from Lay's Potato Chips
summary: Lay's and Matt James have collaborated to create a "Lay's Potato Chip to Potato Dish with Matt James" cookbook kit for Friendsgiving, featuring mashed potatoes made from Lay's potato chips. This initiative leverages a viral cooking hack and highlights Lay's chips, made from real potatoes, as a fun ingredient for holiday dishes. Fans have the chance to win this exclusive kit, which includes a limited-edition bag of chips and the recipe.

title: Cheetos® Enters New Category with Debut of CHEETOS® Pretzels
summary: Cheetos has launched a new product, Cheetos Pretzels, available in Cheddar and FLAMIN' HOT® flavors, marking its entry into a new snack category. The company aims to leverage the popularity of flavored pretzels and Cheetos' distinctive Cheetle seasoning to offer fans a new snacking experience. These Cheetle-covered pretzels are available nationwide in various bag sizes.

title: Snack-maker Conagra may tweak portions as weight-loss drugs alter appetites
summary: Conagra Brands is considering adjusting portion sizes and ingredients of its snacks in response to the growing use of weight-loss drugs like Wegovy and Ozempic, which are altering consumer eating patterns. The company's CEO, Sean Connolly, stated that while changes might not be immediate, Conagra's scientists are actively studying consumer behavior for potential long-term shifts. This trend could impact revenue and profit forecasts for many packaged food companies.

title: Bunge: The Top Pick For Dividend Growth In Agriculture (NYSE:BG)
summary: Bunge Limited is highlighted as a strong player in the agriculture sector due to its vertically integrated operations and recent merger with Viterra. Despite a modest dividend yield, its financial strength, undervaluation, and growth potential make it an attractive investment, especially when paired with other stocks like PepsiCo for inflation hedging. The article suggests Bunge is a valuable addition to a dividend growth portfolio.

title: Frito-Lay Opens New Scholarship for College Students to Celebrate Community Builders
summary: Frito-Lay announced the launch of the Frito-Lay Community Builders Scholarship, a new needs-based scholarship program for college students. The program will award four students $25,000 each who demonstrate a commitment to uplifting and leading their communities. Applications open on October 3rd and close on November 20th, with awards announced by January 30, 2024.

title: Big Food vs. Big Pharma: Companies bet on snacking just as weight loss drugs boom
summary: Food companies are heavily investing in snacking amid the rise of GLP-1 weight loss drugs like Ozempic and Wegovy, which could threaten future sales growth. While some analysts project a significant impact on snack consumption by 2035, others suggest the drugs' high cost and target demographic might limit the threat to "Big Food." Companies are expected to adapt through innovation and portfolio adjustments, potentially focusing on healthier snack options.

title: Microsoft and Oracle Expand Partnership to Deliver Oracle Database Services on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure in Microsoft Azure
summary: Microsoft and Oracle have expanded their partnership to launch Oracle Database@Azure, allowing customers direct access to Oracle database services running on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) in Microsoft Azure datacenters. This collaboration simplifies cloud migration, offers high-performance Oracle databases with Azure's services and AI capabilities, and provides a streamlined purchasing process through Azure Marketplace. The service aims to address challenges in multicloud architectures and is supported by a joint support model.

title: Microsoft expands partnership with Oracle to bring customers’ mission-critical database workloads to Azure
summary: Microsoft and Oracle are expanding their partnership to enable Oracle's customers to run mission-critical database workloads on Microsoft Azure. This new offering, Oracle Database@Azure, allows customers to migrate existing Oracle databases "as is" to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) and deploy them within Azure datacenters, providing seamless integration with Azure services like Azure OpenAI. The collaboration aims to reduce hurdles for cloud migration and allow businesses to leverage cutting-edge cloud services with their Oracle databases, improving efficiency and enabling new applications.

title: Cheetos® Marks 75 Years of Mischief with Epic Birthday Bash with Cheetos-inspired Fashion Show and Reveal of Cheetos Milk Bar Cake
summary: Cheetos celebrated its 75th anniversary with an "Epic Birthday Bash" featuring a Cheetos-inspired fashion show and the unveiling of a new Cheetle-infused Milk Bar cake. The event showcased a limited-edition fashion collection designed by Gabriel Held, and fans can purchase an exclusive Cheetos handbag. The celebration also introduced a unique savory-sweet Cheetos Milk Bar birthday cake, available in select locations for a limited time.

title: LAY'S® Kettle Cooked RUFFLES® All Dressed Brings Flavors of the Great White North to LAY'S® FLAVOR SWAP® Fan Favorites
summary: Lay's is introducing Lay's Kettle Cooked Ruffles All Dressed flavored potato chips, bringing back a popular Canadian flavor as part of its Flavor Swap program. This new mashup offers a tangy, savory, and sweet experience, joining other fan-favorite flavor swaps like Lay's Cheetos Cheese, Lay's Doritos Cool Ranch, and Lay's Wavy Funyuns Onion. These limited-time and permanent Flavor Swap varieties will be available nationwide starting this month.

title: How Mars, Colgate-Palmolive, Nestle & Coca-Cola are Exploring Generative AI
summary: This article details how major CPGs like Mars, Colgate-Palmolive, Nestle, and Coca-Cola are exploring generative AI to enhance efficiency, drive innovation, and improve consumer engagement. It highlights specific use cases ranging from pet health prediction and product formulation to marketing content creation and consumer experiences, while also emphasizing the critical need for responsible and ethical implementation of AI technologies. Each company is leveraging AI in unique ways to gain a competitive edge and redefine various operational and customer-facing functions.

title: Free Mullets??? Fritos® Gets Fans Flow Ready
summary: Fritos, the official snack sponsor of the USA Mullet Championship, is offering 1,000 free mullet haircuts at all Floyd's 99 Barbershop locations throughout August. Fans can also enter for a chance to win a $10,000 cash prize in the USA Mullet Championships or a year's supply of Fritos by sharing their mullet photos on social media. This campaign aims to celebrate individuality and the resurgence of the mullet hairstyle.

title: Eastman provides updates on massive PET recycling plant
summary: Eastman Chemical is proceeding with its massive PET recycling plant in Kingsport, Tenn., despite rising costs and current low PET prices slowing contract negotiations with brand owners like PepsiCo. The company remains confident in the project due to recycled-content mandates and its technological advantage, expecting to start selling products from the plant around year-end and generate roughly $75 million in EBITDA next year. Capital expenditures for the Kingsport plant have significantly increased, with the company also planning similar plants in France and another U.S. location.

title: Get Ready for Greatness: Frito-Lay Unites Current Soccer Stars and Past Icons in New FIFA Women's World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™ Marketing Campaign
summary: Frito-Lay launched a new marketing campaign for the FIFA Women's World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™, marking its largest-ever investment in women's sports. The campaign includes a TV commercial featuring current and legendary women's soccer players, a #LaysGOALdenGiveaway, and an ultimate watch party experience. Frito-Lay is also offering limited-edition FIFA Women's World Cup™-branded packaging for several of its snack brands, including Cracker Jill®, which celebrates women in sports.

title: PepsiCo Selects 10 Hispanic-Owned Food and Beverage Startups to Join the Greenhouse Accelerator Program: Juntos Crecemos Edition
summary: PepsiCo announced the 10 finalists for its Greenhouse Accelerator Program: Juntos Crecemos Edition, which supports emerging Hispanic-owned food and beverage businesses. These companies will receive a $20,000 grant and business mentoring over six months, with one finalist awarded an additional $100,000 to further their business growth. The program aims to fuel the growth of Hispanic small businesses and foster entrepreneurial spirit within the community.

title: NFL's Jalen Hurts Signs Deal With Keurig Dr Pepper-Backed Energy Drink A Shoc
summary: NFL quarterback Jalen Hurts has signed a multiyear deal with Keurig Dr Pepper Inc.-backed energy drink A Shoc beverages. As part of the agreement, the Philadelphia Eagles star will receive an equity stake in the business and promote its Accelerator brand. The financial terms of the deal were not disclosed, highlighting the increasing competition for celebrity endorsements in the energy drink industry.

title: Better Buy: Procter & Gamble vs. Clorox
summary: This article compares Procter & Gamble (PG) and Clorox (CLX), concluding that P&G is the better buy primarily due to its significantly larger marketing budget and ability to dominate competitive markets. While Clorox leads in niche categories, P&G's financial muscle allows it to consistently out-promote competitors and maintain an "unfair advantage" in consumer staples. The article emphasizes that P&G's size allows it to better navigate consumer price sensitivity and market competition.

title: PepsiCo Releases 2022 Global DE&I Report: Gender Parity in Management Rises to 44%
summary: PepsiCo has released its 2022 Global DE&I Report, showcasing continued progress towards its diversity, equity, and inclusion goals. The report highlights an increase in gender parity, with women now holding 44% of global management roles and positive trends in U.S. Black and Hispanic representation at the manager level. PepsiCo's efforts span employee representation, business partner engagement through diverse suppliers, and community support initiatives, all reinforcing DE&I as a core pillar of its pep+ journey.

title: A.I. ETF Sold Out Of Monster Energy, Three Ways To Look At It
summary: The Artificial Intelligence driven ETF (AMOM) unexpectedly sold its entire position in Monster Beverage (MNST), despite Monster's strong performance and growth. The article explores three perspectives on this move, comparing Monster's valuation and performance against Starbucks (SBUX), PepsiCo (PEP), and Coca-Cola (KO), highlighting Monster's aggressive growth trajectory versus the more predictable cash flows and dividends of its peers. The analysis suggests Monster still has significant room for outperformance.

title: Sigue el conflicto gremial con una embotelladora de Coca-Cola y amenaza con provocar faltantes en góndolas
summary: A labor dispute at a Coca-Cola bottling plant in Córdoba, Argentina, belonging to Coca-Cola Andina, threatens product shortages. The conflict stems from workers' claims of "unjustified dismissals" and demands for better labor rights and salaries, while the company asserts the conflict is politically motivated and without foundation. This situation has escalated to legal action due to alleged violent incidents.

title: Conagra Brands Snacks Portfolio Showcases Dynamic Range at 2023 Sweets & Snacks Expo
summary: Conagra Brands showcased its diverse and innovative snack portfolio, valued at $3.1 billion, at the 2023 Sweets & Snacks Expo in Chicago. The company highlighted category leaders and new products from brands like Slim Jim, DAVID Seeds, BiGS Sunflower Seeds, ACT II, Angie's BOOMCHICKAPOP, Andy Capp's, and Snack Pack. Emphasizing both salty and sweet options, Conagra demonstrated its continued focus on meeting evolving consumer preferences and driving sales growth for retailers.

title: Colgate-Palmolive beats Q4 profit estimates helped by price hikes
summary: Colgate-Palmolive (India) Ltd's fourth-quarter profit fell less than expected, helped by price hikes implemented to combat surging costs. The company reported a 2.3% fall in net profit to 3.16 billion rupees, while sales rose nearly 4% to 13.42 billion rupees due to price increases. Its better-than-feared earnings follow previous drops in profit and come as other consumer goods makers also report mixed earnings for the March quarter.

title: PepsiCo Declares Quarterly Dividend
summary: PepsiCo's Board of Directors declared a quarterly dividend of $1.265 per share, representing a 10 percent increase from the previous year. This action aligns with the company's previously announced annualized dividend increase to $5.06 per share, effective with the June 2023 payment. PepsiCo has a history of consistent dividends, marking its 51st consecutive annual dividend increase in 2023.

title: Colgate-Palmolive’s stock pops after earnings beat as company raises prices by double-digit percentage
summary: Colgate-Palmolive's stock rose 3.6% after reporting better-than-expected first-quarter earnings, driven by significant price increases, including a 10.5% hike in North America. This trend reflects the pricing power demonstrated by several consumer-goods companies this earnings season, such as Procter & Gamble, Kimberly-Clark, PepsiCo, Nestlé, and Unilever, who also implemented double-digit price increases with minimal impact on sales volumes.

title: 30% of Dow Shareholders Urge Company to Study Future With Less Virgin Plastic
summary: A shareholder resolution filed with Dow Inc. by As You Sow, requesting the company report on the impact of reduced global demand for virgin plastic, received support from over 30% of shareholders. This proposal highlights the growing concern over single-use plastics and the need for companies like Dow, a major producer of plastic resins, to assess their reliance on these materials. The resolution also sought disclosure on the cost-effectiveness, efficiency, and environmental soundness of chemical recycling technologies Dow plans to use.

title: Lay's® Unveils First Lay's RePlay Soccer Field in the U.S. Made from Reused Chip Bag Packaging
summary: Lay's has launched its first U.S. Lay's RePlay soccer field in Santa Ana, California, constructed from recycled chip bags, expanding its global initiative to provide sustainable play spaces. Soccer legends Mia Hamm and Javier "Chicharito" Hernández joined the announcement, highlighting the positive community impact and environmental benefits of the program. This field marks the sixth worldwide, aiming to unite communities through soccer and minimize environmental impact.

title: Frito-Lay North America Completes First Third-Party Electric Vehicle Shipment in Continued Effort to Decarbonize Supply Chain
summary: Frito-Lay North America announced its first third-party shipment using an electric vehicle, a significant step in its efforts to decarbonize its supply chain and achieve net-zero emissions by 2040. This collaboration with Schneider, utilizing their Freightliner eCascadia fleet, is expected to reduce emissions by over 70 percent from initial EV routes compared to diesel trucks. The initiative supports PepsiCo Positive (pep+) and Frito-Lay's broader sustainability goals, including advancements within its own fleet and manufacturing facilities.

title: PepsiCo Chief Human Resources Officer Ronald Schellekens set to retire at the end of 2023; PepsiCo Prepares for Incoming Chief Human Resources Officer Becky Schmitt
summary: Ronald Schellekens, PepsiCo's Executive Vice President and Chief Human Resources Officer, announced his retirement at the end of 2023. Becky Schmitt, formerly of Cognizant, will succeed him, joining PepsiCo as the new Executive Vice President and Chief Human Resources Officer, effective October 1st. Schellekens' leadership was praised for advancing PepsiCo's human-centric organization and culture, while Schmitt brings almost 30 years of HR leadership experience from companies like Cognizant, Walmart, and Accenture.

title: iShares Global Consumer Staples ETF (KXI) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides an in-depth look at the iShares Global Consumer Staples ETF (KXI), detailing its stock price, holdings, dividend yield, and key statistics. It highlights top holdings such as Costco, Nestle, PepsiCo, and Philip Morris International, along with historical performance metrics and asset allocation. The report also includes information from its latest N-PORT filing, showing 95 total holdings with a portfolio value of $854.00 million.

title: PepsiCo Juntos Crecemos and Celebrity Chef Lorena Garcia Team Up to Support Jefa-Owned Businesses on National Jefa Day
summary: PepsiCo's Juntos Crecemos initiative, in partnership with celebrity chef Lorena Garcia, is launching its second annual "Jefa-Owned" campaign to support Latina small business owners in the food and beverage industry. In celebration of National Jefa Day, PepsiCo will cover the tab for the first 200 consumers dining at select Latina-owned businesses nationwide on March 31, 2023. The campaign also highlights PepsiCo's ongoing programs like the Hispanic Digital & Delivery Program and the PepsiCo Foundation's IMPACTO Hispanic Business Accelerator, offering resources and financial support to Hispanic-owned businesses.

title: Global Corporations Join Brookfield to Invest Nearly a Billion Dollars in Closed Loop Partners' Operating Company, Circular Services, the Leading Developer of Circular Economy Infrastructure
summary: Closed Loop Partners announced that six major corporations – Microsoft, Nestlé, PepsiCo, SK Group, Starbucks, and Unilever – are joining Brookfield to invest nearly a billion dollars in Circular Services. This investment aims to scale circular economy infrastructure and services in the United States, focusing on packaging, organics, textiles, and electronics. Circular Services, already the largest privately held recycling company in the U.S., will use these funds to upgrade recycling capabilities and prevent billions in landfill disposal costs, fostering a transition to a circular economy.

title: Starbucks Corp. stock outperforms competitors on strong trading day
summary: Starbucks Corp. stock rose 0.83% to $102.44 on Monday, breaking a six-day losing streak, amidst a generally positive day for the stock market. The company's stock outperformed some competitors like Coca-Cola Co. and PepsiCo Inc. which saw slight declines, though McDonald's Corp. also rose. Starbucks closed $8.39 below its 52-week high, with trading volume below its 50-day average.

title: BlackRock — the world’s largest asset manager — says central banks are 'deliberately' causing recessions and warns of a downturn unlike any other. 3 shockproof assets for your protection
summary: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, predicts a unique recession caused by central banks deliberately overtightening policy to combat inflation, warning that central banks may not intervene to rescue the economy. The firm suggests investors consider "shockproof" assets like consumer staples, fine wine, and real estate as hedges against this impending downturn.

title: Universal Corp. Appoints Arthur Schick, Jr. to Board of Directors
summary: Universal Corporation (NYSE: UVV) announced the appointment of Arthur J. Schick, Jr. to its Board of Directors, effective April 1, 2023. Mr. Schick, a retired Vice President from PepsiCo, brings extensive experience in the food and beverage industry, particularly in ingredients, supply chain, and product research to Universal's growing plant-based ingredients business. Both Universal's CEO and Mr. Schick expressed enthusiasm for his contribution to the company's future growth strategy.

title: Lay's® and Global Superstar Anitta Celebrate Joy of Latino Community and Invite Fans to Stay Golden®
summary: Lay's is partnering with global superstar Anitta to launch a new Latino TV spot and campaign titled "Beat of Joy," celebrating the joy and diversity of the Latino community. The campaign features a remixed version of Anitta's hit "Envolver," uniquely recorded using over 6,000 potatoes, which earned a Guinness World Records™ title. Lay's also plans to support Latino communities across the U.S. and engage fans through social media contests and a limited-edition voceteo kit signed by Anitta.

title: Directory of All Companies active in the potato sector in Ohio
summary: This article provides a directory of companies operating in the potato sector within Ohio. The directory lists various businesses ranging from potato chip manufacturers and food processors to equipment suppliers and agricultural marketing agencies, indicating their primary activities and locations. It serves as a comprehensive resource for identifying key players in Ohio's potato industry.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper grows as company, gains on competition
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper, America's third-largest soft drink maker, is growing and gaining market share despite the overall decline in soda consumption. The company increased its dollar share by 9% from 2003 to 2021, now holding 25% of the U.S. retail market, behind Coca-Cola (40%) and Pepsi (29%). This growth highlights Keurig Dr Pepper's success in a competitive beverage industry.

title: Kellogg divests Russian operations to local snacks maker Chernogolovka
summary: Kellogg Co announced its decision to divest its Russian operations to local snacks and drinks maker Chernogolovka, joining other Western brands leaving the country. This move follows Kellogg's earlier suspension of product imports and investments in Russia due to the Ukraine invasion. Chernogolovka, known for snacks and beverages, has also stepped in to supply soft drinks to Russian fast-food outlets after major soda companies halted sales.

title: Coca-Cola Business Model
summary: This article details the Coca-Cola business model, outlining its historical development, revenue streams, customer segments, value propositions, and operational aspects. It also includes a comprehensive SWOT analysis, examining the company's strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats in the global beverage industry. The analysis highlights Coca-Cola's strong brand, global reach, and diversified product portfolio as key strengths, while addressing challenges like reliance on sugary drinks, environmental impact, and increasing competition.

title: $13M Pepsi settlement over unpaid wages following Kronos hack approved
summary: A New York federal judge approved a $12.75 million settlement between PepsiCo and its employees to resolve claims of unpaid wages following a 2021 Kronos cybersecurity breach. The settlement benefits current and former PepsiCo employees affected by the Kronos outage between December 5, 2021, and April 8, 2022, with a final approval hearing set for April 4. During an investigation, PepsiCo found it had underpaid 23,801 workers by over $23 million, which has since been paid, and an additional $12.75 million will be distributed if the settlement is finalized.

title: DORITOS® TRANSFORMS LATE-NIGHT DINING WITH THE LAUNCH OF DORITOS AFTER DARK™, AN AFTER-HOURS FOOD EXPERIENCE OFFERING ELEVATED, GLOBALLY INSPIRED BITES
summary: Doritos is launching "Doritos After Dark," a new after-hours food experience offering elevated, globally inspired bites through ghost kitchens and a pop-up event. This initiative aims to satisfy late-night snack cravings, particularly among Gen Z, by pairing classic Doritos flavors with unique culinary creations. The program includes delivery services in select cities and a one-night-only pop-up event in Los Angeles on December 21.

title: DORITOS® TAKES INSPIRATION FROM VON MILLER'S ICONIC TRIANGLE HAIRCUT, INVITES FANS TO #NAMETHATTRIANGLE AND SHOWCASE THEIR CREATIVE TAKE
summary: Doritos is launching the #NameThatTriangle social contest, inspired by Von Miller's triangular haircut, encouraging fans to adopt the style and creatively name their new 'do for a chance to win Super Bowl LVII tickets. Weekly winners can also receive an autographed Von Miller helmet and a Triangle Hair Kit. The campaign includes a "Von's Chips (and Clips) Tailgate" event offering on-site barbers for fans to get triangular haircuts.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper spends $863M for stake in C4 Energy maker
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper is acquiring a 30% stake in Nutrabolt, the maker of C4 Energy and Xtend Energy drinks, for $863 million. This deal includes a long-term sales and distribution agreement, giving Keurig Dr Pepper a significant entry into the rapidly growing performance energy drink market. The investment strategically positions Keurig Dr Pepper to adapt to changing consumer trends in the beverage industry.

title: Exxon Mobil gives employees massive pay raises
summary: Exxon Mobil is significantly raising employee salaries by an average of 9% and granting restricted stock options to 14,000 employees globally, marking its largest salary increase in 15 years. This comes amidst record-breaking profits for the oil giant in 2022. The article contrasts Exxon's good fortune with mass layoffs occurring in the tech, housing, and financial sectors at companies like Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs, PepsiCo, Intel, and BuzzFeed.

title: Precision pollination startup BeeHero nets $42M with backing from General Mills
summary: BeeHero, a precision pollination startup, has secured $42 million in Series B funding, with investment from General Mills' 301 Inc. and ADM's Cibus Capital. The company utilizes data analytics and AI to enhance crop yields by allowing remote monitoring of hives and crop development. This investment highlights an increasing industry focus on pollination to ensure reliable commodity procurement and address food insecurity concerns.

title: PepsiCo sets global packaging goals following shareholder scrutiny
summary: PepsiCo has set an ambitious global packaging goal for 2030, aiming to deliver up to 20% of its beverage servings through reusable models, doubling its current rate. This move is part of the PepsiCo Positive (pep+) sustainability programme and is accelerated by shareholder pressure, particularly from "As You Sow." The company plans to expand its SodaStream business and work with bottlers to increase reusable plastic and glass bottle offerings to achieve this target.

title: Report says PepsiCo to slash hundreds of jobs
summary: PepsiCo plans to eliminate hundreds of jobs at the headquarters of its North American snacks and beverages division, according to a report by The Wall Street Journal. The layoffs are intended to simplify the organization and improve efficiency. As of Dec. 25, 2021, PepsiCo employed over 309,000 people worldwide.

title: PepsiCo to lay off hundreds of workers in headquarters roles
summary: PepsiCo Inc. is laying off hundreds of workers at the headquarters of its North American snacks and beverages divisions as part of an effort to streamline the organization for greater efficiency. The cuts will be more significant in the beverage business, with the snacks unit having already reduced positions through a voluntary retirement program. This move signals a broader corporate belt-tightening beyond the tech and media sectors, with other major companies like Walmart and Ford also trimming white-collar roles.

title: WSJ News Exclusive | PepsiCo to Lay Off Hundreds of Workers in Headquarters Roles
summary: PepsiCo Inc. is enacting layoffs across its North American snacks and beverages divisions, affecting hundreds of headquarters roles. This move signals that corporate cost-cutting measures are now extending beyond the tech and media sectors. The cuts impact operations in Purchase, N.Y., Chicago, and Plano, Texas.

title: PEPSICO INTRODUCES NEW PACKAGING GOAL, DOUBLING DOWN ON SCALING REUSABLE PACKAGING OPTIONS
summary: PepsiCo has announced a new global packaging goal to double the percentage of beverage servings delivered through reusable models to 20% by 2030, as part of its PepsiCo Positive (pep+) strategy. This initiative, driven by disruptive innovation, aims to reduce virgin plastic per serving by 50% by 2030 and contribute to becoming Net Zero by 2040. The company plans to achieve this through expanding SodaStream, increasing refillable bottle options, growing its fountain drinks business, and accelerating powders and concentrates.

title: Tesla expands with the first electric Semi-truck to PepsiCo
summary: Five years after its prototype reveal, Tesla delivered its first electric Semi-truck to PepsiCo\'s Frito-Lay in Modesto, California. PepsiCo has reserved 100 trucks and plans to deploy 15 by year-end, aiming to reduce fuel costs and emissions. Tesla CEO Elon Musk projects significant cargo transportation cost decreases and safety boosts, with a tentative plan to produce 50,000 Semis for North America in 2024.

title: Pepsi Falsely Touts 'No Preservatives' In Izze Drinks, Suit Says
summary: PepsiCo is facing a proposed class action lawsuit alleging false advertising of its Izze-brand sparkling juice products. The suit claims that Izze drinks are advertised as having "no preservatives" despite containing ascorbic and citric acids, which are common preservatives. The legal action was filed in a New York federal court.

title: PepsiCo transforms for the digital era
summary: PepsiCo is undergoing a significant five-year digital transformation led by Chief Strategy and Transformation Officer Athina Kanioura, focusing on cloud, analytics, automation, and upskilling its 300,000 employees. The company has migrated 5,000 applications to Microsoft Azure and is refining its data analytics and deploying AI-enhanced robotics, leading to positive financial KPIs and an expected 12% growth for the current fiscal year. A key aspect of the transformation is employee buy-in and upskilling through initiatives like the PepsiCo Digital Academy, alongside establishing Digital Hubs to create new digital jobs.

title: General Mills, others warm up to hot cereal category
summary: The hot cereal category saw new product introductions in 2021 from General Mills, This Saves Lives, and Proper Good, even as established brands faced declining sales compared to the COVID-19-boosted 2020. General Mills launched new instant oatmeal flavors based on popular cereals, while This Saves Lives focused on nutrition and social impact, and Proper Good introduced a convenient, shelf-stable option. Despite the new entries, the overall hot cereal/oatmeal category experienced a 3.3% sales decline in the 52-week period ending Dec. 26, 2021.

title: Tesla Delivers Semi Trucks to PepsiCo, Expanding Beyond Passenger Vehicles
summary: Tesla Inc. delivered its first all-electric semitrailer trucks to PepsiCo Inc. on Thursday, marking a significant expansion beyond its traditional passenger vehicle market. This delivery comes five years after Elon Musk initially revealed the Semi model, which was originally due out in 2019. The Semi represents the first new model Tesla has put into customer hands since early 2020.

title: "ALL-IN WITH FRITO-LAY" INITIATIVE INCREASES SOCCER ACCESSIBILITY FOR THOUSANDS OF CHILDREN NATIONWIDE
summary: Frito-Lay North America has announced a $600,000 contribution to the "All-In with Frito-Lay" initiative with the U.S. Soccer Foundation, as part of a three-year commitment to increase equity in soccer. This program aims to train over 1,000 coaches and provide equipment, ultimately keeping more than 30,000 young athletes on the field. Two-time FIFA Women's World Cup champion Brandi Chastain participated in an event celebrating the partnership, highlighting the importance of the coach-player relationship.

title: Coke’s sustainably chief throws down a marker on regulations for reporting supplier emissions
summary: Coca-Cola's chief sustainability officer, Bea Perez, announced the company's support for the SEC's proposed regulations on supplier emissions, or Scope 3 emissions, despite previous quibbles regarding implementation details for smaller suppliers. Perez emphasized the need for fairness and consistency in reporting, while Kristina Wyatt, formerly of the SEC, clarified that the proposed rules allow for flexibility, including using industry benchmarks for smaller entities during a phase-in period. The article highlights Coca-Cola's existing voluntary climate targets to reduce total greenhouse gas emissions by 25% by 2030 and its ambition for net-zero carbon emissions by 2050.

title: RTE cereal makers seeking seasonal boost
summary: Ready-to-eat (RTE) cereal manufacturers are introducing new seasonal flavors and miniature versions of classic cereals to boost unit sales, which have been declining despite dollar sales growth in the category. Kellogg Co. is recovering from past disruptions with new products like Instabowls and seasonal offerings, while General Mills, Inc. has introduced "Minis" and other holiday-themed cereals. Quaker Oats Co. is also participating in this trend with the return of Christmas Crunch, aiming to capitalize on strong growth in its Cap’n Crunch brand.

title: Meet The Markets: Introducing Spain
summary: This article introduces Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) in Spain, highlighting its history, economic contribution, and commitment to sustainability and community programs. It details CCEP Spain's innovation in product offerings, significant job creation, and environmental efforts like emissions reduction, plastic recycling, and waste collection. Key facts and figures demonstrate CCEP's substantial presence and impact on the Spanish economy and environment.

title: DORITOS® SERVES UP "BIG DIP ENERGY" TO INTRODUCE DORITOS® DIPS
summary: Doritos has launched new DORITOS® Dips in Spicy Nacho and Cool Ranch Jalapeno flavors, dubbing the initiative "Big Dip Energy" to encourage consumers to elevate their meals with bold dips. Actress and singer Keke Palmer has partnered with Doritos to promote the new dips and inspire fans to find creative food pairings. Consumers can also enter a social media sweepstakes for a chance to win a kit featuring the new dips and Doritos-themed items.

title: Reporter’s Notebook: Beer Insights Seminar; Big Beer Execs Optimistic About Beer
summary: Executives from Anheuser-Busch InBev, Molson Coors Beverage Company, Constellation Brands, and Boston Beer Company shared insights at the Beer Marketer's Insights' Beer Insights Seminar, expressing optimism about core beer brands and discussing innovation strategies. Molson Coors highlighted the success of its revitalization plan, A-B focused on Nütrl Vodka Seltzer and Kona Big Wave for 2023 innovation, and Constellation Brands emphasized the strength of its core brands like Modelo and Corona. Boston Beer's Jim Koch addressed the controversial Blue Cloud Distribution partnership for Hard MTN Dew.

title: Is it Soccer or Football? To Find Out, Frito-Lay Asks David Beckham and Peyton Manning to Settle the Score
summary: Frito-Lay has launched a FIFA World Cup™ campaign called "Soccer or Football," featuring David Beckham and Peyton Manning, directed by Michael Bay, along with other soccer legends. The campaign aims to settle the age-old debate while promoting Frito-Lay snacks and includes a "Snack Cards" giveaway during select games. Fans can also find limited-edition, FIFA World Cup™-inspired Lay's flavors and participate in online challenges.

title: COP27 Sponsor The Coca-Cola Company named worst plastic polluter for five years in a row according to 2022 Brand Audit
summary: The Coca-Cola Company, PepsiCo, and Nestlé have been identified as the world's top plastic polluters for the fifth consecutive year, according to the 2022 Brand Audit by Break Free From Plastic. This report highlights the ineffectiveness of corporate voluntary commitments in reducing environmental impact, with plastic packaging use actually increasing for many companies. Activists are advocating for a legally-binding Global Plastics Treaty to enforce reductions in plastic production and promote reuse-based alternatives, especially as Coca-Cola sponsors COP27 despite its significant plastic footprint.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper CEO pushed out after 3 months over personal conduct ‘violations’
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper CEO Ozan Dokmecioglu resigned after less than four months in the role due to unspecified violations of the company's Code of Conduct related to personal behavior, not strategy or financial reporting. Former CEO Bob Gamgort will return to the top position. The company emphasized its commitment to ethics and integrity for all employees.

title: PepsiCo Reveals Company's Continued Progress Through the Voices of Associates in Latest DE&I Report
summary: PepsiCo published its latest Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DE&I) Report, highlighting progress in gender parity, pay equity, and diverse workforce representation. The report introduces an audio component for accessibility and details advancements across three strategic pillars: fostering an inclusive environment for employees, empowering business partners, and supporting communities worldwide. PepsiCo remains committed to its DE&I agenda, leveraging insights to meet workforce needs and drive positive change.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper invests $50M in Athletic Brewing
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper has invested $50 million in Athletic Brewing, a nonalcoholic craft beer maker, acquiring a minority stake and a board seat. This investment is part of Athletic Brewing's $75 million fundraising round and reflects Keurig Dr Pepper's strategy to expand into the rapidly growing nonalcoholic beverage category. The move contrasts with competitors who are entering the ready-to-drink alcoholic beverage market.

title: PepsiCo breaks ground on Georgia plant expansion
summary: PepsiCo Beverages North America (PBNA) has broken ground on a $260 million expansion of its manufacturing facility in Tucker, Ga. The project will expand the facility by over 260,000 square feet, increasing production five-fold by 2025 and creating at least 136 new full-time jobs. This investment is part of PepsiCo's $468 million capital commitment to Georgia over the past two years.

title: Eastman to provide PepsiCo with recycled PET
summary: Eastman has secured an offtake agreement with PepsiCo to supply processed PET from its third planned chemical recycling facility in the U.S. This facility, expected to be operational by the end of 2026, will have an input capacity of 160,000 tonnes/year of hard-to-recycle PET waste. The agreement is a significant step for Eastman's circular economy initiatives, with other similar facilities in Tennessee and France also underway.

title: United Rentals names Ted Grace as permanent CFO
summary: United Rentals has appointed Ted Grace as its permanent Chief Financial Officer. The equipment rental company has a significant global presence, with 22,100 employees and numerous rental locations across North America, Europe, Australia, and New Zealand.

title: Coke Is a Sponsor of the Climate Summit in Egypt. Some Activists Aren’t Happy. (Published 2022)
summary: Coca-Cola's sponsorship of the COP27 climate summit in Egypt has drawn strong criticism from climate activists, who point to the company's increasing plastic production as detailed in a recent report. Activists argue that Coca-Cola, named the world's leading plastic polluter in 2021, is greenwashing its image while its plastic use, largely derived from fossil fuels, continues to rise. Despite Coca-Cola's claims of environmental commitments, a report from the Ellen MacArthur Foundation indicates that the company will likely miss its target for recyclable or compostable packaging by 2025.

title: PepsiCo Appoints C.D. Glin As President of The PepsiCo Foundation
summary: PepsiCo announced the appointment of C.D. Glin as President of The PepsiCo Foundation, where he will continue to serve as Global Head of Philanthropy for PepsiCo. In this elevated role, Glin will oversee the Foundation's strategic direction फोकस on Food Security, Safe Water Access, and Economic Opportunity, building on his previous work with initiatives like the Black Restaurant Accelerator and She Feeds the World. His leadership aims to ensure lasting community impact through PepsiCo's philanthropic efforts.

title: Frito-Lay® Introduces Minis: New Bite-Sized Versions of Iconic Doritos®, Cheetos® and SunChips® Flavors
summary: Frito-Lay has launched Frito-Lay Minis, a new product line featuring bite-sized versions of popular snacks like Doritos, Cheetos, and SunChips. Packaged in convenient, easy-to-pour canisters, these new snacks are designed for on-the-go consumption and sharing, offering more variety in the snack aisle. Frito-Lay Minis are now available nationwide for $2.79, including flavors such as Doritos Nacho Cheese, Cheetos Cheddar, and SunChips Harvest Cheddar.

title: Eastman inks deal to supply PepsiCo with chemically recycled PET
summary: Eastman Chemical Co. has secured a definitive agreement to supply PepsiCo Inc. with chemically recycled PET from its planned third molecular recycling facility. This deal highlights Eastman's leadership in the circular economy, with their first chemical recycling plant opening in early 2023 and a second in France by 2025. The location of the third plant, which will supply PepsiCo, is still unannounced but discussions with Texas City officials for tax breaks have occurred.

title: Flows Into Consumer Staples ETFs Rebound on Economic Uncertainty
summary: Investors are increasingly moving back into consumer staples ETFs, a defensive strategy during economic uncertainty. The Invesco S&P 500® Equal Weight Consumer Staples ETF (RHS) has seen significant net inflows, indicating a preference for equal-weighted approaches to mitigate company-specific risks that are common in market-cap weighted funds dominated by a few large companies. This shift reflects advisors' search for downside protection while still participating in market upside in the current economic climate.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper concludes search for CFO
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. (KDP) has appointed Sudhanshu Priyadarshi as its new Chief Financial Officer, effective Nov. 14. Mr. Priyadarshi brings over 20 years of leadership experience in the food and beverage industry, previously serving as CFO for Vista Outdoor Inc. and holding key finance roles at Walmart US and PepsiCo.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper appoints chief financial officer
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. announced the appointment of Sudhanshu Priyadarshi as its new chief financial officer, effective November 14, 2022. Priyadarshi brings over 20 years of leadership experience in various industries, including significant tenures at PepsiCo and Walmart. He will report to CEO Ozan Dokmecioglu and lead the company's Finance and Information Technology organizations.

title: Coca-Cola lifts forecasts as demand keeps pace with pricier sodas
authors: Uday Sampath Kumar and Granth Vanaik
summary: Coca-Cola Co (KO.N) raised its annual forecasts after strong Q3 results, mirroring rival PepsiCo, as multiple price increases for its sodas did not deter consumer demand. Despite concerns about inflation's impact on consumer spending in some regions, the company plans to introduce smaller capacity bottles to stabilize prices, and beat analyst expectations for both revenue and profit.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper names CFO
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. has appointed Sudhanshu Priyadarshi as its new Chief Financial Officer, effective November 14, 2022. Priyadarshi brings over 20 years of experience from various industries, including leadership roles at PepsiCo Inc. and Walmart, and most recently served as CFO at Vista Outdoor Inc. He will report directly to CEO Ozan Dokmecioglu.

title: GXO Logistics To Cease Operations At 2 Dallas-Area Warehouses, Lay Off Hundreds Of Workers
summary: GXO Logistics is laying off over 250 workers and closing two Dallas-area warehouses due to PepsiCo Inc. ending its contract. While most affected employees will be offered jobs with PepsiCo's new contractor, Ryder, the remaining GXO workers will transfer to other facilities in the Dallas area. This scaling back of Dallas operations occurs as GXO plans a major global hiring initiative for the holiday season.

title: PepsiCo Announces Second Round of Projects Funded by Its Global Agriculture Accelerator, The Positive Agriculture Outcomes Fund
summary: PepsiCo has announced the second round of projects to be funded by its global agriculture accelerator, The Positive Agriculture Outcomes Fund. This initiative supports ventures aimed at advancing sustainable farming practices and achieving PepsiCo's Positive Agriculture goals. The selection of these new projects reinforces PepsiCo's commitment to transforming agricultural supply chains and fostering innovation in sustainable food systems.

title: Tesla Sales Rise, but Revenue Still Lower Than Expected
summary: Tesla Inc. reported third-quarter revenue of $21.5 billion, falling short of analysts' estimates despite a 56% rise in sales. The company's shares declined as CEO Elon Musk acknowledged economic headwinds impacting demand and delivery challenges, though he remained confident about Q4 performance and future growth targets. Tesla is also pursuing a share buyback and building a lithium refinery to secure its supply chain.

title: Consumer Giants Keep Raising Prices as Profits Come Under Pressure (Published 2022)
summary: Nestlé and Procter & Gamble continued to raise prices last quarter, generating higher sales despite lower sales volumes as consumers face inflation. Both companies expect price increases to continue to offset rising costs and restore profit margins. This trend highlights how consumer giants are navigating inflation, impacting shoppers and posing a challenge for central banks.

title: CHEETOS® MAKES MISCHIEF IN THE METAVERSE WITH THE LAUNCH OF HALLOWEEN-THEMED CHESTERVILLE
summary: Cheetos is launching Chesterville, a new Halloween-themed virtual reality experience within Meta Horizon Worlds, marking its first venture into the metaverse. In Chesterville, fans can engage in mischievous games and vote to bring back a favorite, discontinued Cheetos flavor for a limited time in the real world. This initiative aims to broaden Cheetos' engagement with consumers by offering an interactive and innovative brand experience.

title: Frito-Lay salty snacks enjoy double-digit gains in Q3
summary: Frito-Lay North America, a division of PepsiCo, Inc., reported a strong third quarter in 2022, driven by double-digit revenue growth in its salty snacks segment. The company saw operating profit increase by 17% to $1.59 billion and net revenue climb 20% to $5.56 billion. This growth was attributed to diversified portfolio, strong marketplace execution, enhanced revenue management, and consumer-centric innovation, despite ongoing supply chain complexities.

title: PepsiCo Boosted by Higher Prices
summary: PepsiCo reported stronger-than-expected third-quarter sales, prompting the company to raise its full-year revenue and earnings forecast. While sales volumes were down slightly, a significant 17% surge in pricing drove the positive results, with higher prices not deterring customers. Despite increased costs and marketing spend, PepsiCo's net income rose 21% to $2.7 billion, exceeding Wall Street's forecasts.

title: PEP Earnings: Key quarterly highlights from PepsiCo’s Q3 2022 financial results
summary: PepsiCo (NASDAQ: PEP) reported strong Q3 2022 earnings, with net revenue growing 8.8% year-over-year to $21.97 billion and organic revenue up 16%. Both net income ($2.7 billion) and core EPS ($1.97) surpassed expectations. The company also raised its full-year 2022 guidance for organic revenue growth to 12% and core constant currency EPS growth to 10%.

title: PepsiCo’s Higher Prices for Soda and Snacks Test Consumers’ Resolve
summary: PepsiCo has increased prices on its snacks and drinks by an average of 17% over the last year, leading to a rise in third-quarter sales. This move tests consumer willingness to continue purchasing at higher costs amidst record food inflation in the U.S. Companies are closely monitoring consumer reactions to these price hikes, as food inflation hit 13.5% in August compared to the previous year.

title: PepsiCo Defies Fears of Consumer Slowdown With Strong Earnings and Forecast (Published 2022)
summary: PepsiCo reported strong third-quarter earnings, exceeding analyst expectations and raising its full-year forecasts for revenue and profit. This performance indicates that consumers are continuing to spend on its products despite high inflation and rising prices. The company's ability to raise prices without significantly impacting sales volumes, even as the U.S. dollar's strength affected international earnings, offered a positive signal for the broader earnings season.

title: PepsiCo Lifts Outlook as Drink, Snack Sales Buck Inflation
summary: PepsiCo Inc. reported strong third-quarter results, beating profit estimates and raising its full-year forecast as price hikes boosted sales despite lower snack volumes. The company's strategy for battling inflation proved effective, with organic revenue growth of 16% driven by resilient demand for its diverse portfolio of beverages and snacks even as consumers face economic pressures. All divisions recorded solid revenue gains, and PepsiCo boosted its market share in key North American product categories.

title: Coca-Cola FEMSA recompra 299.8 millones de dólares en bonos
summary: Coca-Cola FEMSA conducted a public offer to repurchase $299.8 million of its outstanding senior bonds due in 2043 and 2030. HSBC and J.P. Morgan acted as dealer managers for the offer, which initially had a cap of $250 million but was increased due to high demand. The company was advised by Cleary Gottlieb Steen & Hamilton, while the banks received legal support from Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom and Galicia Abogados.

title: Pepsi first in line for Tesla semi truck deliveries starting in December
summary: Five years after its unveiling, the Tesla semi truck is finally set for delivery, with Pepsico Inc. being the first recipient in December. Pepsico has reserved 100 semi trucks and plans to have 15 on the road by year-end. This development follows Tesla's prioritization of other models due to supply shortages and is boosted by the Inflation Reduction Act's tax incentives for heavy-duty electric trucks.

title: Tesla Plans to Deliver Semis to Pepsi Five Years After Unveiling
summary: Tesla Inc. is set to deliver its first Semi trucks to PepsiCo Inc. on Dec. 1, five years after the electric big rigs were first unveiled by Elon Musk. PepsiCo confirmed it will take delivery of its first 15 Tesla Semis for its Frito-Lay plant in Modesto, Calif., and a beverage plant in Sacramento. This delivery follows production delays and comes after new federal tax credits for heavy-duty electric trucks.

title: Musk says Pepsi to receive Tesla's first Semi trucks in December
summary: Elon Musk announced that Tesla is starting production of its Semi electric trucks and PepsiCo Inc will receive the first deliveries on December 1st. The truck, which has a 500-mile range and is expected to cost $180,000, has seen its production timeline pushed back multiple times since its 2017 unveiling. PepsiCo had reserved 100 of these trucks to reduce fuel costs and fleet emissions.

title: PEP Stock: Is PepsiCo a safe investment in the bear market?
summary: PepsiCo (NASDAQ: PEP) is considered a safe investment due to its strong fundamentals, brand loyalty, and consistent financial performance, even amidst economic challenges. While its valuation appears high after recent gains, its attractiveness as a dividend stock and long-term investment remains, though short-term market volatility might be a concern. The company is set to release its Q3 2022 results on October 12, with analysts expecting continued growth in earnings and revenues.

title: Pepsi® Dig In Launches First-Ever Culinary Residency Program at MGM's Mandalay Bay and Luxor Featuring Exclusive Dishes from Top Black-Owned Restaurants Across the Country
summary: Pepsi Dig In has launched its first-ever Restaurant Royalty Residency program at MGM Resorts International's Mandalay Bay and Luxor in Las Vegas. This initiative will bring signature dishes from Black-owned restaurants across the United States to a wider audience, starting with Chef JJ Johnson of FIELDTRIP. The program aims to increase visibility and provide growth opportunities for Black restaurateurs, culminating in Pepsi Dig In Day on November 5th.

title: Constellation Brands Q2 Profit Tops Estimates; Beer Business Net Sales Up 15%
summary: Constellation Brands reported strong Q2 performance, with profit topping estimates and Beer Business net sales growing 15%. The company also increased its full-year net sales outlook for the Beer Business and declared a quarterly dividend. Additionally, Constellation Brands reached an agreement to divest a portion of its mainstream and premium wine portfolio.

title: Utz Brands taps Post Holdings’ Friedman as CEO; Lisette becomes executive chairman
summary: Utz Brands Inc. has announced a leadership transition, with Dylan Lissette moving from CEO to executive chairman of the board, effective December 15, 2022. Howard Friedman, previously COO of Post Holdings Inc., will assume the role of chief executive officer and join the board. Roger Deromedi, the current chairman, will become the lead independent director.

title: Pepsi partners with Chlöe Bailey to reimagine ‘Footloose,’ celebrates return of Soda Shop
summary: PepsiCo Inc. has announced the return of Pepsi-Cola Soda Shop, featuring new and returning limited-edition flavors. To celebrate, Pepsi teamed with Chlöe Bailey to reimagine "Footloose" with a new song and music video, and is launching a TikTok dance challenge for consumers to participate in. The limited-edition Soda Shop flavors are available nationwide.

title: 2022 Executive of the Year: John Fieldly, CEO of Celsius Holdings Inc.
summary: Beverage Industry has named John Fieldly, CEO of Celsius Holdings Inc., as its 2022 Executive of the Year for his leadership in transforming Celsius into a prominent lifestyle energy brand. Under Fieldly's guidance, the company has achieved significant financial growth and expanded its market presence, including a strategic distribution agreement and investment from PepsiCo. This success is attributed to Celsius's alignment with consumer demand for healthier, functional beverages and its effective marketing strategies.

title: Mondelez International Inc. Cl A stock falls Thursday, still outperforms market
summary: Mondelez International Inc. Cl A (MDLZ) stock fell 1.88% on Thursday to $56.67, despite a broader market decline with the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average also falling. The stock closed $12.80 below its 52-week high but underperformed some competitors like Nestle S.A. ADR and PepsiCo Inc. Its trading volume for the day exceeded its 50-day average.

title: Slideshow: New products from PepsiCo, NaFrosting and White Castle
summary: This article details new product introductions from PepsiCo, NaFrosting, and White Castle. White Castle is launching "Castle Bites," a bite-sized snack resembling its sliders, while NaFrosting introduces a plant-based coffee frosting. PepsiCo is debuting a s'mores-inspired collection of cola beverages with distinct marshmallow, graham cracker, and chocolate flavors.

title: 18-property industrial portfolio in the Midwest sells for $13M
summary: JLL Capital Markets announced the $13 million sale of an 18-property industrial portfolio spanning 105,500 square feet across four Midwest states. The portfolio, acquired by Essjay Investment Co and marketed on behalf of Ebert Construction, consists of build-to-suit facilities for Frito-Lay, a subsidiary of PepsiCo (NASDAQ:PEP). These strategically located properties support Frito-Lay's "Direct Store Delivery" system, serving core retailer locations in Minnesota, Iowa, Wisconsin, and North Dakota.

title: Exclusive: PepsiCo ends Pepsi, 7UP production in Russia months after promising halt over Ukraine
summary: PepsiCo has stopped producing Pepsi, 7UP, and Mountain Dew in Russia, nearly six months after initially announcing a suspension of sales and production following the invasion of Ukraine. This decision came after Reuters found these products with recent production dates still widely available in Russia. The action aligns with PepsiCo's March 2022 pledge, though the company continues to sell essential goods like milk and baby food in the country.

title: Kraft Heinz names new chief growth officer
summary: Kraft Heinz has appointed Diana Frost as its new Chief Growth Officer for the North America Zone. In this role, Frost will be responsible for the intersection of marketing and innovation, overseeing the company's in-house marketing agency, digital teams, and internal innovation efforts. She previously served as chief growth officer for Kraft Heinz Canada and head of North America disruption and chief marketing officer for Canada, and has been instrumental in the company's joint venture with NotCo.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper acquires equity stake in C4 Energy maker
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper is acquiring an approximately 30% ownership stake in Nutrabolt, the maker of C4 Energy, for $863 million. This investment also includes a long-term sales and distribution agreement to significantly expand C4 Energy's market presence. The move strengthens Keurig Dr Pepper's position in the rapidly growing performance energy drink market, making it Nutrabolt's largest investor behind its founder.

title: Starbucks Espresso drink recalled over metal fragments in product
summary: Pepsico Inc is recalling certain Starbucks Vanilla Espresso Triple Shot beverages in several states due to possible contamination with metal fragments. The recall, initiated on Aug. 15 and posted by the FDA on Sept. 8, advises consumers to return the product to the place of purchase as foreign objects can cause serious injury.

title: Coca-Cola CEO sees alcohol as fourth bucket
summary: Coca-Cola CEO James Robert B. Quincey outlined a "bucket" strategy for the company, positioning the core Coke brand as the primary gold medalist. He identified alcohol as the "fourth bucket" or "true experimentation bucket," with growing potential, noting success in partnerships for products like Topo Chico Ranch Water Hard Seltzer and Simply Spiked. Despite the growth in alcoholic offerings, Quincey emphasized that the Coke brand remains the main driver of company sales and revenue.

title: ‘Predictive-Maintenance’ Tech Is Taking Off as Manufacturers Seek More Efficiency
summary: Predictive-maintenance technology is gaining traction among manufacturers aiming for increased efficiency amid strained supply chains. Companies like Pepsi and Colgate are implementing sensor-based systems from startups like Augury to detect potential machinery problems before they cause disruptions. This approach has already shown benefits, such as reducing unexpected breakdowns and costs, as demonstrated by PepsiCo Labs’ experience with Frito-Lay plants.

title: Target CEO Cornell to stay three more years in bid for stability
summary: Target Corp. has waived its CEO retirement policy to allow Brian Cornell, 63, to continue leading the company for another three years. This decision aims to provide stability as Target navigates high inflation and overstocked stores. Investors reacted positively to the news, seeing it as beneficial during a challenging period for the retailer.

title: Starbucks taps PepsiCo veteran Laxman Narasimhan as CEO
summary: Starbucks Coffee Co. has appointed Laxman Narasimhan as its new CEO, effective October 1, 2022, succeeding interim CEO Howard Schultz. Narasimhan brings nearly 30 years of experience from global consumer-facing brands, including PepsiCo Inc., and will join the board of directors on April 1, 2023. During a transition period, he will immerse himself in the company's brand, culture, and "Reinvention" plan.

title: Starbucks Names Laxman Narasimhan as Next Chief Executive Officer
summary: Starbucks announced that Laxman Narasimhan will become its next chief executive officer and a member of its Board of Directors, effective April 1, 2023. Narasimhan, previously CEO of Reckitt, will join Starbucks on October 1, 2022, and work closely with interim CEO Howard Schultz during a transition period. Schultz will remain on the Board and serve as an advisor following the transition.

title: Brazil manufacturer acquires Mabel cookie business from PepsiCo
summary: Camil Alimentos, a Brazil-based cookie manufacturer, has acquired the Mabel cookie business from PepsiCo Inc. for an undisclosed sum. PepsiCo had originally acquired Mabel, which has five production facilities, in November 2011. This acquisition marks a significant move in the food manufacturing sector.

title: McDonald's Appoints Jon Banner as Executive Vice President and Global Chief Impact Officer
summary: McDonald's has appointed Jon Banner as Executive Vice President and Global Chief Impact Officer, reporting directly to CEO Chris Kempczinski. In this role, Banner will oversee Sustainability & ESG, Government Relations and Public Policy, Communications, International Corporate Relations, and Ronald McDonald House Charities. He brings extensive experience from PepsiCo and Disney/ABC, where he led communications and sustainability initiatives.

title: PepsiCo sells biscuit assets to Brazilian manufacturer Camil Alimentos
summary: PepsiCo has agreed to sell its biscuit assets in Brazil, including brands like Mabel and Doce, two factories, and 800 employees, to the Brazilian manufacturer Camil Alimentos. The transaction, valued at BRL152.8m (US$29.8m), is subject to regulatory approval and includes a ten-year licensing deal for the Toddy cookies brand. This acquisition is part of Camil's strategy to expand its portfolio and regional presence in Latin America, following several other acquisitions in 2021.

title: Conagra Brands names Tracy Schaefer SVP/CIO
summary: Conagra Brands Inc. has appointed Tracy Schaefer as Senior Vice President and Chief Information Officer, effective August 22, 2022. Schaefer has been with Conagra Brands since 2001 and has held various leadership roles in finance, IT, and global business services. CFO Dave Marberger highlighted her strong track record, deep business understanding, and strategic mindset as critical assets for the company's strategic plans.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper Eyes Fitness-Focused Drink Maker for $3B
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper is reportedly in early-stage talks to acquire Vital Pharmaceuticals Inc., the maker of Bang Energy drinks, in a deal estimated to be over $3 billion. This potential acquisition follows Bang Energy's recent settlement of a legal dispute with PepsiCo and comes amid significant deal activity in the beverage market. Both companies are major players, with Keurig Dr Pepper having a market capitalization of $57 billion and Bang Energy generating $1.4 billion in sales in 2021.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper denies reported talks to buy Bang Energy drink owner
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper denied reports that it is in talks to acquire Bang Energy drink owner, though it confirmed that M&A and brand partnerships are key to its growth strategy. The negotiations, reported by Bloomberg, suggested a potential valuation of over $2 billion for Bang. An acquisition would significantly bolster Keurig Dr Pepper's presence in the growing energy drink market, following Bang's recent exit from a distribution deal with PepsiCo.

title: Utz expands into Publix markets
summary: Utz Brands, Inc. reported a net income of $2.5 million in the second quarter, attributing results to higher pricing and market share gains in salty snacks. The company announced a significant expansion into nearly 1,300 Publix stores and plans to ramp up production at its Kings Mountain facility to meet demand for brands like Zapp’s kettle chips. Utz achieved double-digit retail sales growth across all geographies and categories representing 80% of its sales.

title: Monster Beverage Corp. stock outperforms competitors despite losses on the day
summary: Monster Beverage Corp. (MNST) stock declined by 0.58% on Thursday, closing at $89.30, yet still outperformed competitors Coca-Cola Co. and PepsiCo Inc. despite the market's mixed trading session. The stock closed $10.51 short of its 52-week high, with trading volume below its 50-day average. This performance highlights Monster Beverage's relative strength against its peers in a challenging market.

title: Coke bottles taste of dreams for latest experimental flavor
summary: Coca-Cola has launched "Dreamworld," the fourth and final product from its Creations platform for 2022, aiming to capture the taste of dreams and target Gen Z consumers. The launch includes digital and experiential activations like an AR music experience with Tomorrowland and a digital fashion collection for the metaverse. This strategy follows previous Creations flavors, which have contributed to Coca-Cola's reported 12% year-on-year growth in net revenue to $11.3 billion.

title: Kellogg, General Mills and Frito-Lay co-manufacturer and Michigan bakery giant changes ownership
summary: Roskam Baking Co., a large Michigan-based bakery and co-manufacturer for major brands like Kellogg, General Mills, and Frito-Lay, has been acquired by Entrepreneurial Equity Partners (e2p). The acquisition merges Roskam with e2p's existing portfolio company Organic Milling, though the Roskam Baking name and management team will be retained. e2p plans to drive growth through identified initiatives and strategic acquisitions, building on Roskam's nearly century-long legacy in the food manufacturing industry.

title: PepsiCo invests in owner of Romania’s Aqua Carpatica
summary: PepsiCo has acquired a 20% stake in Carpathian Springs, the owner of Romanian bottled-water company Aqua Carpatica. The deal grants PepsiCo distribution rights for Aqua Carpatica products in Romania and Poland, with opportunities to expand into other markets, including the United States. This investment follows PepsiCo's recent announcement of an 8.5% stake in US energy-drinks firm Celsius Holdings.

title: PepsiCo Makes $550M Investment in Celsius Drinks
summary: PepsiCo Inc. has announced a $550 million investment in Celsius Holdings Inc., makers of the Celsius fitness energy drink, in exchange for convertible preferred stock representing an estimated 8.5% ownership. This investment is part of a long-term strategic distribution agreement that transitions Celsius' U.S. distribution to PepsiCo's network and establishes PepsiCo as Celsius' preferred global distribution partner. The partnership aims to accelerate growth and expand Celsius' shelf space, particularly in the U.S. convenience and gas channels.

title: Celsius Holdings, PepsiCo announce distribution agreement
summary: Celsius Holdings and PepsiCo have announced a long-term strategic distribution agreement, transitioning Celsius' current U.S. distribution to PepsiCo's capabilities, effective August 1. As part of the deal, PepsiCo will invest $550 million in Celsius for convertible preferred stock, acquiring an estimated 8.5% ownership. This partnership aims to expand Celsius' market presence across retail and foodservice channels globally, leveraging PepsiCo's distribution network and accelerating growth for both companies.

title: Pepsi Grows Energy Segment With Celsius Pact
summary: PepsiCo Inc. and Celsius Holdings Inc. have finalized a long-term strategic distribution agreement, making PepsiCo Celsius' preferred global distribution partner. As part of the pact, PepsiCo will invest $550 million in Celsius for a convertible preferred stock, securing an estimated 8.5% ownership and a seat on Celsius' board. This partnership aims to expand Celsius' market presence, particularly in the U.S. convenience and gas channel, and enhance growth and efficiency for both companies.

title: PepsiCo to invest $550M in Boca Raton fitness drink company Celsius
summary: PepsiCo is set to invest $550 million for an 8.5% stake in Boca Raton-based fitness drink company Celsius Holdings. This investment also establishes PepsiCo as Celsius' preferred distribution partner through a long-term agreement.

title: PepsiCo to Pay $550 Million for 8.5% Stake in Fitness-Drink Maker Celsius
summary: PepsiCo Inc. is investing $550 million for an 8.5% stake in fitness-energy drink maker Celsius Holdings Inc. This investment is part of a long-term strategic distribution agreement, making PepsiCo the preferred global distribution partner for Celsius. Additionally, PepsiCo will nominate a director to Celsius's board.

title: PepsiCo takes $550 million stake in energy drink maker Celsius
summary: PepsiCo has invested $550 million in Celsius Holdings, an energy drink maker, as part of a long-term distribution agreement. This deal gives PepsiCo a minority stake of roughly 8.5% and a board seat, strengthening its position in the rapidly growing energy drink market. The investment comes after Celsius's significant revenue growth and following Pepsi's previous ventures in the energy drink sector.

title: Pilgrim’s sees US investments as key to growth
summary: Pilgrim's Pride Corp. announced new investments in the US market as part of its second-quarter earnings report, including an Athens, Ga., facility expansion, automation improvements, a protein conversion plant, and a prepared foods facility. These investments aim to enhance capacity, improve operating margins, create shareholder value, and provide team member opportunities, according to CEO Fabio Sandri. The company saw significant growth in net sales and net income for the quarter, with strong performance in the US market.

title: Slideshow: Unboxing new cereal innovation
summary: Despite a trend where private brand cereal shows growth, major manufacturers like PepsiCo's Quaker Oats Co., General Mills, and Kellogg Co. are aggressively innovating and releasing new products. Companies are focusing on "better-for-you" alternatives like Crispy Fantasy's chocolate cereal and unique collaborations, such as Quaker with DC Comics and Kellogg's with Nickelodeon, to appeal to both children and adults. This push for innovation aims to refresh the cereal category and capture broader consumer interest.

title: Sally Beauty CEO joins the board of major food manufacturer
summary: Denise Paulonis, the CEO of Sally Beauty, has been appointed to the board of directors of Conagra. This marks a return to the food industry for Paulonis, who previously held leadership roles at PepsiCo and Sprouts Farmers Market. Her appointment brings a wealth of experience from both retail and food sectors to Conagra's board.

title: Coca-Cola raises revenue forecast as soda demand defies price hikes
summary: Coca-Cola Co raised its full-year revenue forecast due to strong demand for its sugary sodas, despite increased prices intended to offset higher costs. Global sales volumes grew 8% in the second quarter, and the company plans further price hikes in response to rising costs. Net revenue for the quarter exceeded analyst expectations, although operating margins were impacted by higher expenses.

title: Second Circuit Says RISE Mark is on Weak End of Suggestive Spectrum, Reversing Preliminary Injunction Against Pepsi
summary: The Second Circuit Court of Appeals reversed a preliminary injunction against Pepsi, ruling that the "RISE" mark, used by Rise Brewing, is on the weak end of the suggestive spectrum. The court determined that the district court improperly assessed likelihood of confusion factors, particularly the strength of the mark, and found that the logical association between "RISE" and coffee, along with widespread use of similar terms, narrowed its scope of protection. Although acknowledging potential reverse confusion in cases involving larger companies like Pepsi, the court concluded that Rise Brewing had not demonstrated sufficient acquired strength to counteract the mark's inherent weakness.

title: Tamarron Survey: A-B, Boston Beer, Constellation Receive High Marks; Distributors Want Brewers to Improve National Accounts Strategy
summary: A Tamarron Consulting survey revealed that Anheuser-Busch InBev, Boston Beer Company, and Constellation Brands Beer Division received high marks from distributors for relationships and partnerships. Distributors, however, expressed a strong desire for brewers to improve their national accounts strategy, particularly in on-premise and off-premise management and staff training. The survey also highlighted a significant distributor interest in spirits-based ready-to-drink (RTD) offerings.

title: PEPSICO ISSUES NEW $1.25 BILLION 10-YEAR GREEN BOND AS COMPANY ACCELERATES PEP+ TRANSFORMATION
summary: PepsiCo has issued a new $1.25 billion 10-year Green Bond to accelerate its pep+ (PepsiCo Positive) agenda, focusing on sustainable agriculture, decarbonization, circular economy initiatives, and water stewardship. This marks PepsiCo's second Green Bond, with proceeds allocated to Eligible Green Projects that align with UN Sustainable Development Goals. The company plans to publish annual updates on the allocation of these proceeds.

title: PepsiCo to build massive manufacturing plant
summary: PepsiCo Beverages North America (PBNA) is building a 1.2 million-square-foot manufacturing facility in Denver, Colorado, which will be its largest and most sustainable plant in the US. The facility, set to open in 2023, will produce a variety of PepsiCo products and create nearly 250 new jobs, aiming for 100% renewable electricity and reduced virgin plastic use. PepsiCo views this as a model for its future supply chain and a deeper dedication to Colorado.

title: The Path to a Regenerative Farming Revolution
summary: The article discusses the growing movement towards regenerative farming, highlighting how Applegate's "Do Good Dog" is making regeneratively raised meat accessible to the mainstream consumer. It explores the benefits of regenerative agriculture for soil health, biodiversity, and climate change, and addresses challenges such as consumer awareness and the need for robust certification systems.

title: Pepsi Buys 152 Acres in Denver to Develop 1.2 MSF Manufacturing Plant
summary: PepsiCo Beverages North America has acquired 152 acres in Denver to build its largest manufacturing facility in the country, a 1.2 million-square-foot plant expected to open in 2023. This new facility will triple the size of Pepsi's existing Denver operation and is designed to be highly sustainable, aiming for 100 percent renewable electricity and reduced virgin plastic use. The project is supported by various public and private entities and is expected to create 250 new jobs in addition to relocating 250 existing employees.

title: Shoppers are still willing to pay more for drinks and snacks, Pepsi says. (Published 2022)
summary: PepsiCo reported strong second-quarter earnings, raising its revenue forecast for the year, as consumers continue to absorb higher prices for its products.
