Despite this, the company maintained its profit forecast due to uncertainties about consumer elasticity, suggesting future caution if prices continue to rise. This performance offers a cautiously optimistic signal for the broader economy amidst inflation and recession concerns.

title: PepsiCo profit feels sting of impairment charge
summary: PepsiCo's second-quarter earnings were negatively impacted by a $1.4 billion pre-tax impairment charge related to the war in Ukraine, leading to a 39% decrease in net income year-over-year. Despite this, the company saw strong business momentum, with net revenues increasing to $20.23 billion and executives raising their full-year organic revenue growth forecast to 10%. Segments like Frito-Lay North America and Quaker Foods North America reported increased operating profit and net revenue, while Europe experienced an operating loss.

title: PepsiCo Boosts Outlook After Increasing Prices
summary: PepsiCo Inc. has successfully navigated inflationary pressures by increasing prices for its products, leading to a boosted profit outlook for the year. The company reported a 12% average price increase in the second quarter, which helped revenue grow despite only a slight increase in sales volumes. This performance offers insights into consumer behavior amidst rising inflation, as PepsiCo expects 10% revenue growth for the year.

title: Black Swan Data Closes $18.5 Million in Funding
summary: Black Swan Data, a London-based SaaS company specializing in predicting consumer behavior using social data, secured an $18.5 million growth investment. The funding round was led by Oxx, with participation from existing investors AlbionVC, Blackstone, Mitsui, and Lloyds. This investment will support the development of advanced features for its Trendscope platform and aid in its expansion into the US market.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper achieves 11% PCR use
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper increased its post-consumer resin (PCR) use in plastic packaging to 11% in 2021, up from 2% the previous year, primarily by utilizing 100% recycled PET bottles for several brands. This progress keeps the company on track for its goal of 25% PCR use by 2025 and eliminated 57 million pounds of virgin plastic last year. The shift also contributed to a 9% reduction in Scope 1 and 2 greenhouse gas emissions compared to its 2018 baseline.

title: PepsiCo's Supplier Diversity Program Celebrates 40th Anniversary and Commits to Spending More than $400 Million Annually with Black and Hispanic-owned Suppliers
summary: PepsiCo celebrates the 40th anniversary of its Supplier Diversity Program, having spent nearly $30 billion with diverse suppliers over this period and committing to spend over $400 million annually with Black and Hispanic-owned suppliers. The company aims to expand its diverse supplier base and remove barriers to economic advancement through mentorship, partnerships, and support for the certification process. This initiative is part of PepsiCo's broader Racial Equality Journey, focusing on increasing representation and economic empowerment for Black and Hispanic communities.

title: Coca-Cola turns up the heat on frozen as it searches for growth
summary: Coca-Cola is increasingly focusing on its frozen beverage offerings as a key growth area, particularly to attract younger consumers (millennials and Gen Z) to its brand portfolio. The company sees frozen drinks as a way to engage new generations before they transition to adult-targeted products like Coke Zero Sugar, as well as to expand consumption occasions and experiment with new flavors and textures. Frozen products also represent a highly profitable category for convenience stores, which serve as a significant testing ground for these innovations.

title: Tractor Supply Company Appoints Andre Hawaux to its Board of Directors
summary: Tractor Supply Company announced the appointment of Andre Hawaux to its Board of Directors and Audit Committee, effective July 1, 2022. Mr. Hawaux brings 37 years of experience in consumer packaged goods and retail, including leadership roles at Dick’s Sporting Goods, ConAgra Foods, and PepsiCo. His expertise in finance and operations is expected to provide invaluable insights for Tractor Supply's growth and shareholder value.

title: Dr Pepper Maker Opens 300,000 sq ft Newbridge Manufacturing Plant
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) Ireland has opened a 300,000 sq ft international operations hub in Newbridge, Co Kildare, marking its second manufacturing plant for beverage concentrate and its first outside North America. The facility plans to add 20 jobs by year-end, bringing the total to 100, and will serve as a 'centre of excellence' for concentrate production and global sourcing. This expansion underscores Ireland's reputation as a manufacturing and supply chain hub, as acknowledged by IDA Ireland CEO Martin Shanahan.

title: New leadership within Frito-Lay North America
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. announced several leadership changes within its North American divisions, effective July 1. These changes include new presidents for PepsiCo Foods Canada and Gatorade Performance Portfolio, as well as new chief customer and chief marketing officers at Frito-Lay North America. Notable appointments include Rachel Ferdinando as president of PFC, Cara Keating as chief customer officer for FLNA, Mike Del Pozzo as president and general manager of GPP, and Brett O’Brien as CMO of Frito-Lay US.

title: Reprint: PepsiCo to add 6% to 8% non-matching contribution for some 401(k) participants
summary: PepsiCo announced it will add a non-matching contribution of 6% to 8% for some participants in its 401(k) plans. This move aims to enhance retirement benefits for a segment of its workforce.

title: PepsiCo's new $8.5M warehouse adds to logistics growth northeast of Atlanta
summary: PepsiCo has opened a new $8.5 million distribution facility in Jackson County, northeast of Atlanta, contributing to the region's booming industrial growth. This new warehouse highlights the increasing logistics development along the northern Interstate 85 corridor.

title: PepsiCo commits to new sustainable packaging goal
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. has announced a new goal to increase the percentage of its beverages sold through reusable models from 10% to 20% by 2030, reinforcing its prior commitment to reduce single-use virgin plastic. This initiative, part of its pep+ sustainability program, will be supported by a four-pronged approach including expanding its SodaStream business, increasing refillable bottle offerings, investing in concentrates, and developing fountain drink options. The company's efforts align with a broader industry trend toward sustainable packaging, moving towards a circular economy model.

title: How PepsiCo's Derek Lewis will maximize the beverage giant's impact through equity and diversity efforts
summary: Derek Lewis, president of multicultural business and equity development at PepsiCo, is tasked with leading the company's next phase in its "racial equality journey." This initiative aims to maximize PepsiCo's impact through focused equity and diversity efforts. The article highlights an Orlando executive's role in advancing PepsiCo's commitment to racial equality.

title: 'Mtn Dew Rise' doesn't flout coffee trademark, Pepsi tells appeals court
summary: A U.S. appeals court judge appeared sympathetic to PepsiCo's argument against an injunction that halted its use of "Mtn Dew Rise" in a trademark dispute with Rise Brewing. The judge questioned the strength of Rise Brewing's trademark for its coffee drinks, suggesting it was a "weak mark" because the term "Rise" is generic. PepsiCo argued that their products are "startlingly different" and that Rise Brewing is attempting to monopolize a common word.

title: The Future Of Hershey May Be Snack Foods, Not Chocolate
summary: Hershey, traditionally known for its chocolate, is increasingly focusing on savory snack foods. The company has acquired several snack brands like SkinnyPop, Pirate's Booty, and Dot's Homestyle Pretzels to become a "snacking powerhouse." This strategic shift is driven by the growing profitability of the salty snack market and aims to capture more consumer snacking occasions.

title: Fort Wayne Council Approves Land Purchase of Pepsi Property
summary: The Fort Wayne City Council has approved the purchase of a 6.4-acre riverfront property from PepsiCo Inc. for $4.5 million to facilitate downtown redevelopment. PepsiCo, in turn, plans to invest $19 million in building a new distribution facility near the Fort Wayne International Airport, supported by a tax incentive from the city. This move aims to retain Pepsi's presence in Fort Wayne while revitalizing the riverfront area.

title: Union County to Host Pepsi Job Fair, May 24
summary: Union County, N.J., is hosting a PepsiCo job fair on May 24 at the Warinanco Sports Center in Warinanco Park. PepsiCo will be hiring for CDL Driver, Warehouse Person, Merchandiser, and Fleet Mechanic positions, offering competitive pay and benefits. Job seekers must pre-register online, and an on-the-spot interview is guaranteed for those who complete the pre-registration form and PepsiCo job applications.

title: PepsiCo Announces Timing and Availability of Second Quarter 2022 Financial Results
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. announced the timing and availability of its second-quarter 2022 financial results. The results will be released on Tuesday, July 12, 2022, with a press release and 10-Q statement, prepared management remarks, and a live Q&A session for analysts.

title: Clorox Announces Appointment of Julia Denman and Stephanie Plaines to its Board of Directors
summary: The Clorox Company announced the appointment of Julia Denman and Stephanie Plaines to its board of directors, expanding the board to 13 members. Both Denman and Plaines bring extensive financial expertise and leadership experience from various sectors, enriching the board's diversity and qualifications. They are expected to serve on the audit committee, contributing to Clorox's strategic goals and stakeholder value.

title: University of Arkansas nears deal for return of Coca-Cola
summary: The University of Arkansas is finalizing a 10-year deal to bring Coca-Cola back as its exclusive beverage provider, replacing PepsiCo whose $19 million contract expires on June 30. This new agreement, effective July 1, will offer diverse Coca-Cola products on campus and at events, alongside providing internship opportunities and scholarship funding for students. The total financial value of the new contract will be disclosed after final negotiations are complete.

title: Kronos Hack Leaves PepsiCo Vulnerable to Wage and Hour Claims
summary: A 2021 Kronos hack has led to a lawsuit against PepsiCo by two employees, alleging the company failed to accurately track and pay overtime wages. The plaintiffs claim PepsiCo's actions violated the Fair Labor Standards Act and California wage laws, seeking class certification and various damages. The lawsuit highlights the need for companies to have robust systems for wage and hour tracking, especially in the wake of cyber incidents affecting HR technology providers.

title: Beyond Meat’s jerky collaboration with PepsiCo helped sales but hurt margins
summary: Beyond Meat's collaboration with PepsiCo Inc. on Beyond Meat Jerky boosted the company's revenue, but the production of the jerky product significantly hurt profit margins. The launch of Beyond Meat Jerky reduced gross margin by approximately 940 basis points compared to the previous year. This indicates a trade-off between increased sales volume and profitability for the plant-based meat company.

title: Circle K & Mountain Dew Partner on Exclusive Flavor
summary: Circle K and Mountain Dew have partnered to release an exclusive new beverage called Mtn Dew Purple Thunder, which combines blackberry and plum flavors. This drink is available only at Circle K locations in 20-ounce bottles and as a fountain drink, marking another collaboration between Circle K and PepsiCo following the 2021 launch of Mtn Dew Major Melon. The article also highlights PepsiCo's financial performance in 2021 and Circle K parent company Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc.'s extensive operations.

title: Kraft Heinz wants to solve its supply chain problems — in the metaverse
summary: Kraft Heinz is leveraging the metaverse and a partnership with Microsoft to enhance its supply chain efficiency. By creating "digital twins" of its facilities, the company aims to resolve logistical issues virtually, speed up operations, and ensure products like Lunchables and Velveeta reach shelves faster. This technological investment seeks to improve dependability and responsiveness to shifting consumer demands.

title: Industrial Sugar Market to Reach USD 46.56 Billion by 2029
summary: The global industrial sugar market is projected to reach USD 46.56 billion by 2029, growing at a CAGR of 2.72% from USD 38.58 billion in 2022. The market, which was valued at USD 37.62 billion in 2021, saw a decline in demand during the COVID-19 pandemic. Key drivers include increasing utilization in processed foods and beverages, and strong demand for sugar confectioneries, particularly in the Asia Pacific region.

title: How PepsiCo used a Lays potato chip plant to help heat neighboring homes
summary: PepsiCo has developed an innovative system called Lay’s Factory Home Heating, which won a Fast Company World Changing Ideas Award. This project utilizes vapor from cooking potatoes at a Lay's plant in Veurne, Belgium, to heat neighboring homes, replacing natural gas. The initiative helps PepsiCo reduce carbon emissions and provides an environmentally friendly heating solution for up to 500 households.

title: PEP Earnings: Key quarterly highlights from PepsiCo’s Q1 2022 financial results
summary: PepsiCo (NASDAQ: PEP) reported strong first-quarter 2022 earnings, with net revenues growing 9.3% to $16.2 billion and organic revenue up 13.7%. Net income attributable to PepsiCo more than doubled to $4.2 billion, or $3.06 per share, compared to the prior-year period. The company exceeded both top and bottom-line estimates and provided an optimistic outlook for fiscal year 2022, projecting 8% organic revenue growth and a 6% increase in core EPS to $6.63.

title: PepsiCo says revenues jumped after it raised prices. (Published 2022)
summary: PepsiCo reported strong first-quarter revenues primarily driven by price increases across its snack and beverage brands, despite modest volume growth. The company saw revenues rise 9.3 percent to $16.2 billion, with its Frito-Lay North American division experiencing a 12 percent pricing soar. Executives acknowledged consumers facing inflation and aim to monitor behavior closely for future pricing decisions while emphasizing the company's historical resilience during inflationary periods.

title: Constellation Brands Stock is Launching Towards New Highs
summary: Constellation Brands (NYSE: STZ) stock is rebounding towards all-time highs driven by strong growth in its high-end beer and wine segments, including brands like Corona and Modelo. The company beat Q4 2022 earnings estimates and raised its dividend, with expectations for continued growth in fiscal 2023 and strategic investments in cannabis. Prudent investors are advised to watch for opportunistic pullbacks in the stock, given its recession-resistant segment and positive financial outlook.

title: The Untold Truth Of Yum Brands
summary: Yum Brands, parent company of KFC, Pizza Hut, and Taco Bell, originated from PepsiCo's restaurant division before becoming an independent entity in 1997. The company has a history of acquiring and divesting various restaurant chains, expanding significantly in China, and has faced past controversies regarding food safety. Despite challenges, Yum Brands is a major global restaurant company, known for its philanthropic efforts and commitment to sustainability.

title: Frito-Lay adding electric fleet in Texas
summary: Frito-Lay North America, a division of PepsiCo, Inc., is introducing a new electric fleet of 40 Ford eTransit trucks in Carrollton, Texas, to reduce annual greenhouse gas emissions by approximately 390 tonnes. This initiative is part of Frito-Lay's broader strategy to decarbonize its fleet and achieve Net-Zero emissions by 2040, complementing existing efforts like renewable electricity at all US facilities and LED lighting. The company aims to improve air quality and reduce emissions in the Dallas Fort Worth area, where its headquarters and 6,500 employees are located.

title: Energy drink A Shoc raises $29M from investors including Keurig Dr Pepper
summary: A Shoc, an energy drink distributed by Keurig Dr Pepper, raised $29 million in a Series B funding round with investors including Keurig Dr Pepper, Aaron Judge, Freddie Freeman, and Michael Strahan. The company, founded by Lance Collins, is positioned in the fast-growing U.S. energy drink market and has a "path to ownership deal" with Keurig Dr Pepper. Given Collins' track record of building and selling successful brands to large corporations like Coca-Cola and Keurig Dr Pepper, a full acquisition by Keurig Dr Pepper is a strong possibility as it seeks to compete with Monster and Rockstar.

title: Mars invites Mondelēz International, Nestlé and General Mills into key climate action group
summary: Mars, in partnership with Guidehouse, PepsiCo, and McCormick & Company, has invited nine major global brands, including Mondelēz International, Nestlé, and General Mills, to join the Supplier Leadership on Climate Transition (Supplier LoCT) consortium. This initiative aims to drive action towards achieving net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050, focusing on engaging and mobilizing suppliers to reduce Scope 3 emissions. The consortium offers instructional seminars and direct mentoring to help suppliers build internal capacity for climate action.

title: Focus: Oreo-maker, Nestle, Pepsi face pressure from European employees over Russia
summary: Oreo-maker Mondelez, Nestle, and PepsiCo are facing significant pressure from their employees in Ukraine and Eastern Europe to cease all business operations in Russia following the invasion of Ukraine. Employees have expressed anger and even resigned over the companies' continued presence, citing concerns that tax and salary payments contribute to the Russian state budget. While the companies have made some adjustments, such as suspending advertising or certain product sales, workers are demanding greater transparency and a stronger stance against Russia.

title: Kernza, a grain used by General Mills, increases in acreage
summary: A perennial grain called Kernza, known for its soil health benefits, has seen a significant increase in acreage to 3,957 acres in 2021, up from 500 acres in 2019, across the United States and Canada. Yields more than doubled, and new varieties show potential for further increases. The grain is being used in various food products by companies like General Mills and Patagonia Provisions, with strong interest from growers looking for economic and environmental benefits.

title: Truist Securities to move its headquarters to Braves' Battery development in Cobb
summary: Truist Financial Corp. announced it will move the headquarters of its securities and corporate banking division from Buckhead to a new 250,000-square-foot office building in The Battery Atlanta, adjacent to Truist Park. The move, expected to house about 1,000 employees, is slated for completion in 2024, with Truist Securities occupying roughly half of the new building. This relocation marks a significant development for The Battery and a loss for the Buckhead office market.

title: Inflation shakes up cereal market share
summary: In February 2022, inflation reached 7.9%, leading to varied price increases across CPG categories like cereal. While General Mills, PepsiCo, and Kellogg significantly raised prices, leading to market share shifts, General Mills saw market share gains primarily due to higher pricing rather than increased unit sales. This suggests consumers may have switched brands due to price Sensitivity.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper CEO to step down in July
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper CEO and Chairman Bob Gamgort will step down on July 29, to be succeeded by CFO and international division president Ozan Dokmecioglu. Gamgort will transition to executive chairman for two years, working closely with Dokmecioglu who will lead the company's operational strategy. This leadership change comes after Gamgort successfully integrated the merged companies and grew sales, while Dokmecioglu is an insider familiar with the company's finances and strategy.

title: Rubenstein Buys PepsiCo’s Dallas Campus
summary: Rubenstein Partners LP has acquired the 250,000-square-foot former PepsiCo campus at 5600 Headquarters Drive in Plano, Texas, marking its entry into the Dallas office market. The firm plans to renovate and reposition the property into a top-tier experiential office destination, including new amenities and potentially integrating its "Powered by Cove" program. This acquisition

title: Church & Dwight to Announce Virgin Plastic Reduction Goal
summary: Church & Dwight Co. has committed to setting a virgin plastic use reduction goal, leading As You Sow to withdraw its shareholder proposal. The company plans to announce a substantial virgin plastic packaging reduction goal in its 2022 Sustainability Report, anticipated in April 2023, aiming for reduction by 2025 through various strategies. This commitment aligns with As You Sow's ongoing efforts to engage companies on plastic packaging reduction.

title: PepsiCo’s Journey to Net Water Positive: Sustainability Goals 2030
summary: PepsiCo is advancing its ambition to be Net Water Positive by 2030, aiming to replenish more water than it uses. This includes new technology to recover over 50% of water in potato chip manufacturing, investing nearly $2 million in the Colorado River Basin, and extending safe water access to 8 million more people in 2021. The PepsiCo Foundation is also granting $1.5 million for new water stewardship programs in Latin America and Nigeria to continue these efforts.

title: Hershey workers at Virginia plant vote against unionization
summary: Workers at Hershey's Stuarts Draft, Virginia, plant voted against unionizing, with 79% opposing the measure. This decision goes against a broader national trend of increasing unionization efforts at companies like Starbucks. Despite the outcome, experts believe unionization efforts will continue, given the current favorable environment for organized labor.

title: PepsiCo Sets Its Sights on Being Net Water Positive by 2030
summary: PepsiCo announced new innovations, investments, and partnerships under its pep+ initiative to achieve Net Water Positive status by 2030, aiming to replenish more water than it uses. Key efforts include developing technology to recover over half the water in potato chip manufacturing, investing nearly $2 million in the Colorado River Basin, and extending safe water access to millions more people. The company has successfully implemented water-saving technology in India and is funding solutions for water scarcity in the American West.

title: PepsiCo to recover water used in potato chip manufacturing, scale drip irrigation technology across 25,000 acres
summary: PepsiCo announced new innovations and investments to achieve its Net Water Positive by 2030 goal, including a technology to recover over 50% of water used in potato chip manufacturing. The company is also investing nearly $2 million in the Colorado River Basin, expanded safe water access to 8 million more people in 2021, and partnered with N-Drip to scale drip irrigation technology across 25,000 acres. These efforts are part of PepsiCo's broader pep+ transformation aimed at replenishing more water than it uses.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper makes sustainability push with new water goal and packaging prototype
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper announced a new goal to be net water positive by 2050 and plans to test its first fully recyclable and compostable paper bottle later this year. This initiative is part of an industry-wide trend where CPGs are improving sustainability through water reduction and recyclable packaging to mitigate their environmental footprint. The company's new paper bottle will be 100% plastic-free and curbside recyclable, aligning with its aim to cut virgin plastic packaging usage by 20% by 2025.

title: Beyond Meat® and PepsiCo's Planet Partnership Debuts Beyond Meat Jerky, the Joint Venture's First Product, at Retailers Nationwide
summary: Beyond Meat, Inc. and PepsiCo, Inc. have launched Beyond Meat Jerky, the first product from their joint venture, Planet Partnership, LLC. This plant-based jerky offers a convenient, shelf-stable snack and is now rolling out nationwide at various retailers. The product aims to make plant-based meat more accessible while contributing to a more sustainable food system.

title: Colgate-Palmolive to sell only essential health, hygiene products in Russia
summary: Colgate-Palmolive announced that it will only sell essential health and hygiene products in Russia, ceasing all other product imports, capital investments, media, advertising, and promotional activities in response to the invasion of Ukraine. This decision follows similar actions by other major US companies like PepsiCo, Coca-Cola, McDonald's, Starbucks, Mastercard, and Visa, all suspending or limiting operations in Russia. The company stated it would continue to assess the situation to align with its values.

title: KFC parent Yum pausing development in Russia, a key market
summary: Yum Brands Inc, parent company of KFC and Pizza Hut, is pausing investment and restaurant development in Russia, a key market. The company is also suspending operations of its 70 KFC company-owned restaurants and finalizing an agreement to suspend Pizza Hut operations through its master franchisee. This move follows similar actions by other major global brands amid sanctions and outrage over the invasion of Ukraine.

title: Starbucks' Stock Price Serves Up a Buying Opportunity
summary: Starbucks' stock has seen a significant decline, presenting a potential buying opportunity for investors. Despite pandemic-related cost pressures and unionization efforts, the company is poised for growth due to strong consumer demand, international expansion, and the success of its loyalty program. Morningstar analyst Sean Dunlop estimates a fair value of $106 per share, projecting an 18% gain from current levels.

title: Builders FirstSource hires Amy Bass Messersmith as chief people officer
summary: Builders FirstSource has appointed Amy Bass Messersmith as its new chief people officer, effective March 14. Messersmith will oversee all human resources aspects, including organizational and leadership development, diversity and inclusion, and talent acquisition for the company's 28,000 team members. She previously held chief human resources or chief people officer roles at U.S. Anesthesia Partners, TDIndustries, Inc., and Pizza Hut, Inc.

title: Cheetos Debuts Hands-Free House, an Immersive Experience at SXSW Inspiring Fans to Live Their Best Hands-Free Lives
summary: Cheetos is launching the Hands-Free House at SXSW, an immersive experience designed to inspire fans to embrace a hands-free lifestyle, particularly while enjoying Cheetos. The activation highlights the brand's playful spirit and its iconic cheesy dust, encouraging attendees to engage with various hands-free activities. This initiative aims to connect with consumers through an innovative and engaging pop-up event.

title: Salesforce, Elanco Animal Health, Pepsi Co, and 150+ Major U.S. Companies Oppose Anti-Transgender Legislation
summary: Over 150 major U.S. companies, including Salesforce, Elanco Animal Health, and Pepsi Co, have publicly opposed anti-LGBTQ+ legislation, particularly bills targeting transgender youth. These businesses, representing nearly 25,000 employees in Indiana alone, argue that discriminatory laws negatively impact recruitment, retention, tourism, and overall business operations and financial performance. They call on public leaders to abandon efforts to enact discriminatory legislation to ensure a strong business climate and fairness for all Americans.

title: Origin Materials selects Louisiana as site for second manufacturing plant
summary: Origin Materials announced it will invest at least $750 million to build its second manufacturing plant, Origin 2, in Geismar, Louisiana. This plant will produce carbon-negative materials from sustainable wood residue, creating 200 direct jobs and significantly contributing to the local economy. The facility is expected to begin construction in mid-2023 and be fully operational by mid-2025, addressing strong demand for net-zero enabling materials.

title: Starbucks announces new CEO
summary: Starbucks has announced Laxman Narasimhan as its new chief executive officer, effective April 1, 2023. Narasimhan will join as incoming CEO on Oct. 1, 2022, working with interim CEO Howard Schultz, after stepping down from his role at Reckitt Benckiser Group PLC. Schultz and board chair Mellody Hobson highlighted Narasimhan's experience in building capabilities and driving growth in global consumer-facing businesses as key to his selection.

title: Former ULTA Beauty CEO’s Career-Long Success Comes Down to 1 Rule: No BS
summary: Mary Dillon, former CEO of ULTA Beauty, attributes her career-long success to authenticity and clear communication, a principle instilled by her mentors. Her straightforward approach as CEO enabled ULTA to navigate market challenges and significantly increase share price. The article advises entrepreneurs to embrace their authentic selves and confidently express their views, emphasizing the importance of strong leadership.

title: Seth Rogen and Paul Rudd "Stay Golden™" While Walking Down Memory Lane in Lay's® New Super Bowl Campaign
summary: Lay's is launching a new Super Bowl campaign featuring actors Seth Rogen and Paul Rudd. The campaign, titled "Golden Memories," will star the duo in a 60-second in-game ad that focuses on their shared golden memories over a bag of Lay's potato chips. This marks Lay's first Super Bowl advertisement in 17 years.

title: Colgate-Palmolive Streamlining Supply Chain, Boosting Ad Spend
summary: Colgate-Palmolive is implementing a global productivity program to streamline its supply chain and operations, anticipating significant pre-tax savings. The company is also increasing advertising spend across key categories like oral care and pet nutrition and investing in capacity to sustain volume growth amid price increases. Additionally, Colgate is launching a predictive tool for dentists to support its teeth-whitening product.

title: Starbucks launches energy drinks in partnership with PepsiCo
summary: Starbucks Corp. is launching its first-ever line of energy drinks, Starbucks BAYA Energy, in partnership with PepsiCo, Inc. The new energy drinks will be available in grocery stores, national retailers, convenience stores, and Starbucks locations starting in March, in flavors like mango guava, raspberry lime, and pineapple passionfruit. Each serving contains 90 calories and 160 mg of caffeine, along with vitamin C for immune support, tapping into the growing energy drink market.

title: Monster Beverage to enter alcohol market with craft beer
summary: Monster Beverage Corp is venturing into the alcoholic drinks market through a US$330 million acquisition of CANarchy Craft Brewery Collective LLC. This move allows Monster, known for its energy drinks, to gain infrastructure, distribution, and expertise in the alcoholic beverage industry. The deal, expected to close in the first quarter of the year, reflects a trend of soft-drink companies expanding into alcohol.

title: Monster Energy Acquires CANarchy for $330M, Entering the Alcohol Industry
summary: Monster Beverage Corp. has announced its acquisition of craft beer and hard seltzer producer CANarchy Brewery Collective, LLC for $330 million, marking its official entry into the alcoholic beverage industry. This move follows a trend of soft beverage companies expanding into alcohol, much like Coca-Cola and PepsiCo. The acquisition is expected to close before the end of the first quarter and provides Monster with an established infrastructure for alcoholic beverage development and distribution.

title: Monster Energy enters alcohol with $330M purchase of Canarchy Craft Brewery
summary: Monster Beverage is set to acquire Canarchy Craft Brewery Collective for $330 million, marking its entry into the alcoholic beverage market. This strategic move provides Monster with an established infrastructure and brands like Cigar City and Oskar Blues, allowing it to diversify beyond energy drinks and compete with industry giants. The acquisition comes amidst rumors of Monster itself being an acquisition target, suggesting a push towards independence and new growth avenues.

title: Monster acquires CANarchy, which includes Cigar City & Oskar Blues
summary: Monster Beverage Corp, known for Monster Energy Drinks, has acquired CANarchy, a craft beer collective that includes Oskar Blues and Cigar City Brewing, in a $330 million all-cash deal. This acquisition grants Monster access to an established craft brewing infrastructure and distribution channels, ahead of its planned entry into the alcoholic beverage industry with new products and hard seltzers. The Brewers Association has stated that CANarchy will retain its "craft brewer" definition under Monster's ownership, as Monster is not currently a beverage alcohol industry member.

title: Monster Beverage to buy craft-beer maker in alcohol market drive
summary: Monster Beverage Corp is entering the alcoholic drinks market by acquiring CANarchy Craft Brewery Collective LLC for $330 million. This all-cash deal signifies a broader trend of soft-drink companies expanding into the alcohol sector, providing Monster with established infrastructure and expertise in the industry. The acquisition adds several craft beer brands to Monster's portfolio and is expected to close in the first quarter of this year.

title: Ethiopian chip brand receives $40 million investment from PepsiCo
summary: PepsiCo is investing $40 million in its Ethiopian subsidiary, Senselet, known for its SUN Chips brand. This investment will fund new production lines to significantly increase snack production capacity and create over 500 new jobs. The move also supports PepsiCo's Positive Agriculture initiative by focusing on local potato sourcing and improving the potato value chain in Ethiopia.

title: PepsiCo takes stake in energy drink maker
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. has acquired an 8.5% ownership stake in Celsius Holdings, Inc. for $550 million, alongside a distribution agreement. This partnership aims to leverage Celsius's growing momentum and PepsiCo's distribution capabilities to boost growth and innovation in the energy beverage market. The deal continues PepsiCo's strategy to expand its share in the energy drink sector, following its acquisition of Rockstar Energy Beverages in 2020.

title: Coca-Cola, Constellation Brands strike deal to offer Fresca canned cocktails
summary: Coca-Cola is partnering with Constellation Brands to launch a new line of spirit-based, ready-to-drink canned cocktails under its Fresca brand, called Fresca Mixed, which is expected to debut later this year. This collaboration follows similar moves by other beverage giants into the adult alternative beverage market, a rapidly growing segment. The financial terms of the deal were not disclosed, and Constellation Brands will be responsible for production, marketing, and distribution.

title: You Can Now Buy Vodka Made With Lay’s Potatoes For The Ultimate Pairing
summary: Lay's has partnered with Eastside Distilling to release a limited-edition Lay’s Potato Vodka, available for purchase online starting December 16, 2021, for $40. The unique vodka is made from a blend of Portland Potato Vodka and vodka distilled from Lay’s potatoes, packaged in a 750-milliliter bottle with a limited edition numbering. This collaboration offers an unexpected alcoholic twist for fans of the iconic potato chip brand.

title: PepsiCo Beverages North America Announces $15 Million Investment in Closed Loop Partners' Leadership Fund
summary: PepsiCo Beverages North America has announced a $15 million investment in Closed Loop Partners' Leadership Fund to strengthen recycling infrastructure and build circular supply chains. This investment aims to increase recycling rates in the U.S. and support PepsiCo's goal to cut virgin plastic from non-renewable sources by 50% by 2030. It builds on PepsiCo's existing partnerships with Closed Loop Partners to advance material recovery and infrastructure.

title: Merger rumour: Monster and Constellation to create total beverage firm
summary: A merger rumor suggests that Monster Beverage and Constellation Brands are exploring a deal to create a "total beverage company" encompassing energy drinks, spirits, beer, RTDs, and potentially cannabis. This potential megadeal would be one of the largest in the beverage industry, though Coca-Cola's stake in Monster and investor skepticism pose complexities. The concept aims to energize beverage giants to find new ways to engage consumers.

title: Coca-Cola and others report using more recycled plastic
summary: Major packaged goods companies, including Coca-Cola, PepsiCo, and Unilever, reported increased use of post-consumer recycled (PCR) plastic in 2020, according to a report by the Ellen MacArthur Foundation. While these companies are making progress toward their 2025 targets, many still have significant ground to cover. Greenpeace, however, criticized the focus on recycled content, arguing that it does not solve the fundamental problem of plastic pollution and encourages continued fossil fuel-based plastic production.

title: India revokes patent for PepsiCo's Lay's potatoes
summary: India has revoked a patent held by PepsiCo for its FC5 potato variety, which is used for Lay's potato chips. The Protection of Plant Varieties and Farmers' Rights (PPVFR) Authority ruled that Indian law doesn't allow patents on seed varieties, siding with farmers' rights activists and groups who celebrated the decision as a victory. PepsiCo is currently reviewing the order.

title: Microsoft is Equipping People with Low-Code AI
summary: Microsoft is empowering "citizen developers" with low-code AI solutions, exemplified by its Azure AI Platform and Project Bonsai. These tools enable businesses to integrate advanced AI capabilities without extensive data science expertise, as demonstrated by PepsiCo's successful implementation of Project Bonsai to improve Cheetos production consistency. The initiative aims to make AI more accessible and practical for everyday business applications.

title: PepsiCo Announces Timing and Availability of Fourth Quarter and Full-Year 2021 Financial Results
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. (NASDAQ: PEP) announced that it will release its fourth-quarter and full-year 2021 financial results on Thursday, February 10, 2022. The company will post a press release, 10-K, and prepared management remarks online, followed by a live question and answer session for analysts with its Chairman and CEO, Ramon Laguarta, and Vice Chairman and CFO, Hugh Johnston.

title: PepsiCo blocked from using 'Rise' name in dispute with coffee co
summary: A Manhattan federal court has ruled that PepsiCo Inc must stop using the "Mtn Dew Rise Energy" name for its morning energy drink due to a trademark dispute with Rise Brewing. The court found that PepsiCo's drink was likely to cause customer confusion and posed an "existential threat" to Rise Brewing's business. This injunction bars PepsiCo from using the "Mtn Dew Rise" name commercially while the lawsuit is ongoing.

title: Compañía Cervecerías Unidas (CCU) gana participación de mercado en Chile
summary: Compañía Cervecerías Unidas (CCU) has increased its market share in the Chilean beverage market, reaching 45.2% in 2020, up from 43.4% in 2018. CCU is a multi-category beverage company with significant operations and market presence in Chile and several other South American countries. The company produces and distributes a wide range of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages, including licensed international brands.

title: Last Call: Ball Can Prices to Increase; Hawaii Stream Register 1.2% ABV
summary: Ball Corporation is significantly increasing can prices and minimum order quantities for craft brewers, with 12 oz. cans rising by nearly 28% and 16 oz. cans by 19.5%, leading to concerns within the Brewers Association about the impact on small brewers. This comes amidst a surge in can demand and supply chain issues. Additionally, the article reports on the death of Anthony Angotti, founder of Beers of the World, and a stream in Oahu, Hawaii registering 1.2% ABV due to contamination from a beverage warehouse spill.

title: PepsiCo partners with the UN World Food Programme in Iraq to support farmers affected by conflict, displacement, and climate change
summary: PepsiCo Inc. and the UN World Food Programme (WFP) have launched a new partnership to support Iraqi farmers affected by conflict and climate change, aiming to build a sustainable agricultural supply chain. A $250,000 grant from PepsiCo Foundation will expand WFP's 'Food Assistance for Assets' program, providing training, technical expertise, and market linkages to smallholder farmers, with PepsiCo purchasing potatoes for food production. This collaboration is part of PepsiCo's positive agriculture strategy and its ongoing commitment to global food security.

title: Applebee’s partners with PepsiCo on new menu items
summary: Applebee's Grill & Bar is launching a limited-time Cheetos-inspired menu, featuring items like boneless wings and fried cheese bites with Cheetos flavors. This initiative deepens Applebee's partnership with PepsiCo, which also includes the addition of Mtn Dew Berry Bash to its beverage offerings. The new menu aims to leverage the popularity of wings and Cheetos and was inspired by the Cosmic Wings online delivery concept.

title: PepsiCo to take delivery of Tesla electric trucks in fourth quarter - CNBC
summary: PepsiCo is set to receive its first Tesla electric semi-trucks in the fourth quarter of 2021, as confirmed by CEO Ramon Laguarta. The company aims to reduce fuel costs and fleet emissions, with transportation accounting for 10% of its gas emissions. Several other major companies like Walmart, J.B. Hunt, and Sysco have also placed orders for Tesla's semi-trucks.

title: PepsiCo CEO says he expects delivery of first Tesla Semis this quarter
summary: PepsiCo CEO Ramon Laguarta announced that the company expects its first delivery of Tesla Semi trucks in the fourth quarter of 2021. This comes almost four years after PepsiCo initially placed a pre-order for 100 Tesla Semi trucks, a delivery that had been delayed due to production challenges and battery cell limitations. Laguarta stated that transportation accounts for about 10% of PepsiCo's overall gas emissions and that they are actively working on solutions, including the adoption of electric trucks.

title: Mtn Dew adds limited-time flavors
summary: PepsiCo is introducing two new limited-time Mtn Dew flavors for the holiday season: Gingerbread Snap’d and Voo-Dew. This follows other recent limited-edition beverage launches, such as Pepsi x Cracker Jack soda and Mtn Dew Flamin’ Hot. Mtn Dew Voo-Dew was previously marketed as a mystery flavor, which was just revealed to be fruit candy chews.

title: Coca-Cola is buying sports drink maker BodyArmor
summary: Coca-Cola has acquired sports-drink maker BodyArmor for $5.6 billion, marking its largest brand acquisition to date. This move aims to challenge PepsiCo-owned Gatorade's market dominance and leverage BodyArmor's growing market share. Coca-Cola plans to use both Powerade and BodyArmor to compete more effectively in the expanding sports and performance drinks market.

title: Coca-Cola nearly doubled its advertising this year
summary: Coca-Cola significantly increased its advertising budget this year, nearly doubling it from a year ago. Experts suggest this is a strategic move to maintain "top of mind" awareness among consumers, even for established brands, especially after cutting costs at the pandemic's outset. This advertising also helps combat inflation by allowing price increases while retaining loyal customers.

title: PepsiCo investing in digital innovation
summary: PepsiCo is establishing "digital hubs" in Dallas and Barcelona to centralize and advance its efforts in predictive analytics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning. These hubs aim to improve customer access to real-time sales and inventory data, offer predictive decision-making tools to employees, and will create 500 new jobs over the next three years.

title: PepsiCo Accelerates Digitalization with Launch of Digital Hubs in North America and Europe
summary: PepsiCo announced the establishment of its first two Digital Hubs in Dallas and Barcelona, aiming to create over 500 new data and digital jobs and accelerate the company's digitalization agenda. These Hubs will drive critical digital capabilities and predictive analytics across global operations, supporting PepsiCo's goal to become a faster, stronger, and better company through innovation and talent development. The initiative is expected to improve customer access to data, enhance product availability for consumers, and empower employees with predictive decision-making tools.

title: Make Your Meal Count: People Across America Are Invited to Boost Local Black-Owned Restaurants on the First-Ever "Pepsi® Dig In Day" on Nov. 6
summary: Pepsi is launching the first-ever "Pepsi® Dig In Day" on November 6, 2021, to encourage people across America to support Black-owned restaurants. The initiative includes special offerings, free food events, a limited-edition merchandise drop, and a DigInPassport.com platform for discovering restaurants and earning rewards. PepsiCo has committed $50 million to support Black-owned businesses over five years and aims to drive $100 million in sales for Black-owned restaurants through programs like Dig In Day.

title: Slideshow: New products from PepsiCo, Grupo Bimbo, Country Archer Provisions
summary: This article highlights new product launches from snack brands PepsiCo, Grupo Bimbo, and Country Archer Provisions. PepsiCo is reintroducing Doritos Twisted Lime, while Grupo Bimbo's Takis brand is launching stackable potato crisps. Country Archer Provisions is releasing a limited-edition Death Reaper Jerky made with Carolina Reaper peppers, targeting consumers who enjoy extremely spicy foods.

title: PepsiCo Announces Pricing Terms for Cash Tender Offers for Certain Outstanding Debt Securities
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. announced the pricing terms for its cash tender offers for certain outstanding debt securities. This information is available on the company's investor relations website and will also be filed with the SEC on a Form 8-K.

title: Pricier shipping containers and port delays haven't slowed Vita Coco's growth, co-CEO says
summary: Vita Coco, despite supply chain challenges and port delays, has continued to grow its business substantially, according to co-founder and co-CEO Mike Kirban. The company went public on Nasdaq under the symbol "COCO," raising $173 million with an initial offering price of $15 per share, although shares fell nearly 4% in afternoon trading. Vita Coco's strong long-term contracts with coconut manufacturers have helped it avoid higher commodity costs, a key differentiator from competitors.

title: One Woman’s Rise to Amazon Director Is Model for Board Diversity
summary: Edith Cooper's recent appointments to the boards of PepsiCo Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. highlight progress in board diversity for women and people of color. Her board changes, along with others, contributed to women gaining 13 net seats on S&P 500 boards in September. Cooper emphasizes that while progress has been made, there is still a significant journey towards achieving parity in power.

title: PepsiCo, Bally’s sign exclusive partnership
summary: PepsiCo Inc. and Bally's Corp. have announced an exclusive partnership naming PepsiCo the official beverage provider for Bally's casinos and resorts nationwide. This agreement expands PepsiCo's presence across more than 14 Bally's properties in 10 states, offering a wide range of beverages from carbonated soft drinks to sparkling waters. PepsiCo will hold exclusive pouring rights in all Bally's food and beverage outlets, including vending machines.

title: Microsoft announces proposed election of new board member
summary: Microsoft announced the nomination of Carlos A. Rodriguez, president and CEO of Automatic Data Processing (ADP), to its board of directors. Rodriguez will be presented for election at the company's annual shareholders meeting on November 30, 2021. This addition is expected to bring valuable industry and technology expertise, particularly concerning changing work norms, to Microsoft's board.

title: PepsiCo dials into bold flavors, 3D textures
summary: PepsiCo showcased new products at the 2021 NACS Show, focusing on bold flavors and multidimensional textures to appeal to younger consumers. Innovations include Lay's Layers for 3D crunch, Doritos Flamin' Hot Cool Ranch, and new energy drinks like Rockstar Unplugged and Baya Energy. The company also introduced Nitro Pepsi and new Mtn Dew flavors, including an alcoholic version.

title: Pepsi launches Cracker Jack flavored soda
summary: PepsiCo has launched a new limited-edition Pepsi x Cracker Jack soda, combining the taste of Pepsi cola with the flavors of caramel, popcorn, and peanut. This beverage celebrates "the biggest month in baseball" and is available only through a Twitter and TikTok sweepstakes. Each can includes a peel-off temporary tattoo, reminiscent of classic Cracker Jack prizes.

title: PEPSI® Unveils New Limited-Edition Pepsi x Cracker Jack Flavored Cola in Celebration of October Baseball
summary: Pepsi has launched a limited-edition Pepsi x Cracker Jack flavored cola to celebrate October Baseball, blending the taste of Pepsi with caramel, popcorn, and peanut flavors. This collaboration includes classic Cracker Jack-style temporary tattoo prizes inside each can and is available exclusively through the #PepsiSingToScore program on Twitter and TikTok. Fans can win cans by singing "Take Me Out to the Ballgame" for a chance to receive the unique flavor and special collector's items.

title: Mental performance benefits interest PepsiCo
summary: PepsiCo is exploring mental performance benefits in its new product innovation, focusing on how foods and beverages impact neurochemical pathways. The company is particularly interested in reducing sleep deprivation and improving the mind-gut axis, having already launched Driftwell, an enhanced water aimed at relaxation. This initiative follows an internal competition and highlights PepsiCo's strategy to expand into functional foods and beverages.

title: PepsiCo benefits from consumers in transition
summary: PepsiCo's third-quarter results were positively impacted by a mix of consumer trends, including sustained at-home consumption and a resurgence in away-from-home and convenience store purchases. The company reported increased sales and organic revenue growth, despite inflation and supply chain disruptions, and plans additional pricing adjustments into 2022. PepsiCo also highlighted its Pep+ sustainability initiatives, focusing on healthier products and environmentally friendly consumption models.

title: PepsiCo warns of another price increase as supply disruptions linger
summary: PepsiCo announced plans for further price increases in early 2022 to counter persistent supply chain challenges, including shortages of bottles and truck drivers. Despite these issues, the company raised its organic revenue forecast for fiscal 2021 to about 8% and reported strong third-quarter results with net revenue rising 11.6% to $20.19 billion.

title: PepsiCo Launches A More Than $5 Million Initiative To Help Young Adults From Chicago's South And West Side Communities Access High-Quality Careers In Partnership With Leading Community Organizations
summary: PepsiCo announced the launch of its new initiative, Pathways to Readiness and Empowerment Program (PREP) by PepsiCo Stronger Together, a more than $5 million dollar investment to help nearly 3,000 young people from Chicago's South and West Sides access high-quality careers. This program, in partnership with leading community-based organizations, will offer workforce readiness, career exposure, paid work experience, skills training, and employment opportunities to address disparities in youth employment. PREP builds on PepsiCo's existing commitments and investment in Chicago, aiming to foster economic growth and create pathways to careers for underserved youth.

title: id2021finalwebversion101.htm
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) held its 2021 Investor Day to highlight its transformation into a modern beverage company, emphasizing its strong financial model, sustainable growth, and significant M&A capacity. The company aims for mid-single digit net sales growth and high-single digit adjusted EPS growth in the long term, supported by industry-leading cash conversion and a scalable business model. KDP also detailed its strong ESG commitments, robust go-to-market strategy, and an expanded capital allocation plan that now includes inorganic options like share buybacks.

title: Where AB-InBev, Molson Coors, Diageo rank in the Corporate Plastic Pollution Scorecard
summary: As You Sow released its "Corporate Plastic Pollution Scorecard 2021," evaluating 50 major U.S. consumer companies on their efforts to reduce plastic pollution. The report highlights progress in virgin plastic reduction commitments but notes that no companies have sufficiently robust policies given the urgency of the crisis. Coca-Cola received the highest grade with transparency and strong recycling commitments, while adult beverage companies like Diageo, Molson Coors, and AB InBev received lower scores, indicating significant room for improvement, particularly in recycling support and packaging design.

title: The Coca-Cola Company Unveils New Global Brand Platform for Coca-Cola Trademark
summary: The Coca-Cola Company has launched "Real Magic," a new global brand philosophy and platform, refreshing its trademark promise to unite and uplift people. This marks the first new global platform since 2016 and introduces a refreshed visual identity, including the "Hug" logo. The platform kicks off with the "One Coke Away From Each Other" campaign, blending real and virtual worlds and featuring collaborations with gamers and artists.

title: PepsiCo introduces compostable bags for Off The Eaten Path brand
summary: PepsiCo, through its Frito-Lay North America division, has introduced industrially compostable bags for its Off The Eaten Path brand, marking a significant step in reducing packaging waste. These new bags, made from plant-based products, generate lower greenhouse gas emissions compared to traditional packaging. Consumers can participate in a TerraCycle program to compost the packaging.

title: Ball Corp. plans $290M factory investment amid increasing can demand
summary: Ball Corp. announced a $290 million investment in a new beverage can factory, driven by booming demand for aluminum cans. This move is part of the company's continuous expansion efforts over the past year, establishing new manufacturing locations to meet market needs.

title: PepsiCo pledges to reduce virgin plastic use
summary: PepsiCo has committed to an agreement with As You Sow to reduce its total virgin nonrenewable plastic use by 20 percent by 2030, a move anticipated to cut approximately 460,000 tons of virgin nonrenewable plastic. This pledge is part of PepsiCo's wider "Pep+" strategy to drive sustainable long-term value, which also includes expanding its SodaStream business to avoid 200 billion plastic bottles by 2030. While As You Sow acknowledges the significant goal, it expresses concern that PepsiCo's timeline for reduction is longer than that of several peers.

title: Danone’s Evian partners with Loop on water bottle made with recycled plastic
summary: Danone's Evian brand is rolling out a new prototype water bottle made from 100% recycled PET using technology from Loop Industries. This initiative is a major step towards Evian's goal of using all recycled plastic in its bottles by 2025 and aims to repurpose PET waste that would otherwise be discarded. The technology allows diverse plastic waste to be transformed into food-grade plastic, with commercial rollout starting in South Korea in 2022.

title: PepsiCo's New Sustainability Goals Include Halving Virgin Plastic Use by 2030
summary: PepsiCo introduced its "pep+" transformation focused on sustainability, aiming to halve virgin plastic use by 2030 and achieve Net-Zero emissions by 2040. This strategy includes initiatives like regenerative agriculture, sustainable packaging innovations, and expanding its SodaStream business to reduce plastic bottle usage. The company also plans to use 100% rPET bottles for its Pepsi-branded products in various markets.

title: PepsiCo Announces Strategic End−To−End Transformation: pep+ (PepsiCo Positive)
summary: PepsiCo has introduced pep+ (PepsiCo Positive), a strategic end-to-end transformation aimed at putting sustainability at the center of how the company will create growth and value. This initiative involves three key pillars: Positive Agriculture, Positive Value Chain, and Positive Choices, with ambitious goals for 2030, including Net-Zero emissions by 2040, becoming Net Water Positive, and significantly reducing virgin plastic use. The company plans to leverage its global brands and reach to inspire positive change for both the planet and people by evolving its portfolio with more sustainable options and expanding the SodaStream business.

title: PepsiCo sees sustainability as a key to growth
summary: PepsiCo announced a comprehensive sustainability initiative called "pep+" focused on regenerative agriculture, reducing virgin plastic, and evolving its food and beverage portfolio. The company aims to achieve net-zero emissions by 2040 and become net water positive by 2030, while also expanding its SodaStream business to eliminate plastic bottles. These efforts are expected to transform PepsiCo's brands and contribute to positive environmental and social impact.

title: PepsiCo targets early 2022 to roll out products from joint venture with Beyond Meat
summary: PepsiCo aims to launch new plant-based snacks and drinks through its joint venture with Beyond Meat by early 2022. This partnership, called The PLANeT Partnership, was announced in January 2021 and leverages Pepsi's expertise and Beyond Meat's product innovation. Additionally, PepsiCo announced a new "Pep+" initiative focused on sustainability, impacting its operations and product development.

title: Pepsi Plans to Cut Virgin Plastic by 50%, Go Carbon-Neutral
summary: PepsiCo Inc. announced new sustainability goals, aiming to cut virgin plastic use by 50% by 2030 and achieve net-zero emissions by 2040. The company also plans to implement regenerative farming practices across its agricultural footprint and introduce innovative sustainable packaging and plant-based snack foods.

title: PepsiCo Announces Strategic End-to-End Transformation: pep+ (PepsiCo Positive)
summary: PepsiCo introduced pep+ (PepsiCo Positive), a strategic end-to-end transformation focused on sustainability. This initiative aims to drive long-term value and competitive advantage through three pillars: Positive Agriculture, Positive Value Chain, and Positive Choices. The transformation includes goals like Net-Zero emissions by 2040, reducing virgin plastic by 50%, and expanding its SodaStream business to avoid billions of plastic bottles.

title: PepsiCo Announces Strategic End-To-End Transformation: pep+ (PepsiCo Positive)
summary: PepsiCo introduced pep+ (PepsiCo Positive), a strategic end-to-end transformation integrating sustainability into its growth model. This initiative focuses on three pillars: Positive Agriculture, Positive Value Chain, and Positive Choices, with goals including regenerative farming, Net-Zero emissions by 2040, Net Water Positive by 2030, and significant reductions in virgin plastic usage. The company aims to leverage its global brands to inspire positive change and evolve its product portfolio to be more planet and people-friendly.

title: Time To Rise™: Stacy's® Pita Chips Partners With Hello Sunshine To Amplify Female Founders
summary: Stacy's Pita Chips has partnered with Reese Witherspoon's Hello Sunshine to amplify female founders through the Stacy's Rise Project. The initiative provides grants, mentorship, and a new online business directory, FoundedByHer.org, to support women entrepreneurs. This partnership builds on Stacy's legacy of helping female-founded businesses grow, following a significant increase in applications for the 2021 Rise Project.

title: General Mills strives to scale back contract manufacturing
summary: General Mills plans to reduce its reliance on contract manufacturing once pandemic-fueled demand for its products normalizes, according to CFO Kofi Bruce. The company enlisted an additional 50 contract manufacturers during the pandemic, bringing the total to 250, but aims to shed these as they are more costly and impact gross margins. General Mills is also monitoring rising commodity prices and inflation, though it currently has no plans to raise prices.

title: PepsiCo Launches $50 Million Juntos Crecemos Platform to Support Hispanic-Owned Businesses Across the U.S.
summary: PepsiCo has launched Juntos Crecemos, a $50 million platform designed to support Hispanic-owned businesses in the U.S., particularly restaurants, bodegas, and carnicerías, over the next five years. This initiative, part of PepsiCo's Racial Equality Journey Hispanic Initiative, aims to address foundational business challenges and support growth. The PepsiCo Foundation is also launching the IMPACTO Hispanic Business Accelerator, providing $10 million in funding and business coaching to 500 Hispanic small food and beverage business owners across 13 cities.

title: PepsiCo plans largest European food facility
summary: PepsiCo is investing approximately $257.1 million to build its largest and most sustainable food manufacturing plant in Europe, located in Sroda Slaska, Poland. The facility will be PepsiCo's fifth in Poland and aims to be a model for sustainability, utilizing renewable energy, water reuse, and converting potato peelings into fertilizer. This expansion will boost the company's food production capacity for domestic and international distribution, including brands like Lay's and Doritos.

title: Top 100 Food and Beverage Company Highlights: #8 The Coca-Cola Company
summary: The Coca-Cola Company saw significant net revenue acceleration by 42% in Q2, driven by pandemic recovery, posting $10.1 billion with 26% growth in concentrate sales. The company is undergoing a global restructuring effort, including job cuts and streamlined operations into nine units and five global categories. Recent activities include the sale of US production facilities, intent to acquire Bodyarmor, increased takeover offers for Coca-Cola Amatil, and investments in cultured milk products, alongside product launches and discontinuation.

title: PepsiCo reveals Mtn Dew Flamin' Hot
summary: Mtn Dew has collaborated with Cheetos to create a new limited-edition Mtn Dew Flamin’ Hot beverage, combining the citrus taste of Mtn Dew with the spicy kick of Flamin’ Hot Cheetos. This "provocative" drink will be available exclusively on the Dew Store's virtual shelves starting August 31, 2021, while supplies last.

title: PepsiCo Announces "Net Water Positive" Commitment
summary: PepsiCo has announced its ambition to become "Net Water Positive" by 2030, aiming to replenish more water than it uses, particularly in high-risk watersheds. This commitment includes reducing water usage in its operations and expanding The PepsiCo Foundation's safe water access program with a $1 million investment in Sub-Saharan Africa. The initiative, in partnership with WaterAid, seeks to provide safe water to 100 million people by 2030 and addresses critical needs exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Hard MTN Dew Is On the Way With 5% ABV and 3 Flavors
summary: Boston Beer Company and Pepsi are collaborating to launch Hard MTN Dew, a new flavored malt beverage with 5% ABV. This adult version of MTN Dew will come in three classic flavors and is expected to hit shelves in early 2022, with Boston Beer handling development and Pepsi managing marketing.

title: Coca Cola HBC seals Egypt deal after first-half profit jump
summary: Coca Cola HBC agreed to acquire a majority stake in Coca-Cola Bottling Company of Egypt for $427 million following a significant rise in its first-half comparable operating profit. Despite expecting lower operating profit margins in the second half of the year due to rising cost inflation, the company anticipates overall annual margin expansion. Analysts, however, expressed concerns about upside risk to FY22 margin expectations given continued high raw material costs.

title: Judge bars PepsiCo from using Mtn Dew Rise Energy name
summary: A US federal court has ruled that PepsiCo, Inc. must cease using the Mtn Dew Rise Energy name for its new energy drink. The decision comes after a trademark infringement lawsuit filed by Rise Brewing Co., which argued that PepsiCo's product created an "existential threat" to its brand. The ruling by Judge Lorna Schofield noted credible evidence that PepsiCo's infringement dissuaded an investor from Rise Brewing.

title: PepsiCo Elects Edith W. Cooper to Board of Directors
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. announced the election of Edith W. Cooper as an independent member of its Board of Directors, effective September 1, 2021. Ms. Cooper brings over two decades of experience from The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., where she served in human capital management leadership roles, and also co-founded Medley, a community for personal and professional growth. Her extensive background in talent development, financial management, and corporate governance is expected to significantly benefit PepsiCo's strategic initiatives and shareholder value.

title: PepsiCo to sell Tropicana, other juice brands for $3.3B
summary: PepsiCo is selling its Tropicana, Naked, and other juice brands in North America and Europe to private-equity firm PAI Partners for $3.3 billion in pre-tax proceeds. PepsiCo will retain a 39% noncontrolling stake and exclusive distribution rights for chilled direct store delivery. This divestment aims to strengthen PepsiCo's balance sheet and allow it to focus on its core businesses, healthier snacks, and zero-calorie beverages amidst declining juice sales over recent years.

title: PepsiCo Selling Juice Brands in North America, Europe
summary: PepsiCo has agreed to sell its Tropicana, Naked, and other select juice brands in North America and an option to sell certain juice businesses in Europe to PAI Partners for approximately $3.3 billion. PepsiCo will retain a 39% non-controlling interest in the newly formed joint venture and exclusive U.S. distribution rights for the chilled direct-store delivery channels. This move allows PepsiCo to focus on its healthier snack and zero-calorie beverage portfolio, while PAI aims to grow the juice brands through innovation and expansion.

title: PepsiCo to Sell Select Juice Brands as Part of Portfolio Optimization
summary: PepsiCo has entered into an agreement with PAI Partners to sell Tropicana, Naked, and other select juice brands for approximately $3.3 billion, while retaining a 39-percent interest in a newly formed joint venture. This move allows PepsiCo to focus on its diverse offerings, including healthier snacks and zero-calorie beverages, and PAI Partners aims to drive growth through innovation and market expansion. The transaction is expected to close in late 2021 or early 2022.

title: PepsiCo to Sell Tropicana, Naked Juice Brands to Private-Equity Firm
summary: PepsiCo plans to sell its Tropicana, Naked, and other juice brands in North America to private-equity firm PAI Partners for $3.3 billion in pretax proceeds. The deal, valued at roughly $4.5 billion, will see PepsiCo retain a 39% stake in the new joint venture. This move aims to boost PepsiCo's growth and comes after increased demand for orange juice during the pandemic.

title: PepsiCo exiting juice business
summary: PepsiCo is selling a majority stake in its Tropicana, Naked, and other juice businesses to private equity firm PAI Partners for approximately $3.3 billion, retaining a 39% ownership in a joint venture. This divestment allows PepsiCo to focus on healthier snacks, zero-calorie beverages, and products like SodaStream, aligning with a broader industry trend of major beverage companies streamlining portfolios. The sale also reflects the long-term decline in fruit juice consumption and the evolving role of juice in consumer diets.

title: PepsiCo Announces Portfolio Optimization Actions For Juice Businesses In North America and Europe
summary: PepsiCo announced it is selling Tropicana, Naked, and other juice brands in North America and Europe to PAI Partners for approximately $3.3 billion, while retaining a 39% non-controlling interest in a newly formed joint venture. This move allows PepsiCo to focus on its portfolio of healthier snacks, zero-calorie beverages, and products like SodaStream, and use the proceeds to strengthen its balance sheet and make organic investments. PAI Partners will be the majority shareholder, aiming to drive growth through product innovation and expansion.

title: PepsiCo to sell Tropicana, other juice brands for $3.3 billion
summary: PepsiCo announced the sale of its Tropicana and other North American juice brands to French private equity firm PAI Partners for $3.3 billion. The move aims to simplify PepsiCo's product range, reduce focus on high-sugar drinks, and provide funds for investment in health-focused snacks and zero-calorie beverages. PepsiCo will retain a 39% stake in the new joint venture and exclusive U.S. distribution rights for the brands.

title: PepsiCo to sell Bradenton-based Tropicana and other juice brands for $3.3 billion
summary: PepsiCo has entered into an agreement to sell Tropicana and other select juice brands across North America to PAI Partners for $3.3 billion. PepsiCo will retain a 39% non-controlling interest in a newly formed joint venture and exclusive U.S. distribution rights for these brands. This sale allows PepsiCo to focus on its healthier snack and zero-calorie beverage portfolio, while PAI Partners aims to drive growth through innovation and market expansion.

title: PepsiCo to Sell Juice Brands to PAI for About $3.3 Billion
summary: PepsiCo announced it would sell its Tropicana, Naked, and other juice brands to French private equity firm PAI Partners for approximately $3.3 billion. This divestment will allow PepsiCo to strengthen its balance sheet and intensify its focus on healthier snacks and zero-calorie beverages. PepsiCo will maintain a significant minority stake of 39% in the new holding company for these brands.

title: PepsiCo
summary: This article provides a corporate profile of PepsiCo, a global leader in the food and beverage industry. It highlights the company's history, leadership, global operations, commitment to sustainability, and extensive product range. The article also lists various related content covering PepsiCo's supply chain efficiency, sustainability efforts, and innovations within the industry.

title: Utz promotes three in executive shuffle
summary: Utz Brands, Inc. announced an executive management reshuffle, appointing a new chief operating officer, chief financial officer, and chief people officer to optimize the company for its next growth phase. Cary Devore transitions to executive vice president and COO, Ajay Kataria becomes executive vice president and CFO, and Jim Sponaugle is named executive vice president and chief people officer. These changes, following recent appointments of a chief growth officer and chief customer officer, aim to enhance Utz's leadership and strategic execution.

title: Utz Brands Appoints New CFO, COO, CPO
summary: Utz Brands, Inc. announced several executive management team changes to accelerate growth capabilities. Cary Devore was appointed EVP and COO, Ajay Kataria became EVP and CFO, and Jim Sponaugle was named EVP and Chief People Officer, all effective October 4, 2021. Additionally, Todd Staub, EVP and Chief Administrative Officer, shared his intention to retire effective January 3, 2022.

title: Sparkling beverages soar in popularity among young Chinese
summary: Sparkling beverages are rapidly gaining popularity among young Chinese consumers, driven by health consciousness and a preference for low or no-sugar, calorie-free options. Brands like Genki Forest have successfully capitalized on this trend with innovative marketing and product development, leading to significant market growth. Despite challenges, such as a recent setback for Nongfu Spring, the carbonated water market in China is projected to continue its expansion, attracting major beverage companies.

title: ‘A space to be you’
summary: PepsiCo shared its 2020 DE&I Report, outlining an evolved global strategy focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion, aiming to achieve 50/50 parity between women and men in management and increase Black and Hispanic managerial representation by 2025. The company is investing significantly to support Black and Hispanic communities and businesses, while also implementing global programs for women and initiatives to foster an inclusive workplace culture for all employees.

title: Cheetos And Bad Bunny Drop Exclusive adidas Fashion Collection, Inviting Fans To Deja tu Huella (Leave Your Mark)
summary: Cheetos and global music superstar Bad Bunny have teamed up again for the "Deja tu Huella" campaign, launching an exclusive adidas fashion collection and the Deja tu Huella Estudiante Fund. The fashion line features Bad Bunny's style combined with Chester Cheetah's "Cheetos Look," with early access available to fans with Cheetle® on their fingertips. The Estudiante Fund will award $500,000 to ten students in the U.S. and Puerto Rico who are making a mark on their communities.

title: Coca-Cola spurs 42% revenue growth after returning to pre-pandemic marketing spend
summary: Coca-Cola reported a 42% increase in net revenues to $10.1 billion in Q2 2021, largely attributed to a return to pre-pandemic marketing spend levels. The company doubled its marketing investment year-over-year, focusing on innovation, effectiveness, and efficiency. This strategy led to significant growth, outpacing Q2 2019 revenues and earnings, with notable success in new product launches, targeted campaigns, and e-commerce.

title: Coca-Cola leans on early pandemic lessons to prepare for Delta variant hit
summary: Coca-Cola plans to combat the potential impact of the Delta variant by focusing on bigger brands and strengthening its supply chain, a strategy learned from the early pandemic. Despite new restrictions in some regions, the beverage giant exceeded second-quarter expectations and increased its full-year sales forecast, though sales in some Asian markets were affected. The company's vulnerability to venue closures makes it riskier than PepsiCo, according to analysts.

title: Energy market thrives during pandemic
summary: The energy drink and shot market experienced significant growth during the pandemic, with total energy drink sales up 9.2% in 2020 to approximately $14.3 billion. This growth is attributed to consumers relying on these products for energy to cope with increased workloads and challenges brought on by the pandemic. The market is also seeing innovation in flavors, functionality, and performance energy variations, although energy shots have experienced a decline due to reduced convenience store traffic and limited innovation.

title: Coca-Cola Is Changing the Flavor of a Soda. Again. (Published 2021)
summary: Coca-Cola is changing the flavor and look of Coke Zero Sugar, aiming for an "even more iconic Coke taste," a move that has already sparked consumer anxiety and comparisons to the 1985 "New Coke" debacle. This change to one of its popular diet spinoffs risks a backlash from consumers who remember the company's past controversial flavor alterations. The company is seeking to deliver a taste that more closely resembles "classic" Coke.

title: Boosted by Earnings Reports, S&P and Nasdaq Hit New Heights
summary: The S&P and Nasdaq indices reached new record highs due to strong earnings reports and the performance of mega-cap stocks, particularly in the technology sector. The article highlights how declining Treasury yields bolstered the growth thesis for mega-cap stocks, and discusses the Principal U.S. Mega-Cap ETF (USMC) as a way to capture these market movements. USMC tracks a modified equal-weighted index of mega-cap companies, focusing on minimizing volatility while seeking optimal outcomes.

title: Descartes continues customer-driven acquisition strategy with GreenMile purchase
summary: Descartes Systems Group acquired GreenMile, a cloud-based mobile routing solution specializing in food and beverage, for $30 million upfront plus a potential $10 million earn-out. This acquisition is part of Descartes' customer-driven strategy to enhance its global logistics network and improve customer offerings, particularly in last-mile delivery and supply chain operations. GreenMile's platform provides driver visibility, route optimization, and delivery performance management tools, benefiting clients like Coca-Cola and PepsiCo.

title: 2021 State of the Beverage Industry: Bottled water bubbling over with growth
summary: This article details the continued growth of the bottled water industry in 2021, highlighting its expansion even during the COVID-19 pandemic. It emphasizes the role of health and wellness attributes, convenience, and the increasing popularity of sparkling and enhanced waters in driving this growth. The report includes sales figures and insights from industry experts on market trends and innovation within the water category.

title: PepsiCo vows to cut soda sugar levels by 25% in EU by 2025
summary: PepsiCo Inc. announced plans to reduce sugar content in sodas and iced teas by 25% in the European Union by 2025 and 50% by 2030, while also launching more nutritious snacks. This initiative aims to cater to health-conscious consumers and respond to European taxes on sweetened beverages. The company projects its healthy snack category to become its fastest-growing food segment, aiming for a $1 billion portfolio by 2030.

title: PepsiCo expanding better-for-you offerings
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. continued to make progress toward its 2025 sustainability targets in 2020 by expanding its portfolio of products with reduced added sugars, sodium, and saturated fat. The company's 2020 Sustainability Report highlighted improvements in both its food and beverage portfolios, partly due to acquisitions and the growth of zero-sugar options.
