PepsiCo is on track to meet most of its targets for healthier product offerings.

title: PepsiCo 2020 Sustainability Report Showcases Progress Towards a More Sustainable Food System
summary: PepsiCo released its 2020 Sustainability Report, detailing progress on environmental and social initiatives despite global challenges, and outlining significant goals for 2030 and 2040. The report highlights advancements in sustainable sourcing, GHG emissions reduction, water-use efficiency, and packaging waste reduction. PepsiCo also announced further commitments including transitioning to 100% renewable electricity and a $570+ million Racial Equality Journey.

title: Laxman Narasimhan Elected to Verizon Board of Directors
summary: Verizon Communications Inc. announced the election of Laxman Narasimhan to its Board of Directors, effective July 1, 2021. Narasimhan, who is currently the CEO of Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc, brings extensive experience in consumer services, global operations, and strategic development from his previous roles at PepsiCo and McKinsey & Company. His appointment will increase Verizon's board membership to ten, with nine independent directors.

title: Partnerships key to PepsiCo’s plant-based innovation strategy
summary: PepsiCo's chief science officer, Rene Lammers, PhD, emphasizes that plant-based alternatives must be better than their conventional counterparts to drive significant behavioral shifts, highlighting partnerships as crucial for innovation. Danone North America's chief research and innovation officer, Takoua Debeche, PhD, discussed challenges and opportunities in plant-based dairy, stressing the need for improved taste, texture, and affordability, with future breakthroughs expected from biotech proteins and fermentation. Both executives underscored the importance of collaboration and scaling up production to meet future demand in the rapidly growing plant-based category.

title: PepsiCo to launch line of premium, non-alcoholic cocktail mixers
summary: PepsiCo is introducing Unmuddled, a new line of premium, non-alcoholic cocktail mixers, in early September. These mixers are made without artificial sweeteners and come in three varieties: Lemon Mint, Fiery Pineapple, and Spiced Mandarin. This launch follows PepsiCo's earlier introduction of Neon Zebra non-alcoholic cocktail mixers in March.

title: Profile: Beverage giant The Coca-Cola Company
summary: This article profiles The Coca-Cola Company, highlighting its history, global presence, and strategic approach to procurement, particularly in supplier diversity and sustainability. It details Coca-Cola's efforts in increasing spending with minority-owned businesses and implementing sustainable agricultural practices, emphasizing their commitment to strengthening local communities and fostering innovation. The company's unique supply chain management through Coca-Cola Bottlers’ Sales & Service (CCBSS) and various awards are also noted.

title: Two executives promoted at Utz
summary: Utz Brands, Inc. has promoted Shane Chambers to the newly created role of executive vice president and chief growth officer, and Mark Schreiber to executive vice president of sales and chief customer officer. Mr. Chambers will oversee marketing, branding, strategic growth, and M&A, while Mr. Schreiber will manage all sales aspects, trade marketing, revenue management, and category and shopper insights. These promotions aim to accelerate Utz's growth and evolution as a public company.

title: Coke and Pepsi eye new sustainability goals after years of failed promises
summary: Coca-Cola and PepsiCo are under increasing pressure from investors and customers to adopt more ambitious sustainability goals, particularly regarding reusable and refillable packaging, after decades of focusing on plastic recycling with limited success. Both companies have a history of setting and missing recycling targets, leading environmentalists to question the effectiveness of their new commitments. Despite past failures, the pandemic and growing demand for corporate responsibility are pushing these beverage giants to genuinely integrate sustainability into their core operations, beyond just recycling initiatives.

title: Coke market value falls $4bn after Ronaldo snub
summary: Coca-Cola's market value dropped by $4 billion after Cristiano Ronaldo removed two of their bottles from a Euro 2020 news conference, advocating for water instead. The incident, followed by a share price drop, prompted a response from Coca-Cola and Euro 2020 organizers acknowledging diverse drink preferences and the importance of sponsorship. This occurred days before Ronaldo became the leading scorer in European Championship history.

title: In Q3, Campbell Soup Falls From Pandemic High
summary: Campbell Soup Company reported disappointing Q3 earnings, with net sales down 11 percent and adjusted EBIT decreasing 27 percent, largely due to difficult year-over-year comparisons to pandemic-driven highs, rising inflation, and supply chain costs. The company's stock fell 8.5 percent, and it adjusted its full-year guidance downwards. Despite these challenges, Campbell Soup leadership expressed confidence in addressing issues and noted that nearly three-quarters of its portfolio gained or held market share.

title: Krispy Kreme reveals its plans for an initial public offering trading as DNUT. (Published 2021)
summary: Krispy Kreme, owned by JAB Holding, announced its plans for an initial public offering, with shares set to trade on the Nasdaq under the symbol DNUT. The company reported a 17 percent increase in sales to $1.1 billion in its last fiscal year, but also saw losses nearly double to $60 million as it invested in transformation efforts. This IPO marks Krispy Kreme's second public listing, having previously gone public in 2000 before being acquired by JAB in 2016.

title: General Mills’ Venture Capital Arm 301 INC To Regroup Under New Leadership
summary: General Mills' venture capital arm, 301 INC, is reorganizing under a new "disruptive growth" team led by Doug Martin, effective July 1. This new unit will integrate 301 INC with General Mills' internal innovation incubator Gworks and its innovation strategy team iSQUAD. The move aims to focus on long-term growth opportunities, particularly in health, wellness, and plant-based foods, and adapt to evolving consumer behaviors, such as direct-to-consumer delivery.

title: FAT Brands signs exclusive deal with Pepsico
summary: FAT Brands has signed an exclusive beverage partnership with PepsiCo Inc., expanding on an existing relationship to include several more of its restaurant concepts. The agreement will bring PepsiCo's beverage portfolio to domestic FAT Brands restaurants and introduce brand-specific offerings and culinary innovations. To celebrate, Pepsi is running a National Hamburger Day promotion, encouraging consumers to share photos with a Pepsi and any burger for a chance at a rebate.

title: PepsiCo: a company profile 1898 - 2021
summary: This article provides a company profile of PepsiCo from its founding in 1898 up to 2021, detailing its history, mergers, and product acquisitions. It highlights significant advertising campaigns, both successful and controversial, and discusses the company's commitment to ESG values and sustainability efforts, such as the PepsiCo BottleLoop recycling initiative.

title: Coca-Cola pulls plug on energy drink
summary: Coca-Cola has decided to discontinue its Coca-Cola Energy product in North America, little over a year after its launch. The company stated the decision is part of its strategy to focus on scaling successful innovations and being disciplined with products that do not gain sufficient traction. Coca-Cola Energy was initially launched in 25 countries and aimed to attract new consumers to the energy drink category.

title: Coca-Cola discontinues energy drink in N.America
summary: Coca-Cola Co announced it would discontinue its energy drink in North America, a product launched last year, as part of a strategy to streamline its portfolio and focus on faster-moving beverages. The decision comes as consumers return to traditional sodas and flavored sparkling waters post-pandemic, though Coca-Cola Energy will remain available in other global markets. The company emphasized a disciplined approach to investment, scaling successful innovations while divesting from products that lack traction.

title: Coke Discontinues Underperforming Energy Drink in North America
summary: Coca-Cola Co. is ceasing the sale of its Coca-Cola Energy drink in North America, little over a year after its launch. This decision is part of a broader strategy by the beverage giant to streamline its product portfolio. This follows earlier announcements regarding the discontinuation of Tab and Zico drink brands.

title: Pepsi Apple Pie and Candy Kraft Mac & Cheese: Why food giants are designing extreme new flavors
summary: Food and beverage giants like PepsiCo and Kraft Heinz are increasingly launching novel, extreme flavors, which are often remixes of familiar tastes. This trend, dubbed "new nostalgia," has been amplified by the COVID-19 pandemic as consumers seek both comfort and adventure while spending more time at home. These limited-time offerings often serve as marketing tools to generate social media buzz, even if they don't always result in direct sales, while others aim to drive sales through a blend of familiarity and novelty.

title: Mark Schiller, CEO of The Hain Celestial Group, Elected to Kontoor Brands Board of Directors
summary: Mark Schiller, President and CEO of The Hain Celestial Group, has been elected to Kontoor Brands' Board of Directors, effective immediately. He will also serve on the Audit Committee. Schiller brings extensive experience in leading and growing global consumer brands, with previous roles at Pinnacle Foods, PepsiCo, Tutor Time Learning Systems, Valley Recreation Products, and The Quaker Oats Company.

title: PepsiCo Appoints C.D. Glin as Vice President, Global Head of Philanthropy
summary: PepsiCo has announced the appointment of C.D. Glin as Vice President, Global Head of Philanthropy for The PepsiCo Foundation, effective May 17, 2021. Glin will be responsible for the Foundation's daily management, strategic direction, and engagement around its core pillars: Nutrition, Water, and Economic Resilience. He brings extensive experience from his previous role as President and CEO of the U.S. African Development Foundation and other global development initiatives.

title: Unilever, Coca-Cola and Colgate-Palmolive join AB InBev’s sustainability accelerator
summary: Unilever, Coca-Cola, and Colgate-Palmolive have joined AB InBev's 100+ Accelerator to fund and pilot sustainable supply chain innovations. This collaboration aims to scale existing projects and broaden the accelerator's reach through financial backing and real-world testing of technologies in their own supply chains. The initiative seeks to supercharge the adoption of sustainable solutions for a more sustainable future.

title: PepsiCo Launches Soulboost™, A Sparkling Water Beverage with Functional Ingredients, Adding to a Growing List of Consumer-Centric Innovations
summary: PepsiCo has launched Soulboost, a new sparkling water beverage with functional ingredients designed to support mental stamina or relaxation. The product comes in two varieties, Lift with panax ginseng and Ease with L-theanine, and is part of PepsiCo's strategy to meet evolving consumer wellness trends. This innovation further establishes PepsiCo's presence in the growing enhanced water market.

title: Campbell Soup Company transforms IT and boosts supply chain visibility with a single global SAP HANA environment on Azure
summary: Campbell Soup Company migrated its SAP environments to SAP HANA on Microsoft Azure to improve reliability, availability, and scalability, especially after acquiring Snyder’s-Lance. This transformation has significantly reduced downtime, made manufacturing more resilient, and provided deeper insights into its supply chain, supported by a strategic partnership with Microsoft and Khoj Information Technology. The company achieved substantial performance improvements and is now better positioned for future growth and acquisitions.

title: Why some food and drink companies lost sales during the COVID-19 pandemic
summary: During the COVID-19 pandemic, some food and drink companies experienced sales declines due to factors like reliance on already struggling categories (e.g., soda, meat), dependence on "on-the-go" consumption, and failure to adapt to changing consumer preferences for premium or value products. Companies with diversified portfolios or those that innovated into growing segments like plant-based foods and sparkling water fared better. The article highlights that while some sales may rebound post-pandemic, companies need to focus on innovation and relevance to maintain growth.

title: CEO Alison Watkins to exit Coca-Cola Amatil after Coca-Cola European Partners takeover
summary: Coca-Cola Amatil CEO Alison Watkins will depart the company following its acquisition by Coca-Cola European Partners, expected on May 10th. Watkins led CCA for nine years, overseeing significant operational changes and the negotiation of the CCEP takeover. Coca-Cola European Partners will also change its name to Coca-Cola Europacific Partners to reflect its expanded geographic footprint.

title: PepsiCo Announces 2030 Goal to Scale Regenerative Farming Practices Across 7 Million Acres
summary: PepsiCo has announced a new "Positive Agriculture" ambition to scale regenerative farming practices across 7 million acres by 2030, aiming to eliminate at least 3 million tons of greenhouse gas emissions. The initiative also includes improving the livelihoods of over 250,000 people in its agricultural supply chain and sustainably sourcing 100% of its key ingredients. This strategic move underscores PepsiCo's commitment to creating a more resilient and sustainable food system globally.

title: AACQ SPAC Stock Falls to Near All-Time Low—Will It Recover?
summary: The article discusses whether investors should buy AACQ stock before its merger with Origin Materials. AACQ is taking Origin Materials public in a $1.8 billion deal, with the transaction expected to close in Q2 2021. Despite recent dips, analysts rate AACQ as a "buy" due to Origin Materials' large addressable market and strong projected revenue growth, making the stock attractive for long-term investors.

title: Former Coca-Cola CEO, Neville Isdell On Courage, Conviction, And Respect
summary: This article highlights three key leadership lessons from former Coca-Cola CEO Neville Isdell: courage, conviction, and respect. It details how Isdell exemplified these traits through inspiring others, building alignment for growth, and deeply respecting traditions and individuals. The piece uses examples from his career, including the Coca-Cola turnaround, to illustrate these principles.

title: Georgia’s Voting Laws and Coca-Cola’s Complicated History
summary: This article examines Coca-Cola's complicated history with social and political issues, particularly in Georgia, its home state. It delves into the company's past dealings with racial justice movements and compares them to its recent, belated statement on Georgia's "Election Integrity Act." The piece explores the reactions from politicians, both Republican and Democrat, and discusses the challenges Coca-Cola faces in navigating these controversies while preserving its brand image.

title: How The Mastermind Behind LaCroix Puts The Fizz In Business
summary: The article profiles Nick Caporella, the CEO of National Beverage, detailing his unconventional approach to business that led to the success of LaCroix sparkling water. Despite competing with industry giants like Coca-Cola and PepsiCo, Caporella's unique marketing, innovative products, and strong leadership have driven significant growth and shareholder value for National Beverage. It also touches upon his personal journey from humble beginnings to becoming a successful entrepreneur.

title: Heres Why Keurig Dr Pepper Stocks 80% Rally Is Not Surprising
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) stock has seen an 80% rally since March 2020 lows, reaching almost $36 per share. This surge is attributed to the company's resilience during the pandemic, driven by its revenue mix focused on bottled beverages and coffee brewing systems, which benefited from increased at-home consumption. Despite the stock being 40% above its 2018 level, its valuation is considered fair, and continued revenue and earnings growth are expected to maintain its current price.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper to Cut Virgin Plastic Use 20% by 2025
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper has agreed to reduce its use of virgin plastic for packaging by 20% by 2025, following engagement with As You Sow. This commitment, which builds on previous sustainability goals, will involve increased use of recycled content, material redesign, and exploration of reuse models. The move is part of a broader effort initiated by As You Sow to encourage major consumer goods companies to reduce plastic pollution.

title: Pepsico Inc Q1 adjusted earnings Beat Estimates
summary: Pepsico Inc (PEP) reported robust Q1 earnings, with adjusted earnings per share of $1.21 significantly beating analysts' estimates of $1.12. The company's revenue also saw a healthy increase, rising 6.8% to $14.82 billion, up from $13.88 billion in the prior year. This financial performance indicates strong growth compared to the previous year.

title: A look at origin, trade secrets and owner of soft drink company Dr Pepper dubbed better than Coca-Cola
summary: This article delves into the origins, trade secrets, and ownership of the soft drink company Dr Pepper, following a tweet by Ann Coulter claiming it to be superior to Coca-Cola. It explores the drink's creation by Charles Alderton in 1885, the various theories behind its name, and the legal battles that helped it achieve national distribution. The article also discusses the closely guarded secret formula of Dr Pepper and its current ownership by Keurig Dr Pepper.

title: Philip Morris International Announces the Nomination of International Executives to Its Board of Directors
summary: Philip Morris International (PMI) has announced the nomination of two new members, Dr. Juan José Daboub and Mr. Shlomo Yanai, to its Board of Directors. Jacek Olczak has also been nominated to the Board and will assume the CEO role following the Annual Shareholders Meeting on May 5. These nominations aim to strengthen PMI's leadership as it continues its transformation towards a smoke-free future.

title: Snapple is getting a huge makeover, owner Keurig Dr. Pepper CEO reveals
summary: Keurig Dr. Pepper CEO Bob Gamgort announced a complete makeover for the iconic Snapple brand, focusing on new sustainable packaging made from 100% post-consumer recycled plastic. The company is refreshing its existing brands as part of a broader strategy following a strong financial year, which included market share gains and reduced financial obligations. This redesign will also save on shipping costs and reduce its carbon footprint, while maintaining the brand's great taste.

title: How to Read a Value Line Investment Survey
summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide on how to interpret a Value Line Investment Survey report, a valuable tool for stock analysis. It breaks down ten key sections found in a typical report, explaining their significance for investors. The guide uses Starbucks as an example to illustrate how to understand business descriptions, analyst assessments, Value Line ratings, stock price performance, historical financials, P/E ratios, capital structure, current position, annual rates, and quarterly financials.

title: PepsiCo subsidiary expands keto snack brand
summary: Hilo Life, a keto-friendly snack brand owned by PepsiCo's subsidiary Inviting Foods LLC, is launching new cheese puffs in cheddar and fiery hot flavors. These new products, along with their existing tortilla-style chips and snack mixes, aim to satisfy consumers looking for low-carb, flavorful snack options. The snack puffs contain 3 grams of net carbohydrates and 12 grams of protein per serving.

title: Ting Hsin Weighing $800 Million IPO of KFC’s Chinese Rival
summary: Ting Hsin International Group is considering a Hong Kong IPO for its mainland Chinese restaurant business, including fried chicken chain Dicos and Master Kong Chef’s Table. The IPO could raise around $800 million. Dicos is China's third-largest limited service restaurant chain by market share, behind KFC and McDonald's.

title: Beyond Meat Confirms 3-Year Deal With McDonald's, Major Collab With Yum! Brands KFC, Pizza Hut & Taco Bell
summary: Beyond Meat has announced significant global partnerships with McDonald's and Yum! Brands. The deal with McDonald's is a three-year agreement to be the preferred supplier of its McPlant burger and to explore other plant-based items. For Yum! Brands (KFC, Pizza Hut, Taco Bell), Beyond Meat will co-create new exclusive plant-based menu items, expanding on previous collaborations.

title: Slideshow: New products from PepsiCo, Campbell Soup, Real Food From the Ground Up
summary: This article showcases new spicy snack product launches from PepsiCo, Campbell Soup, and Real Food From the Ground Up. PepsiCo's Frito-Lay partnered with Jayson Tatum for a new Ruffles Flamin’ Hot BBQ flavor, while Campbell Soup introduced spicy options under Kettle Brand and Late July. Real Food From the Ground Up also expanded its cauliflower chips line with a spicy buffalo flavor.

title: PepsiCo Halted From Selling Electrolyte Drink Amid TM Claim
summary: A Texas federal judge has issued a temporary restraining order preventing PepsiCo Inc. from launching its new Gatorade product, Gatorlyte, on February 21st. The halt comes after a Mexican sports drink manufacturer claimed that Gatorlyte is a clone of its own electrolyte beverage. This legal action targets PepsiCo and specifically its Quaker Oats Company and The Gatorade Company subsidiaries.

title: Weyerhaeuser names new CFO
summary: Weyerhaeuser has appointed Nancy Loewe as its new Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, effective March 8. Loewe brings over 20 years of financial and operating experience from companies like Visa, Kimberly-Clark, and PepsiCo's Frito-Lay. Her appointment follows Russell Hagen moving to a new role as Senior Vice President and Chief Development Officer.

title: New food and beverage leader among exec changes at Target
summary: Target Corp. has appointed Rick Gomez as executive vice president and chief food and beverage officer, succeeding Stephanie Lundquist. This change is part of a series of executive leadership adjustments that also see Cara Sylvester named chief marketing and digital officer, Christina Hennington as chief growth officer, Jill Sando as chief merchandising officer, and Katie Boylan promoted to chief communications officer, aiming to strengthen Target's strategic leadership across various business areas.

title: PepsiCo Targets Shelf Analytics With New Tech Deal
summary: PepsiCo Inc. has partnered with e.fundamentals, a digital shelf analytics provider, to enhance its e-commerce performance. This strategic deal will support PepsiCo with critical digital shelf performance analytics technology and expertise across its brands in 10 European and U.K. markets. The partnership aims to optimize search positioning and product visibility on major retailers like Amazon, Tesco, and Carrefour, ensuring findability and growth in the rapidly evolving online grocery landscape.

title: Applebee’s Launches Cosmic Wings, a Cheeto-Flavored Chicken Virtual Brand With 1,300 Locations
summary: Applebee’s has launched a new virtual brand called Cosmic Wings, offering Cheeto-flavored chicken, which opened with 1,300 locations overnight. This move by Dine Brands Global Inc. raises questions about the future of the restaurant industry. The article suggests this rapid expansion of a virtual brand could be a significant trend.

Origin Materials, a startup creating sustainable plastic from sawdust, is going public through a SPAC merger with Artius Acquisition in a $1.8 billion deal. The company aims to replace petroleum-based plastics with carbon-negative materials, having already secured partnerships with major brands like Danone, Nestle, and PepsiCo. This transaction is expected to fully fund Origin Materials until it achieves EBITDA and free cash flow positive status by 2025, enabling the construction of its first full-scale commercial plant.

title: Origin Materials, Market Leader in Disruptive Materials Technology, to Combine with Artius, Creating First Publicly Traded Pure Play Carbon Negative Materials Company
summary: Origin Materials, a carbon-negative materials company, is combining with Artius Acquisition Inc., a SPAC, to become a publicly traded company under the ticker "ORGN." The transaction, valued at approximately $1.8 billion, is expected to provide $925 million in gross proceeds to fully fund Origin's growth and commercial production, leveraging its patented technology to replace petroleum-based materials with sustainable alternatives from non-food biomass. This move aims to accelerate the world's transition to sustainable materials and address a trillion-dollar market.

title: Lockdown living helps PepsiCo through pandemic, vaccine paves path to growth
summary: PepsiCo Inc. is predicting revenue growth in 2021, expecting pre-pandemic lifestyles to resume as economies reopen and COVID-19 vaccines are rolled out. The company navigated the health crisis better than Coca-Cola due to its reliance on grocery and retail channels, reporting an 8.8% rise in fourth-quarter revenue to $22.46 billion. PepsiCo anticipates a mid-single digit rise in annual organic revenue and a high-single digit increase in adjusted earnings, with some pandemic-driven changes like increased online shopping likely to persist.

title: PepsiCo renames racially insensitive Aunt Jemima brand as Pearl Milling Company
summary: PepsiCo has officially renamed its Aunt Jemima brand of pancake mixes and syrups to Pearl Milling Company, following concerns about racial stereotyping. The new branding will roll out in June, with the Aunt Jemima name continuing to be used until then but without the "character image." This change is part of a broader trend among food companies to address offensive brand imagery, spurred by increased attention to racial justice.

title: PepsiCo Unveils New Look for Aunt Jemima Brand
summary: PepsiCo has rebranded its Aunt Jemima product line as Pearl Milling Co., introducing a new name and imagery to replace the controversial logo. This change comes after Black Lives Matter protests prompted a reevaluation of brands with racially insensitive origins. The Pearl Milling Co. products will retain the familiar red packaging and will begin arriving in markets in June 2021, with a commitment of $1 million to uplift Black girls and women.

title: Aunt Jemima to rebrand as Pearl Milling Company this summer
summary: After 130 years, Aunt Jemima products will be rebranded as Pearl Milling Company, a move announced by PepsiCo-brand almost eight months after acknowledging the original name was "based on a racial stereotype." The new brand, developed with inclusivity in mind, will be available starting in June 2021, adopting the familiar red and yellow color scheme and including a label stating, "New Name Same Great Taste, Aunt Jemima." This change follows renewed criticism during racial justice protests in 2020 and commitments from PepsiCo to support the black community, with Mars Food also rebranding its Uncle Ben's rice products to Ben's Original.

title: ‘Aunt Jemima’ becomes ‘Pearl Milling Company,’ Salesforce announces permanent remote workforce, and Heineken to lay off 8,000
summary: This article covers several major corporate news items: the rebranding of "Aunt Jemima" to "Pearl Milling Company" amidst broader DEI initiatives, Salesforce's announcement of a permanent "work-from-anywhere" policy, and Heineken's plans to lay off 8,000 employees as part of its "EverGreen" strategy. It also touches on a viral Zoom court incident, a survey of catchy brand jingles, and Coca-Cola's new 100% recycled plastic bottles.

title: PepsiCo Officially Rebrands Aunt Jemima As Pearl Milling Company
summary: PepsiCo has officially rebranded its Aunt Jemima line to Pearl Milling Company as part of the company's "journey toward racial equality," acknowledging the brand's origins based on a racial stereotype. The new brand name will maintain the same product recipe and PepsiCo plans to invest $1 million to support Black girls and women, in addition to a broader $400 million investment in Black businesses and communities. The rebranding follows the historical context of the Aunt Jemima character being linked to a minstrel show figure and Nancy Green, the original spokeswoman.

title: 'Aunt Jemima' retires as PepsiCo acknowledges racial stereotype
summary: PepsiCo Inc. announced that its pancake mix and syrup products, formerly sold under the "Aunt Jemima" brand, will now be marketed under the new name "Pearl Milling Company." This decision follows the company's acknowledge of the brand's roots in a racial stereotype, particularly amid the national debate over racism and racial inequality in the United States. Pearl Milling Company will also commit $1 million to support Black girls and women, as part of PepsiCo's larger investment in Black communities.

title: Aunt Jemima No More; Pancake Brand Renamed Pearl Milling Company
summary: Quaker Oats, a subsidiary of PepsiCo Inc., is rebranding its Aunt Jemima pancake and syrup products to Pearl Milling Company, officially retiring the controversial Aunt Jemima image in June 2021. This decision comes a year after initial announcements and amid broader protests against systemic racism, recognizing the brand's origins in a racist stereotype. The new Pearl Milling Company brand will retain the iconic red and yellow packaging and is also committing $1 million to support Black girls and women, in addition to PepsiCo's larger investment in Black businesses and communities.

title: PepsiCo renames "Aunt Jemima" pancakes, syrup as "Pearl Milling Company"
summary: PepsiCo has announced that its "Aunt Jemima" pancake mix and syrup products will be rebranded as "Pearl Milling Company," acknowledging the former brand's roots in a racial stereotype. This decision follows national debates on racism and racial inequality in the United States, with new products expected to hit markets in June. PepsiCo also committed $1 million to support Black girls and women and plans to invest over $400 million over five years in Black communities.

title: Pepsico Renames ‘Aunt Jemima’ Pancakes, Syrup as ‘Pearl Milling Company’
summary: PepsiCo announced that its pancake mix and syrup products previously sold under the "Aunt Jemima" brand will now be marketed as "Pearl Milling Company." This change comes after the company acknowledged the former brand's roots in a racial stereotype following a national debate on racism. Pearl Milling Company products are expected to arrive in markets in June, and PepsiCo also committed $1 million to support Black girls and women.
source: VOA - Voice of America English News
source_domain: VOA - Voice of America English News

title: PepsiCo rebrands Aunt Jemima as Pearl Milling Company, coming June 2021
summary: PepsiCo announced it is rebranding its Aunt Jemima pancake and syrup line to Pearl Milling Company, effective June 2021, removing all references to the Aunt Jemima name and character due to its association with racial stereotypes. The new brand name harkens back to the original Pearl Milling Company, founded in 1888, which created the self-rising pancake mix that became Aunt Jemima. This change is part of PepsiCo's larger commitment to support the Black community and increase Black representation within the company.

title: PepsiCo announces rebrand of Aunt Jemima as Pearl Milling Company
summary: PepsiCo has announced that its Aunt Jemima brand will be rebranded as Pearl Milling Company, effective June. This change follows Quaker Oats' pledge in June 2020 to remove Aunt Jemima's image due to its origins as a racial stereotype and commit $5 million to support the Black community. The newly named Pearl Milling Company will also commit an additional $1 million towards causes uplifting Black women and girls.

title: Aunt Jemima reveals new name: Pearl Milling Company
summary: Quaker Oats has renamed its Aunt Jemima products to Pearl Milling Company, following protests over systemic racism and concerns about the brand's origins based on a racial stereotype. PepsiCo, the owner, has pledged over $400 million to empower Black businesses and communities, with Pearl Milling Company committing $1 million to Black girls and women. This rebranding reflects a broader trend among companies reconsidering potentially offensive branding.

title: Aunt Jemima brand gets a new name: Pearl Milling Company
summary: Quaker Oats announced that its Aunt Jemima brand pancake mix and syrup will be renamed Pearl Milling Company, with packaging officially changing in June. This decision follows Quaker's announcement last June to retire the Aunt Jemima brand due to its origins based on a racial stereotype. The new name, Pearl Milling Company, harks back to the 1888 originator of self-rising pancake mix, and Quaker is also donating $1 million to groups empowering Black women and girls.

title: PepsiCo takes Rice-A-Roni into new convenience category
summary: PepsiCo is expanding its Rice-A-Roni brand into the microwaveable rice category with new Heat & Eat Rice, available in three flavors. This move aims to cater to consumers with busy schedules seeking convenient and quick meal solutions. The new product is ready in 90 seconds and is now available nationwide.

title: Beer Run: As Budweiser Leaves Super Bowl, Rival Brews Battle For Attention
summary: As Budweiser opts out of a national Super Bowl ad for the first time in 37 years, rival brewers like Diageo, Boston Beer, and MolsonCoors are seizing the opportunity to market their brands. They are utilizing local ad inventory, digital campaigns, and social media to circumvent Anheuser-Busch InBev's long-standing national ad exclusivity during the game. This shift reflects a broader trend of advertisers seeking more cost-effective and targeted ways to reach consumers beyond expensive national Super Bowl spots.

title: Post Holdings leads $12.5M investment in PeaTos
summary: Post Holdings Inc. has led a $12.5 million Series B funding round for PeaTos, a company that produces pea-based versions of popular snacks. This investment is Post Holdings' first in the plant-based foods space and aims to help PeaTos expand its brand, forge new partnerships, and increase its retail reach. The move highlights the growing competition and investment in the plant-based snack segment, providing PeaTos with more resources in its "David vs. Goliath battle" against larger snack companies like Frito-Lay.

title: Super Bowl Still Means Big Q1 Beer Volumes, But Full Year Impact Lessens
summary: The Super Bowl continues to drive significant beer sales volumes in Q1, topping $1.2 billion in traditional beer sales in 2020, along with substantial hard seltzer and FMB sales. However, its overall impact on annual beer sales volume has been declining since 2016, with Super Bowl week falling to 39th in sales volume ranking in 2020. Despite this, major beer companies like Anheuser-Busch InBev, Molson Coors, Constellation Brands, Heineken USA, and Diageo are investing heavily in regional advertising and marketing campaigns during the game to capture consumer attention.

title: Pringles® Releases Out-Of-This-World 2021 Big Game Flavor Stacking Ad
summary: Pringles is launching its fourth consecutive Big Game ad, "Space Return," which showcases the humorous consequences of getting distracted by Flavor Stacking Pringles crisps. The 30-second spot features astronauts and mission control personnel becoming so engrossed in stacking Pringles that they forget their responsibilities. The campaign will be supported by an integrated marketing effort, encouraging viewers to create their own flavor combinations at home.

title: PepsiCo and Beyond Meat® Establish The PLANeT Partnership, LLC, a Joint Venture to Introduce New Plant-Based Protein Offerings
summary: PepsiCo (NASDAQ: PEP) and Beyond Meat (NASDAQ: BYND) have formed a joint venture called The PLANeT Partnership, LLC, to develop, produce, and market plant-based protein snack and beverage products. This partnership aims to combine Beyond Meat's expertise in plant-based protein with PepsiCo's marketing, commercial capabilities, and distribution network. The collaboration seeks to create new sustainable food options and expand PepsiCo's portfolio of nutritious products while capitalizing on the growing plant-based market.

title: Beyond Meat surges on PepsiCo plant-based snack deal
summary: Beyond Meat's shares surged to an 18-month high after announcing a joint venture with PepsiCo Inc to develop and sell plant-based snacks and beverages. This partnership grants Beyond Meat access to PepsiCo's extensive distribution and marketing networks, allowing for expansion into new product categories. Analysts, however, question the true market potential for some of the new plant-based snack products, despite the positive stock reaction.

title: PepsiCo doubles down on climate goal and pledges net-zero emissions by 2040
summary: PepsiCo announced an ambitious climate goal to achieve net-zero emissions by 2040, a decade earlier than the Paris Agreement target. The company aims to reduce absolute greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by over 40% by 2030, focusing on sustainable agriculture, packaging, distribution, and operations. This commitment builds on PepsiCo's strategy to source 100% renewable electricity in its U.S. operations and expand this globally.
source: The World Business Council for Sustainable Development (WBCSD)
source_domain: The World Business Council for Sustainable Development (WBCSD)

title: PepsiCo suspends all political contributions
summary: PepsiCo Inc announced on Friday its decision to suspend all political contributions, joining numerous other companies in re-evaluating or halting donations after a move to challenge President-elect Joe Biden's victory. This decision comes in the wake of the U.S. Capitol being stormed by supporters of former President Donald Trump, an event that resulted in five deaths. PepsiCo stated it is conducting a full review to ensure future contributions align with its company values.

title: McCormick buys natural flavorings company FONA International for $710M
summary: McCormick & Co. has acquired natural flavorings provider FONA International for $710 million, significantly expanding its reach into growing categories like performance nutrition and health and wellness. This acquisition follows McCormick's purchase of Cholula hot sauce for $800 million in November, showcasing its strategy to broaden its portfolio of flavors, spices, seasonings, and condiments. FONA, with annual sales of about $114 million, is expected to see mid-to-high-single-digit growth and will play a role in McCormick's focus on health and wellness ingredients.

title: Coca-Cola to cut 2,200 jobs — most in the US — as part of restructuring
summary: Coca-Cola is cutting 2,200 jobs globally, with 1,200 in the U.S., through buyouts and layoffs as part of a restructuring plan accelerated by the pandemic. The company expects severance costs to range from $350 million to $550 million. This move is part of a larger strategy initiated by CEO James Quincey to streamline operations, focus on faster-growing brands, and adapt to evolving consumer tastes, including reducing its business units and discontinuing about 200 brands.

title: Why Kraft Heinz leaders say their new strategy will drive growth beyond the pandemic
summary: Kraft Heinz leaders are confident their new business strategy, rolled out in September 2020, will drive growth beyond the pandemic, despite initial delays and shifts in consumer behavior. The strategy focuses on reinvesting in brands, using a platform-based approach, and prioritizing consumer needs, which executives believe will lead to sustained success. This approach has already seen positive results in sales growth and consumer rediscovery of trusted brands during the pandemic.

title: Coca-Cola kicks off massive agency review to 'fundamentally transform' its marketing
summary: Coca-Cola has launched a comprehensive global review of its media and creative planning and buying practices, along with its agency appointments. This initiative aims to enhance effectiveness and efficiency across various marketing investments, including media, creative, and production, as part of the company's digital transformation. While expected to generate cost savings, the primary goal is a fundamental redesign of its marketing model and consolidation of third-party agencies.

title: Companies Can Address the Impact of Single-Use Plastics in the Era of COVID-19
summary: Despite a temporary surge in single-use plastic consumption due to the COVID-19 pandemic, companies like Kimberly-Clark are continuing to push forward with long-term commitments to reduce plastic waste. The article highlights the significant environmental and economic costs of marine plastic pollution and details the strategies companies are employing, including product innovation, partnerships, and maintaining a long-term sustainability vision. It emphasizes the urgent need for collaboration between industry leaders, NGOs, and consumers to address the global plastic crisis.

title: Rabobank recognizes General Mills, PepsiCo for leadership
summary: Rabobank recognized PepsiCo, General Mills, and Imperfect Foods at its annual North America Leadership Awards for their leadership in industry stewardship, sustainability, and innovation. PepsiCo received the Award for Excellence in Food & Ag Leadership for its corporate citizenship and COVID-19 response. General Mills was honored with the Leadership in Sustainability award for its regenerative agriculture projects and commitment to renewable energy.

title: PepsiCo Announces Timing and Availability of Fourth Quarter and Full-Year 2020 Financial Results
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. announced the timing and availability of its fourth quarter and full-year 2020 financial results. The company will issue its financial results and related information on Thursday, February 11, 2021, through a press release, 10-K filing, prepared management remarks, and a live Q&A session for analysts.

title: PepsiCo leases nearly 1M industrial square feet at Logistics Park Kansas City
summary: PepsiCo has leased nearly 1 million square feet at Logistics Park Kansas City for a new Gatorade distribution center. The facility, Inland Port VII, was developed by NorthPoint Development and completed earlier in the year. This move highlights NorthPoint's reputation in industrial space development.

title: The Coca-Cola Company, PepsiCo, and Nestlé Named Top Plastic Polluters for Third Year
summary: For the third consecutive year, The Coca-Cola Company, PepsiCo, and Nestlé have been identified as the world's top plastic polluters, according to a report by Break Free From Plastic. The report, "BRANDED Vol III: Demanding Corporate Accountability for Plastic Pollution," highlights the continued reliance of these corporations on single-use plastics and the detrimental impact on communities, particularly in the Global South, despite their claims to address the plastic crisis. Activists are calling for these companies to end their addiction to single-use plastics and prioritize robust reuse systems.

title: PepsiCo to transition to 100% recycled PET in EU
summary: PepsiCo announced it will accelerate its goal to use 100% recycled PET for its Pepsi brand beverage bottles in nine EU markets by 2022, a significant leap from its earlier 2030 target of 50% rPET usage. This transition is expected to eliminate over 70,000 metric tons of virgin plastic annually and reduce carbon emissions per bottle by approximately 40%. The company attributes this accelerated progress to innovations in recycled PET use for carbonated drinks, improved aesthetics of recycled plastic, and increased market availability of recycled materials.

title: Bang Energy sues PepsiCo
summary: Bang Energy has filed a lawsuit against PepsiCo, alleging "gross misconduct" and failure to meet contractual obligations under their distribution agreement. Vital Pharmaceuticals Inc., Bang Energy's parent company, terminated PepsiCo as its exclusive distributor in October due to performance concerns. PepsiCo, however, asserts it remains the exclusive distributor through October 2023 and denies any minimum purchase commitment in the agreement.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper Grows DSD Network with Acquisitions
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is expanding its direct-store delivery (DSD) network through agreements with The Red River Beverage Group and The Made-Rite Company. This acquisition grants KDP manufacturing, sales, and distribution rights for key brands in 37 counties across Texas and Louisiana, expected to reach 1.5 million consumers. The move aims to enhance speed to market and ensure a competitive route-to-market for KDP's brands.

title: General Mills to Close Yogurt Plant in California
summary: General Mills announced the closure of its yogurt manufacturing facility in Carson, California, as part of a restructuring plan to consolidate production and optimize operations. The company expects to incur about $130 million in expenses and anticipates completing the restructuring by the end of fiscal 2021. Despite a drop in share value, General Mills reaffirmed its key financial targets for May 26, 2019, focusing on consumer-first strategy and global growth priorities.
source: Abasto, Food and Beverage Industry News
source_domain: Abasto, Food and Beverage Industry News

title: Coca-Cola Is Open to Inorganic Growth in Still Beverages
summary: Coca-Cola is looking towards inorganic growth, specifically acquisitions, to expand its presence in the high-growth still beverages market. This strategy is in response to the continued underperformance of carbonated soft drinks compared to categories like bottled water, ready-to-drink coffee, and energy drinks. The company has already made strategic moves, including the acquisition of Innocent Drinks and a stake in Suja Juice and Monster Beverage.

title: PepsiCo Appoints Dr. Pietro Antonio Tataranni as Chief Medical Officer
summary: PepsiCo announced the appointment of Dr. Pietro Antonio Tataranni as its global Chief Medical Officer. Dr. Tataranni will continue to oversee the company's COVID-19 response efforts and lead its Life Sciences strategy and R&D Fellows Program. He has been with PepsiCo since September 2018, previously serving as Deputy Chief Scientific Officer and Senior Vice President of Life Sciences, bringing extensive expertise from roles at Sanofi, Merck, and NIH.

title: Slideshow: New products from PepsiCo, Remedy Organics, Uncle Matt’s
summary: Amidst the COVID-19 pandemic, beverage manufacturers like PepsiCo, Uncle Matt's Organic, Remedy Organics, Cloud Water Brands, and Elegance Brands Inc. are launching new immunity-boosting products. These new offerings include electrolyte waters, orange juices, plant-based protein drinks, sparkling beverages, and energy drinks, all fortified with vitamins, zinc, and other immune-supporting ingredients to meet increased consumer demand for health and wellness products. The article highlights specific product details, ingredients, and company statements regarding their immune-focused innovations.

title: PepsiCo introduces direct-to-consumer e-commerce sites
summary: PepsiCo has launched two direct-to-consumer e-commerce platforms, PantryShop.com and Snacks.com, in response to increased online shopping due to the coronavirus pandemic. PantryShop.com offers bundled product collections, while Snacks.com allows consumers to curate snack packages from Frito-Lay brands. This initiative aims to provide consumers with easy and fast access to their favorite PepsiCo products delivered directly to their homes.

title: Slideshow: The spicy revolution
summary: The food industry is experiencing a "spicy revolution" with fiery flavors appearing in a wide range of products, from snacks to sweets, driven by McCormick Flavor Solutions' Flavor Forecast. This trend includes extreme heat offerings using peppers like ghost peppers and Carolina Reaper, brand collaborations creating unique spicy products, and sweet-heat combinations balancing spice with sweet ingredients. CPG manufacturers and restaurants are innovating with these profiles, launching new items across various categories.

title: PepsiCo names ex-Tesco CEO Dave Lewis to board
summary: PepsiCo has announced that former Tesco CEO Dave Lewis will join its board of directors, effective November 13, 2020. Lewis will also serve as a member of the audit committee. This appointment adds significant retail leadership experience to PepsiCo's board.

title: PepsiCo working to meet sustainability goals
summary: PepsiCo is actively working to achieve its sustainability goals, aiming for all plastic packaging to be recyclable, compostable, or biodegradable by 2025. The company plans to increase its use of recycled content by 25 percent and is investing in recycling infrastructure, consumer education, and bioplastics. These efforts include packaging its Lifewtr brand in 100 percent recycled PET and using refillable bottles in various regions.

title: PepsiCo Elects Dave Lewis To Board of Directors
summary: PepsiCo announced the election of Dave Lewis as an independent member to its Board of Directors, effective November 13, 2020. Lewis brings extensive experience from his previous roles as Group Chief Executive Officer of Tesco PLC and various leadership positions at Unilever PLC. His expertise in consumer centricity, retail strategy, operations, and supply chain management is expected to be valuable for PepsiCo's continued growth.

title: Louisville's KFC Yum Center awards PepsiCo Inc. pouring rights in 10-year contract
summary: PepsiCo Inc. has secured a 10-year contract for pouring rights at Louisville's KFC Yum Center, replacing The Coca-Cola Co. The agreement also includes exclusive marketing rights and the transformation of the arena’s outdoor plaza into Pepsi Plaza. The partnership will also involve community programs through Pepsi's "Pepsi Stronger Together" initiative, focusing on education and youth in Louisville.

title: Coca-Cola emerges from lockdown blues as out-of-home demand recovers
summary: Coca-Cola reported better-than-expected revenue and profit in the third quarter as the reopening of theaters and restaurants boosted "away-from-home" demand, which had significantly declined during earlier lockdowns. Despite concerns about potential regional lockdowns due to rising COVID-19 cases, the company is streamlining its product portfolio and noted increased consumer purchases of sparkling soft drinks and juices from grocery stores.

title: Ball Corp. And Kroenke Sports Launch Expansive Partnership Including Denver Arena Naming Rights
summary: Ball Corporation and Kroenke Sports & Entertainment have announced a comprehensive partnership, which includes the renaming of Denver's Pepsi Center to Ball Arena. This deal provides Ball Corp. with a significant platform to promote its new recyclable aluminum cups across KSE's global sports properties, including the LA Rams and Arsenal F.C. The environmentally-focused partnership aims to boost aluminum recycling rates and replace disposable plastic cups with sustainable alternatives.

title: Keurig is a machine: How the beverage giant is leveraging A.I. to fuel growth
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) has shown impressive market share growth in the beverage industry, leveraging a broad product portfolio and strategic use of AI to adapt to changing consumer habits during COVID-19. CEO Bob Gamgort's vision of combining hot and cold beverage segments and utilizing data from connected Keurig brewers allowed KDP to rapidly identify and respond to shifts in demand, such as increased at-home coffee consumption and preferences for large packs of canned soft drinks. This strategy has resulted in strong revenue and profit growth, positioning KDP for future acquisitions and continued expansion.

title: The scoop on soup: Our latest soup innovations
summary: Campbell's announces a range of new soup innovations for the soup season, including 14 new and reformulated Well Yes! soups focusing on nutritious and real ingredients. They also introduce Campbell's Slow Kettle Style Soups with a Crunch, Campbell’s Tomato A-Z’s for kids, and new twists on classics like SpaghettiOs with Chicken Meatballs and new Swanson Sipping Bone Broth flavors. These innovations aim to offer delicious, convenient, and healthy options for diverse consumer preferences.

title: Coca-Cola retiring Tab, Zico brands
summary: The Coca-Cola Co. is discontinuing Tab diet soda and Zico coconut water, among other brands, as part of a portfolio refresh aimed at focusing on products with higher growth potential. This move, which was accelerated by the COVID-19 pandemic, seeks to free up resources for more scalable brands and streamline their offerings due to changing consumer behaviors and supply chain challenges. The company plans to invest more in brands like Minute Maid, Simply, and Topo Chico.

title: Gibu Thomas Named President of Estée Lauder’s Online Division
summary: Gibu Thomas has been appointed President of Estée Lauder's Online division, succeeding Dennis McEniry who will retire at the end of 2020. Thomas, formerly Senior Vice President and Global Head of E-Commerce at PepsiCo, will report to Fabrizio Freda and is tasked with accelerating growth across ELC's digital channels and omnichannel platforms. McEniry is credited with expanding ELC Online from four U.S.-based websites to a global presence in over 50 countries, contributing 22% to the company's net sales in fiscal 2020.

title: Estée Lauder Names New President of ELC Online
summary: The Estée Lauder Companies announced that Dennis McEniry, president of ELC's Online division, will retire at the end of the calendar year after almost 20 years. Gibu Thomas will succeed him as President, ELC Online, effective November 16, 2020. Thomas will be responsible for ELC's global online business, leading e-commerce and omnichannel platforms, and partnering with other executives to drive an interconnected omnichannel strategy and integrate analytic capabilities.

title: Coca-Cola will stop making Tab diet soda, company announces
summary: The Coca-Cola Company announced it will retire Tab diet soda and other "underperforming products" by the end of the year as part of a portfolio rationalization. Tab, Coke's first diet soda launched in 1963, has seen declining sales, accounting for less than 0.03% of Coca-Cola's sales by 2017. The company plans to reallocate resources from these discontinued brands to growing brands like Diet Coke and Coca-Cola Zero Sugar, and to fund promising innovations.

title: Lauren Hobart appointed to Yum! Brands board
summary: Lauren R. Hobart, president of Dick’s Sporting Goods Inc., has been appointed to Yum! Brands Inc.'s board of directors, effective Nov. 12. Her leadership experience and knowledge from retail and consumer products companies, particularly her work in digital transformation and e-commerce at Dick's, are highlighted as valuable assets for Yum! Brands' growth and innovation.

title: PepsiCo Provides Update on US$1 Billion Green Bond
summary: PepsiCo released its 2020 Green Bond Report, detailing the allocation of proceeds from its first US$1 billion Green Bond issued in October 2019. As of December 31, 2019, $447 million has been allocated to sustainability initiatives including procuring recycled PET, transitioning to lower-carbon fleets, building a green R&D facility, and improving water-use efficiency in plants. This report highlights PepsiCo's commitment to advancing its sustainability agenda and contributing to the UN's Sustainable Development Goals.

title: The Post-Pandemic Rules of Talent Management
summary: This article discusses how rapid digital transformation has reshaped the landscape of work and talent management over the past decades. It highlights the significant advancements in areas like video conferencing, digital collaboration, cloud-based connectivity, and data-centric decision-making driven by AI. The authors, Becky Frankiewicz and Tomas Chamorro-Premuzic, explore these "post-pandemic rules" of talent management that reflect a drastically different work environment compared to the mid-20th century.

title: Loop Industries (LOOP) stock: Tapping into infinite plastic recycling
summary: Loop Industries aims to overcome the limitations of mechanical recycling through its patented chemical recycling technology, which allows for unlimited plastic recycling and substitutes virgin plastics. The company, which is pre-revenue, has already secured packaging deals with major consumer brands like PepsiCo and Coca-Cola, aligning with global sustainability targets. Loop Industries plans to expand its operations globally through partnerships and eventually license its technology as a key growth driver.

title: PepsiCo Subsidiary Plans $30M Beverage Plant Expansion
summary: PepsiCo subsidiary SVC Manufacturing Inc. is investing $30 million to expand its Gatorade plant in Osceola County, FL, by adding a new manufacturing line. This expansion is expected to create 40 new jobs and is supported by tax incentives from Osceola County. The project aims to boost Gatorade production and support business growth in Florida and beyond, with work commencing in 2020 and operations slated for mid-2021.

title: SodaStream Announces The Launch Of bubly drops™, The First North America Partnership Since Joining PepsiCo
summary: SodaStream announced the launch of bubly drops™, marking its first North America partnership since joining PepsiCo. This collaboration brings bubly™ brand's flavors to the SodaStream platform, allowing consumers to create customized sparkling beverages at home using calorie and sweetener-free drops. The product will be widely available in January 2021, with an early release of a limited edition kit in November 2020, offering a fun, healthy, and sustainable sparkling water option.

title: Coca-Cola to discontinue Zico coconut water and consider other cuts
summary: Coca-Cola is discontinuing its Zico coconut water brand and considering cutting other less-popular versions of Coke and Diet Coke as part of an effort to streamline its portfolio. This move follows ongoing efforts by the beverage giant to focus on offerings with large-scale potential and improve operational efficiency during the pandemic. Brands like Diet Coke Feisty Cherry, Coke Life, and Hubert's Lemonade are under review, while the company also plans buyouts for 4,000 employees as part of a broader restructuring.

title: PepsiCo reports 5.3% Q3 revenue gain, Frito-Lay up 6%
summary: PepsiCo Inc. reported a 5.3% increase in Q3 revenue, reaching $18 billion, driven by strong global snack and beverage sales. Earnings per share jumped 10% to $1.65, and the company projects a 4% annual revenue rise, exceeding analyst expectations. Frito-Lay North America, Quaker Foods North America, and North America Beverages all saw a 6% gain in sales.

title: PepsiCo Sales Snap Back From Pandemic
summary: PepsiCo Inc. reported a 5.3% revenue growth for the latest quarter, driven by a rebound in its beverage business and sustained strong demand for snacks and packaged foods during the pandemic. The company is also exploring a potential venture into alcoholic beverages. This positive performance indicates a recovery from previous pandemic-related challenges, with consumers resuming purchases of sodas at convenience stores.

title: La Colombe Coffee Roasters Signs 10-Year Distribution Pact with Molson Coors
summary: La Colombe Coffee Roasters has signed a 10-year exclusive distribution agreement with Molson Coors Beverage Company for its ready-to-drink coffee products, initially targeting drug and convenience channels with plans for broader expansion. This partnership aims to significantly boost La Colombe's market presence, particularly in retail sectors where it currently has limited reach, building on its strong sales growth that has outpaced the RTD coffee category. Molson Coors benefits by adding an "above-premium" non-alcoholic offering to its expanding portfolio, marking another step in its strategy beyond traditional alcoholic beverages.

title: PepsiCo (PEP) Locks Distribution Deal for evian in Canada
summary: PepsiCo's subsidiary, PepsiCo Beverages Canada, has signed an exclusive distribution agreement with Danone Waters of America to distribute evian natural spring water across Canada starting January 2021. This partnership aligns with PepsiCo's hydration strategy and is expected to expand evian's reach and accelerate its growth. The deal comes as beverage companies like PepsiCo, Coca-Cola, Molson Coors, and Boston Beer are revamping their product portfolios to meet altered consumer preferences, particularly focusing on health and wellness offerings.

title: Will Pepsi’s Driftwell ‘ScaleWell’?
summary: The article analyzes the market viability of PepsiCo's new sleep aid beverage, Driftwell, examining its pricing, placement, product attributes, and promotional strategy. It contrasts Driftwell's approach with Pepsi's traditional mass-market successes like Bubly, highlighting the challenges of scaling a niche functional beverage. The author suggests that for Driftwell to succeed, Pepsi will need patience, effective consumer learning, and a focus on building credibility for its active ingredients to eventually target the broader market of OTC sleeping pills.

title: B&G Foods to remove Cream of Wheat Black chef image from packaging
summary: B&G Foods announced it would remove the Black chef image from its Cream of Wheat porridge mix packaging due to its connection to racially insensitive depictions. This move follows similar decisions by other companies like Mars Inc and PepsiCo Inc to rebrand products with imagery rooted in racist stereotypes. New packaging for Cream of Wheat is expected to be rolled out in the first quarter of 2021.

title: B&G Foods to remove Cream of Wheat Black chef image from packaging
summary: B&G Foods announced it would remove the image of a Black chef from its Cream of Wheat packaging, following similar moves by other companies. While the image may have been based on a real person, Frank White, consumers found it reminiscent of offensive earlier depictions. New packaging for Cream of Wheat is expected to be rolled out in the first quarter of 2021.

title: PGA of America and Ryder Cup Europe Partner with PepsiCo to become Worldwide Supplier to the Ryder Cup
summary: PepsiCo has expanded its partnership with the PGA of America and Ryder Cup Europe, becoming the "Worldwide Supplier" to the Ryder Cup through 2025. This multi-year agreement builds on a relationship with the PGA of America that started in 1993, making PepsiCo the official soft drink, iced tea, sports drink, and bottled water provider for various PGA events and now the Ryder Cup. The collaboration also aims to drive innovation and sustainability initiatives within golf.

title: Campbell’s soup? Canned pumpkin? What’s missing from your grocery store shelves during the pandemic, and why
summary: This article explores why certain grocery items like Campbell's soup, canned pumpkin, and popular soft drinks have been missing from store shelves during the coronavirus pandemic. Manufacturers like Campbell Soup Co. and Frito-Lay streamlined their product offerings to focus on high-demand items, while issues with processing and timing affected other categories. The situation highlights shifts in production priorities and consumer purchasing behavior during the pandemic.

title: PepsiCo Aims to Use 100% Renewable Electricity by 2030
summary: PepsiCo has announced a new target to source 100% renewable electricity across its company-owned operations globally by 2030 and across its entire value chain by 2040. This transition could reduce approximately 2.5 million metric tons of greenhouse gas emissions by 2040. The company plans to achieve this through a diversified portfolio of solutions, including Power Purchase Agreements and on-site renewable projects, and has joined the RE100 initiative.

title: Stacy's Rise Project Expands Commitment to Female Founders; Partners with Hello Alice to Fund $150,000 in Grants to Black Women Business Owners
summary: The Stacy's Rise Project, in partnership with Hello Alice, is expanding its program to support an additional 15 Black female founders with $150,000 in business grants, professional advertising, and executive coaching. This initiative addresses the significant disparity in venture capitalist funding for women of color and aims to help these entrepreneurs overcome unique challenges identified in a recent survey. The program will also include a complimentary membership in The BOSS Network and will promote the businesses of the selected founders.

title: PepsiCo creator Donald Kendall passes away
summary: Donald M. Kendall, the visionary behind the merger of Pepsi-Cola and Frito-Lay to form PepsiCo Inc., passed away at 99. Kendall served as PepsiCo's leader from 1963 to 1986, expanding its global presence into China and the Soviet Union, diversifying its portfolio with fast-food chains like Taco Bell, KFC, and Pizza Hut, and pioneering diet sodas. His leadership transformed PepsiCo into a global food and beverage giant.

title: PepsiCo Targets 100% Renewable Electricity Globally
summary: PepsiCo announced a new target to source 100% renewable electricity across its company-owned operations globally by 2030 and across its entire franchise and third-party operations by 2040. This initiative aims to reduce approximately 2.5 million metric tons of greenhouse gas emissions by 2040 and builds on the company's existing efforts, including joining the RE100 initiative. PepsiCo plans to achieve this goal through a diversified portfolio of solutions, including Power Purchase Agreements and expanding onsite renewable projects.

title: PepsiCo's Global Business Operations Transitioning To 100% Renewable Electricity By 2040
summary: PepsiCo Inc. (PEP) announced a new target to source 100% renewable electricity across all company-owned and controlled operations globally by 2030, and across its entire franchise and third-party operations by 2040. This move makes PepsiCo a part of RE100, an initiative led by the Climate Group. The transition is projected to reduce approximately 2.5 million metric tons of greenhouse gas emissions by 2040, and PepsiCo is on track to source 56% of its electricity from renewable sources globally by the end of 2020.

title: The new Kraft Heinz is coming into focus
summary: Kraft Heinz CEO Miguel Patricio and his team have outlined a new strategy to return the company to growth, reorganizing its brand portfolio into six consumer platforms. The strategy focuses on balancing scale with agility, prioritizing investment in "grow" brands, and rethinking product development with an emphasis on innovation and renovation. The company anticipates low single-digit organic net sales growth, 2% to 3% adjusted EBITDA growth, and 4% to 6% adjusted earnings per share growth from these changes.

title: Red Lobster and PepsiCo collaborating on menu items
summary: Red Lobster has partnered with PepsiCo to introduce the "Dew Garita," a cocktail made with Mtn Dew, available at select restaurants and nationwide by year-end. The collaboration extends to other menu items featuring Frito-Lay and Quaker brands, leveraging PepsiCo's extensive beverage portfolio already served at Red Lobster. Both companies aim to enhance dining experiences through innovative food and beverage pairings.

title: Red Lobster® and PepsiCo Kick Off New Relationship with the DEW® Garita - the First Official MTN DEW® Cocktail
summary: Red Lobster and PepsiCo are partnering to create new menu items, starting with the DEW® Garita, the first official MTN DEW® cocktail, which will roll out nationwide by the end of 2020. This collaboration aims to leverage their iconic brands for food and beverage innovation and shared sustainability goals, including exploring more sustainable packaging and distribution techniques. The partnership will also bring a broad range of PepsiCo beverages to Red Lobster restaurants.

title: PepsiCo wants to help the caffeinated masses get better sleep with its new relaxation drink
summary: PepsiCo is launching Driftwell, a new relaxation drink designed to help consumers sleep better. This calorie- and sugar-free beverage contains L-theanine and magnesium and will be available online in December and in stores in early 2021. The move into functional beverages addresses the growing demand for products that offer health benefits beyond basic nutrition, especially given increased stress levels during the pandemic.

title: PepsiCo expands senior leadership team
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. has appointed Athina Kanioura as executive vice president and chief strategy and transformation officer. In this role, she will lead the company's digitalization and data strategy and oversee a companywide transformation aimed at accelerating growth and identifying opportunities for cost efficiency. Ms. Kanioura joins PepsiCo from Accenture, bringing expertise in artificial intelligence and analytics to drive business value.

title: PepsiCo Announces Senior Leadership Appointment
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. announced the appointment of Athina Kanioura as Executive Vice President and Chief Strategy and Transformation Officer. In this new role, Kanioura will lead PepsiCo's end-to-end strategy, including digitalization and data, and drive company-wide transformation to accelerate growth and optimize cost efficiency. Her background at Accenture, specializing in AI and analytics for business transformation, is expected to be valuable for PepsiCo's goals.

title: PepsiCo is launching a drink to get a piece of the $1 billion sleep aid industry
summary: PepsiCo is entering the $1 billion sleep aid industry with a new drink called Driftwell, an "enhanced water" designed to promote relaxation and ease stress. The drink contains L-theanine and magnesium, targeting the growing functional beverage category. This move aims to diversify PepsiCo's portfolio beyond carbonated soft drinks and capitalize on the consumer demand for health and wellness products.

title: Universal Corp. to acquire Silva International
summary: Universal Corp. has agreed to acquire Silva International, a company specializing in dehydrated vegetable, fruit, and herb processing, for $170 million in cash. This acquisition will expand Universal Corp.'s plant-based ingredients platform, which also includes FruitSmart, Inc. and Carolina Innovative Food Ingredients, Inc. The company expects these plant-based businesses to represent 10% to 20% of its EBITDA by fiscal year 2022.

title: PepsiCo, USAID Launch Five-Year, $20 Million Partnership to Empower Women in Agriculture
summary: PepsiCo announced a new five-year, $20 million partnership with USAID under the Women's Global Development and Prosperity (W-GDP) Initiative to empower women in agriculture and build a more sustainable food system. The project aims to drive inclusivity and improve business results by actively engaging women as critical drivers of PepsiCo's sustainable sourcing strategy. This initiative will support women-owned small- and medium-enterprises and women-led PepsiCo suppliers in Asia, the Middle East, and Latin America, building on previous successes in West Bengal.

title: Digimarc to serve as principal technology for HolyGrail 2.0 initiative
summary: Digimarc's automatic identification platform has been selected as the principal technology for the "HolyGrail 2.0" initiative. This cross-value chain effort aims to evaluate how digital watermarking can improve the sorting and recycling rates for packaging within the European Union. Major brands like P&G, Nestle, PepsiCo, and Danone are leading the initiative with over 85 participating companies.

title: Campbell Soup Exec's Journey From Combat to CPG
summary: Toby Johnson, SVP of sales at Campbell Snacks, transitioned her leadership skills from pilot of an Apache helicopter in Operation Iraqi Freedom to a successful career in the CPG industry. Johnson emphasizes the importance of servant leadership and building diverse teams, principles she learned in the military. She joined Campbell Soup during a pivotal time, with the company experiencing significant growth in sales due to increased consumer demand during the COVID-19 pandemic, and focuses on meeting this demand and adapting to evolving consumer snacking habits.

title: Plant-based food maker Laird Superfood files for $40M IPO
summary: Laird Superfood, a plant-based superfood company, has filed for a $40 million IPO with the SEC under the ticker symbol LSF. The company reported revenues of $13.1 million in 2019 and $11.1 million in the first half of 2020, aiming to capitalize on increased consumer demand for natural, organic, and functional foods, especially during the pandemic. Danone Manifesto Ventures, the corporate venture arm of Danone, currently holds a 13.4% stake in Laird Superfood.

title: PepsiCo's Annual North America Greenhouse Accelerator Program Awards $100,000 Grant to Spudsy
summary: PepsiCo announced Spudsy, a Costa Mesa, Calif., female-owned company making sweet potato puff snacks, as the winner of its second annual North America Greenhouse program, awarding them a $100,000 grant. The six-month accelerator program supported 10 emerging food and beverage brands, including Spudsy, which significantly grew its revenue and demonstrated a strong purpose-driven brand by upcycling imperfect sweet potatoes to reduce food waste. PepsiCo mentors provided guidance on various business aspects, helping finalists, including Spudsy, navigate challenges and adapt during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: PepsiCo Announces Senior Leadership Appointments
summary: PepsiCo announced key senior leadership appointments, including Roberto Azevêdo as Executive Vice President and Chief Corporate Affairs Officer, effective September 1, 2020. Jim Andrew was also appointed as Chief Sustainability Officer, in addition to his current role as Executive Vice President, Beyond the Bottle, replacing the retiring Simon Lowden. These changes aim to strengthen PepsiCo's external engagement and accelerate its global sustainability agenda.

title: Kraft Heinz Names Cory Onell President of U.S. Sales, Sanjiv Gajiwala as U.S. Chief Growth Officer, and Stephanie Peterson as Head of U.S. Communications
summary: Kraft Heinz announced three new executive appointments to leadership positions in its U.S. operations. Cory Onell was named President of U.S. Sales, Sanjiv Gajiwala as U.S. Chief Growth Officer, and Stephanie Peterson as Head of U.S. Communications. These appointments are part of the company's turnaround plan, bringing new experience in sales, consumer focus, and communications.

title: Two beverage giants choose cloud partners
summary: PepsiCo and Keurig Dr Pepper have each signed long-term cloud technology contracts with Microsoft and Google Cloud, respectively, to modernize their digital networks. PepsiCo's partnership with Microsoft aims to improve service delivery, innovation, and sustainability, while Keurig Dr Pepper's agreement with Google Cloud supports its digital transformation by migrating major applications and retiring data centers. Both companies are leveraging cloud solutions for greater agility, data insights, and operational resilience.

title: Dr Pepper is the latest pandemic shortage
summary: Dr Pepper has become the latest product to experience widespread shortages in some parts of the U.S. due to increased demand during the pandemic. Keurig Dr Pepper, the company owning the brand, stated that sales have consistently risen over the past four years, and they are working with distributors to address low inventory levels, while also not commenting on aluminum can shortages impacting other beverage producers. This shortage, similar to other household items during the pandemic, is attributed to a shift in consumer behavior towards at-home consumption of canned beverages.

title: Flowers Foods prioritizing M&A, top branded products
summary: Flowers Foods announced a strategic update prioritizing mergers and acquisitions in grain-based foods and enhancing the market presence of its valued brands like Nature's Own and Dave's Killer Bread. This move aims to drive growth, operate more efficiently, and deliver enhanced shareholder value, following a trend in the food and beverage space towards value-added products and strategic acquisitions to meet evolving consumer demands and compete with private labels. The company, which had $4.1 billion in sales last year, expects long-term sales growth of 1% to 2% excluding M&A.

title: Coca-Cola to debut coffee-flavored cola in the US
summary: Coca-Cola is launching its coffee and soda hybrid drink, Coca-Cola with Coffee, in the U.S. in January 2021, after having piloted it internationally since 2018. This move is part of Coca-Cola's strategy to diversify its product portfolio beyond traditional sodas and tap into the growing coffee market. The company is using a "test-and-learn approach" by first offering it to its Insiders Club before a wider public release, aiming to gather valuable consumer feedback.

title: COVID-19 pressures pushing Starbucks to rethink its stores
summary: Starbucks is accelerating changes to its store formats and operations in response to shifting consumer behaviors exacerbated by COVID-19. Initiatives include faster drive-thrus, expanded curbside pickup, and the development of new Starbucks pickup stores in urban areas. The company reported a significant loss in its third quarter, driving the need to adapt its strategy for long-term growth.

title: Polar Beverages goes nationwide in blockbuster deal with Keurig Dr Pepper
summary: Polar Beverages has entered a long-term franchise agreement with Keurig Dr Pepper to expand its seltzer distribution nationwide, leveraging Keurig's direct-to-stores delivery and manufacturing networks. This deal allows Polar to maintain ownership while gaining national reach for its quirky-flavored seltzers, aiming to elevate its market position from third nationally in the nearly $2 billion sparkling water category. The partnership builds on an existing 30-year relationship where Polar distributed KDP brands, and now KDP will manufacture and distribute Polar seltzers in new territories, sharing marketing costs.

title: Fifteen Female Founders Kick Off 2020 Stacy's Rise Project With Soccer Stars And Fellow Entrepreneurs Christen Press And Tobin Heath
summary: The 2020 Stacy's Rise Project has launched, supporting 15 female founders with grants, mentorship, and advertising services, with participation from soccer stars Christen Press and Tobin Heath.
