It highlights three charts showing bullish trends for the Invesco Dynamic Food & Beverage ETF (PBJ), Hormel Foods Corporation (HRL), and PepsiCo, Inc. (PEP). Technical analysis such as moving average crossovers and established trendlines indicate potential long-term uptrends and buying opportunities in this often-underfollowed sector.

title: Advance Auto Parts CEO to Speak at C-Suite Perspectives
summary: Advance Auto Parts President and CEO Tom Greco is scheduled to speak at the C-Suite Perspectives forum in Cary on June 21, hosted by the Greater Raleigh Chamber of Commerce. He will discuss leadership, company culture, investing in teams and community, and diversity. The event, sponsored by Ward and Smith, P.A., aims to provide insights into his experiences, including his tenure at Frito-Lay North America and Advance Auto Parts' move to Raleigh.

title: Hershey CEO says CBD trend is being 'evaluated'
summary: Hershey CEO Michele Buck announced that the company is evaluating the CBD trend but has no immediate plans to incorporate it into its products due to regulatory hurdles. While acknowledging CBD's growing popularity and potential benefits, Buck stated that interstate shipping of food products with CBD is currently not legal. Hershey will continue to monitor the trend and regulatory landscape before making any decisions.

title: Former PepsiCo CIO Robert Dixon Named To The Okta Board of Directors
summary: Okta, Inc. has announced the appointment of Robert Dixon, former Senior Vice President and Global CIO of PepsiCo, Inc., to its board of directors, effective June 14. Dixon brings extensive experience from PepsiCo and Procter & Gamble, as well as current board positions with Anthem, Inc. and Build-A-Bear Workshop, Inc. His expertise in digital transformation and IT infrastructure is expected to provide invaluable insight for Okta's vision of enabling organizations to leverage technology effectively.

title: Bink’s beverage distributors continue 116-year tradition
summary: Bink's Coca-Cola and Bink's Wines & Beverages continue a 116-year family tradition of beverage distribution in the local area. The business, originally established in 1903, adapted during Prohibition to bottle soft drinks and later re-entered the alcohol distribution market. Today, the companies focus on selling, distributing, and expanding their product lines and service areas for both alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages.

title: T. Rowe Price appoints Dina Dublon, Robert J. Stevens to board - Bizwomen
summary: T. Rowe Price Group Inc. has appointed Dina Dublon, former CFO at JPMorgan Chase & Co., and Robert J. Stevens, former CEO at Lockheed Martin Corp., as independent directors to its board. These appointments bring the money manager's board to 11 members, filling vacancies left by recent retirements. Dublon’s appointment increases the number of women on the board to four, aligning with efforts to promote more female representation in boardrooms.

title: PepsiCo Announces Senior Leadership Appointment
summary: PepsiCo announced the appointment of Ram Krishnan as its Global Chief Commercial Officer. Krishnan, who currently leads PepsiCo's Greater China sector, replaces Laxman Narasimhan, who is departing to become CEO of Reckitt Benckiser Group. PepsiCo Chairman and CEO Ramon Laguarta praised Krishnan's strategic mindset and consumer understanding, highlighting his success in both Eastern and Western markets.

title: 3M Deconsolidates Venezuelan Subsidiary
summary: 3M has deconsolidated its Venezuelan subsidiary, citing an "unstable environment and heightened unrest" and expecting a $160 million charge in the second quarter, although the move is not expected to cause economic impact to 3M. This follows similar actions by other Minnesota companies like Ecolab and major corporations such as Colgate-Palmolive and PepsiCo due to Venezuela's unstable economic conditions.

title: MTN DEW Introduces Sweet Lightning® Available Exclusively at KFC - A Bold New Beverage to Pair Perfectly with the Colonel's 11 Herbs and Spices
summary: MTN DEW has launched a new exclusive beverage called Sweet Lightning®, available only at KFC restaurants nationwide by July 1st. This unique drink features a flavor profile of peach and honey, specifically developed to pair perfectly with KFC's Original Recipe fried chicken. Sweet Lightning is MTN DEW's second exclusive quick-service restaurant partnership, following the successful Baja Blast at Taco Bell.

title: Metal packaging leader Ball looks to grow Indian business
summary: Ball, a global leader in metal packaging, is looking to significantly expand its business in India by capitalizing on the low per capita consumption of metal cans and the growing demand for sustainable packaging. With two beverage packaging plants and an aerosol can plant, Ball India aims to address local challenges like excise duties and promote metal cans as a highly recyclable and sustainable option. The company plans to innovate with print technologies and new materials like aluminum cups, while also working to improve the collection of used beverage cans for recycling in India.

title: Ball Corporation looks to grow Indian business - THE PACKMAN
summary: Ball Corporation, a global supplier of metal packaging, is looking to expand its business in India, where it currently has a production capacity of 1.3 billion cans. The company sees significant growth opportunities due to low per capita consumption of metal cans compared to other developing markets and is investing in initiatives to leverage aluminum packaging for dairy and craft brewery markets. Despite challenges like excise duties, Ball Corporation highlights the environmental and logistical advantages of aluminum cans to boost market penetration in India.

title: Coca-Cola offers consumers $10K to create best new drink concoction
summary: Coca-Cola has launched a "Make Your Mix" contest offering $10,000 to the consumer who creates the best new flavor combination using their Freestyle machines. Participants must upload a photo and recipe to social media by June 30, with finalists announced from July 15 to August 25, and the winner revealed on November 11. This initiative aims to leverage consumer creativity for potential new product development and to engage a younger demographic.

title: Vita Coco maker thirsts for aluminum as it enters competitive bottled water space
summary: The maker of Vita Coco coconut water, All Market, is launching a new premium bottled water brand called Ever & Ever, packaged in aluminum, to address consumer demand for sustainable options. This move marks All Market's entry into the competitive bottled water market, leveraging aluminum's high recyclability in contrast to the commonly used plastic bottles. The company aims to differentiate Ever & Ever through its sustainability message and distinctive packaging to gain market share despite the saturated nature of the category.

title: LaCroix sales are ‘effectively in free fall,’ analyst says
summary: LaCroix's sales are "effectively in free fall," according to an analyst from Guggenheim, leading to a significant drop in its stock price. The downturn is attributed to increased competition, a lack of innovation, and perceived inexperience, despite sparkling water being a booming category. Newer brands like Spindrift are gaining market share by offering visibly natural ingredients, highlighting LaCroix's struggle to maintain relevance and innovate amidst a crowded market.

title: Conagra Brands Showcases its $2 Billion Snacking Portfolio at 2019 Sweets & Snacks Expo
summary: Conagra Brands highlighted its $2 billion snacking portfolio at the 2019 Sweets & Snacks Expo, featuring leading brands in categories like meat snacks, seeds, popcorn, and sweet treats. The company emphasized its focus on consumer trends, innovation, and helping retailers succeed. Key brands showcased included Angie's® BOOMCHICKAPOP®, Slim Jim®, and Duncan Hines®, among others.

title: Loop’s ‘waste-free’ e-commerce platform launches with P&G, Kroger, Walgreens on board
summary: Loop, TerraCycle's "circular shopping platform," has launched its e-commerce site with Kroger and Walgreens as founding retail partners. The platform offers multi-use packaging for products from brands like Unilever, Mars, Nestle, PepsiCo, Colgate-Palmolive, and Procter & Gamble, aimed at significantly reducing waste. The pilot program, currently available in limited U.S. and Paris locations, requires a deposit for packaging that is returned, cleaned, refilled, and resold, emphasizing the companies' commitment to testing and scaling sustainable consumer solutions.

title: Drink like it’s 1985: Coca-Cola revives New Coke for Stranger Things 3
summary: Coca-Cola is re-releasing New Coke as a tie-in with Netflix's Stranger Things 3, which is set in 1985. 500,000 cans will be available online and at the World of Coca-Cola in Atlanta, complete with Stranger Things promotional designs and a remake of the original New Coke ad. This promotional event capitalizes on New Coke's historical significance as a major news story in the 1980s due to its consumer backlash.

title: PepsiCo Launches Foodservice Digital Lab for Restaurants and Other Foodservice Operators
summary: PepsiCo has launched its Foodservice Digital Lab, a new suite of capabilities designed to help foodservice operators find the best digital solutions for their businesses. This initiative, the first of its kind from a foodservice manufacturer, aims to connect operators with insights and services to improve consumer experiences and business results in the digital age. The Digital Lab offers four key elements: Digital Insights, Digital Playbooks, Digital Activation, and Digital Innovation, covering a range of tools from online ordering optimization to experimenting with voice and augmented reality technologies.

title: PepsiCo Foodservice Unveils New Digital Lab to Help Restaurants Thrive In The Evolving Digital Marketplace
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. (NASDAQ: PEP) has launched the PepsiCo Foodservice Digital Lab, a new suite of capabilities designed to connect foodservice operators with resources to navigate the evolving digital marketplace. This initiative provides insights, playbooks, activation support, and innovation to help restaurants utilize technology effectively for a better consumer experience and improved business results. The Digital Lab aims to address challenges faced by operators in adopting new technologies and will be showcased at the National Restaurant Association Show.

title: Wix buys brand promotion agency Gefen Team
summary: Wix.com Ltd. has acquired Tel Aviv-based brand promotion agency Gefen Team to strengthen its brand and help achieve its goal of becoming one of the world's 100 strongest and best-loved brands. Gefen Team's entire staff will join Wix's marketing department, led by Eran Gefen, and will focus on building an international brand. Financial details were not disclosed, but the acquisition is not considered material given Wix's cash reserves of $789 million.

title: Morgan Stanley upgrades Coca-Cola to overweight: 'Coke is now our top mega-cap staples pick'
summary: Morgan Stanley upgraded Coca-Cola shares to overweight from equal weight, setting a new 12-month price target of $55. The firm believes Coca-Cola is trading at an "unfair discount to peers" given its superior growth outlook, pricing power, and rebounding emerging market trends. Coca-Cola is now Morgan Stanley's top mega-cap staples pick, with analysts raising future EPS estimates.

title: PepsiCo Announces Timing and Availability of Second Quarter Financial Results and Conference Call
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. announced the timing for the release of its second quarter financial results, which conclude on June 15. The results will be posted on the company's website on July 9, 2019, at approximately 6:00 a.m. Eastern Daylight Time, followed by an earnings conference call for investors and financial analysts at 7:45 a.m. EDT.

title: Stacy's Brand Extends Commitment To Helping Female Founders Rise
summary: Stacy's Pita Chips announced an extension of The Stacy's Rise Project, a commitment to help female entrepreneurs in the food and beverage industry. In partnership with Alice, the project will award funding, mentorship, and business development support, including a $100,000 grand prize, to female founders. Entrepreneur and food expert Padma Lakshmi will join the judging panel to select finalists.

title: PepsiCo introduces hydration kiosk to reduce single-serve plastic bottles
summary: PepsiCo Inc. has launched a new hydration system as part of its Beyond the Bottle initiative to reduce single-use plastic bottles. This system includes a hydration dispenser, a smartphone app, and personalized QR codes for reusable bottles, allowing users to track hydration, environmental impact, and customize their drinks. The platform will be rolled out at select workplaces, universities, and hospitality partners to offer sustainable and customizable drink options.

title: Pepsi withdraws Indian potato farmer lawsuits after political pressure
summary: PepsiCo Inc. has agreed to withdraw lawsuits against nine Indian potato farmers whom it had accused of infringing a patent by cultivating a potato variety grown exclusively for its Lay's chips. The decision followed political pressure and intervention from an influential Hindu nationalist group, with PepsiCo stating its commitment to finding an amicable resolution to seed protection issues. The company had previously sought over 10 million rupees from four of the farmers and had faced criticism from the opposition Congress party.

title: Pepsi is suing Indian farmers for growing special spuds designed for Lay’s chips
summary: PepsiCo is suing Indian farmers for patent infringement, claiming they are illegally cultivating its proprietary FC5 potatoes, which are designed for Lay's chips. The company is demanding Rs10 million from each farmer and offered a settlement to either join their licensing program or grow other potato varieties. Farmers and activists argue Pepsi's actions violate Indian agricultural laws protecting farmers' rights and have called for a boycott of Lay's products.

title: PepsiCo sues four Indian farmers for using its patented Lay's potatoes
summary: PepsiCo Inc. has sued four Indian farmers for allegedly infringing its patent by cultivating the FC5 potato variety, which is exclusively grown for its Lay's potato chips. The company is seeking over 10 million rupees from each farmer and has offered them options to either join PepsiCo's farming program or cultivate other potato varieties. This incident highlights ongoing intellectual property disputes faced by large U.S. companies in India's agricultural sector.

title: Tostitos And Avocados From Mexico Team Up To Bring Tableside Guac To The Streets Of NYC, "Cinco Central" Promotion To Retailers Nationwide
summary: Tostitos and Avocados From Mexico are partnering for Cinco de Mayo celebrations, bringing "tableside" guacamole carts to New York City and "Cinco Central" retail promotions nationwide. The collaboration focuses on Cinco de Mayo brunch themes, offering consumers unique recipe ideas and convenient access to ingredients for their festivities. Avocados From Mexico anticipates a significant increase in avocado imports for the holiday, highlighting the growing popularity of Cinco de Mayo.

title: PepsiCo Announces Grant Recipient of Inaugural North American Nutrition Greenhouse Program
summary: PepsiCo announced Hapi Drinks as the recipient of a $100,000 grant, marking the culmination of its inaugural North American Nutrition Greenhouse program. This program supported ten emerging food and beverage brands, providing them with initial funding and mentorship, leading to an average revenue growth of 200 percent for the participating companies. Hapi Drinks, an Austin, Texas-based company creating sugar-free drinks for kids, was chosen for its mission to combat childhood obesity.

title: PepsiCo Goes Beyond the Bottle with New, Mobile-Enabled Hydration Platform
summary: PepsiCo has launched a new mobile-enabled hydration platform designed to address the growing demand for low- and no-sugar drinks and more sustainable packaging. The platform includes a smart dispenser, a smartphone app, and a personalized QR code for reusable bottles, allowing users to track hydration, environmental impact, and customize beverage options. This initiative is part of PepsiCo's "Beyond the Bottle" strategy, aiming to reduce single-use plastic bottles and will be rolled out in select workplaces, universities, and hospitality partners.

title: PepsiCo Announces Webcast of Annual Shareholders' Meeting
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. announced that its annual shareholders' meeting will be webcast live on Wednesday, May 1, 2019, at 9 a.m. Eastern Time. The webcast will be accessible through PepsiCo's website in the "Investors" section under "Events." The company also provided an overview of its global operations, financial performance in 2018, and its "Winning with Purpose" vision.

title: PepsiCo (PEP) posts upbeat Q1 2019 earnings
summary: PepsiCo announced upbeat first-quarter 2019 earnings, with net revenue increasing by 3% to $12.9 billion and net attributable income rising 6% to $1.4 billion, both exceeding market expectations. The company also provided a positive full-year 2019 outlook, anticipating 4% organic revenue growth and $8 billion in total cash returns to shareholders. CEO Ramon Laguarta highlighted strong performance across several divisions despite adverse foreign exchange rates.

title: PepsiCo Sales Get Lift From Rebound in Soda
summary: PepsiCo reported a first-quarter profit of $1.41 billion, or $1 a share, driven by a rebound in its soda sales. The company's overall organic revenue grew 5.2% from a year ago, marking its fastest growth in over three years, primarily attributed to increased advertising. PepsiCo forecasts 4% organic revenue growth for 2019.

title: Pepsi's Bubly Seltzer Brand Gains Ground on LaCroix, Perrier
summary: PepsiCo Inc.'s Bubly flavored seltzer brand is rapidly gaining market share against established competitors LaCroix and Perrier. This observation comes from research conducted by Bloomberg Intelligence analysts Kenneth Shea and Gopal Srinivasan, highlighting Bubly's quick rise in the seltzer market. The article suggests Bubly is "popping" in popularity.

title: Hormel Foods Finalizes the Sale of CytoSport to PepsiCo
summary: Hormel Foods Corporation has finalized the sale of its CytoSport business, including the Muscle Milk and Evolve brands, to PepsiCo, Inc. The transaction was valued at $465 million. Hormel Foods is a global branded food company known for products like SKIPPY and SPAM.

title: Coca-Cola Consolidated Announces $33M West Memphis Expansion
summary: Coca-Cola Consolidated Inc. announced a $33 million, 200,000-square-foot expansion of its West Memphis production facility, expected to create about 60 new jobs in Arkansas. The project, set to begin construction in August 2019 and finish in late 2020, involves transferring jobs and equipment from its Memphis production facility while maintaining distribution and logistics operations in Memphis. This investment highlights Coca-Cola's commitment to the region and has been welcomed by Arkansas state and local officials for its economic impact.

title: Frito-Lay Exec Named CEO of PepsiCo Foods North America
summary: Steven Williams, former Frito-Lay Chief Commercial Officer and Senior Vice President, has been appointed chief executive officer of PepsiCo Foods North America (PFNA). He replaces Vivek Sankaran, who is leaving PepsiCo to become president and CEO of Albertsons. PepsiCo's chairman and CEO, Ramon Laguarta, praised Williams' leadership and industry knowledge.

title: Hormel Foods Board of Directors Elects Chairman and CEO of Evans Food Group, Jose Luis Prado
summary: Hormel Foods Corporation has announced the election of Jose Luis Prado, Chairman and CEO of Evans Food Group, to its Board of Directors. Prado, an accomplished leader in the packaged food and snacks industry with extensive domestic and international experience, will serve on the Board’s Audit Committee. His career includes leadership roles at PepsiCo and Grupo Gamesa-Quaker, bringing valuable expertise to Hormel Foods.

title: Hotel and Restaurant Society gala to honor National Restaurant Association CEO
summary: The Penn State Hotel & Restaurant Society will host its Hospitality Executive of the Year event on April 3 at the Nittany Lion Inn, honoring Dawn Sweeney, president and CEO of the National Restaurant Association. The event, held at University Park campus, has secured numerous sponsors including Marriott International and PepsiCo. The article also provides background on the Penn State Hotel & Restaurant Society and the School of Hospitality Management.

title: The realities of rethinking plastic packaging
summary: This article discusses the complexities of reducing plastic packaging in supply chains, highlighting the challenges manufacturers face in balancing sustainability goals with product integrity and waste prevention. It covers efforts by companies like Walmart, Trader Joe's, and Sonoco Products to reduce plastic use, improve recyclability, and explore alternative materials, while also addressing the limitations and considerations of these substitutes. The piece emphasizes that eliminating plastic entirely isn't a simple solution, as other materials have their own environmental impacts and plastics often play a crucial role in preventing food waste.

title: Kansas City - PepsiCo will shutter KC facility
summary: PepsiCo Inc. is closing its production facility in Kansas City, impacting 57 employees. The article highlights this closure and briefly mentions related past articles concerning manufacturing and Coca-Cola bottling operations.

title: PepsiCo Announces Senior Leadership Appointments for Latin America Business
summary: PepsiCo announced two senior leadership appointments for its Latin America (LatAm) business, effective May 1, 2019. Paula Santilli was appointed CEO of LatAm, succeeding Laxman Narasimhan, and Roberto Martinez was named President of PepsiCo Mexico Foods, reporting to Santilli. These appointments aim to support PepsiCo's focus on consumer-centricity and growth in the region.

title: Tennessee distillery wants Pepsi to allow booze producers to use 'Mountain Dew'
summary: Ole Smoky Moonshine, a Tennessee distillery, is engaged in a legal dispute with PepsiCo over its use of the term "Mountain Dew" for alcoholic beverages. The distillery filed a motion to allow any company to use the phrase, arguing that "Mountain Dew" is a descriptive and general term for moonshine, with dictionary definitions supporting this claim. Ole Smoky hopes for an amicable solution that acknowledges the historical use of the term by moonshiners.

title: PepsiCo Announces Timing and Availability of First Quarter Financial Results and Conference Call
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. announced that it will release its first-quarter financial results for the period ending March 23 on Wednesday, April 17, 2019, at approximately 6:00 a.m. Eastern Daylight Time. The results will be posted on the company's investor website and furnished to the SEC on a Form 8-K. Additionally, an earnings conference call for investors and financial analysts will be webcast at 7:45 a.m. EDT on the same day.

title: PepsiCo announces senior leadership changes
summary: PepsiCo announced significant senior leadership changes aimed at bolstering its strategic priorities and growth agenda. Key appointments include Laxman Narasimhan to the newly created global chief commercial officer position and Silviu Popovici as CEO of ESSA, reporting directly to the CEO. The company also announced the retirement of Dr. Mehmood Khan, chief scientific officer of global R&D, with Rene Lammers appointed as the new chief science officer.

title: PepsiCo Announces Senior Leadership Appointments
summary: PepsiCo announced key senior leadership appointments to support its strategic priorities and growth agenda, including the creation of a Global Chief Commercial Officer role filled by Laxman Narasimhan. The company also delayered its operating businesses to become faster and more locally focused, with key business and geography leaders now reporting directly to Chairman and CEO Ramon Laguarta. Additionally, Dr. Mehmood Khan will retire as Vice Chairman and Chief Scientific Officer, with Rene Lammers appointed as the new Chief Science Officer.

title: Lay's Partners With Bebe Rexha To Create Perfect Harmonies With First-Ever Music-Inspired Chip Flavors That Unlock New Custom Songs
summary: Lay's has partnered with Bebe Rexha to launch "Turn Up the Flavor," a program featuring three limited-time chip flavors inspired by Pop, Hip Hop, and Rock music genres. Each flavor unlocks an exclusive new song from Bebe Rexha, remixed across these genres, offering a unique sensorial experience combining taste and music. Fans can stream the songs and enter for music-themed prizes by purchasing the special edition flavors.

title: New PepsiCo Solution Offers Tailored Insights to Retailer Partners
summary: PepsiCo Inc. has introduced Pep Worx, a cloud-based data and analytics solution designed to provide tailored insights to its retailer partners. This tool helps convenience store operators make data-driven decisions on product assortment, merchandising, and marketing to improve customer engagement and drive traffic. Pep Worx is adaptable for retailers of all sizes and emphasizes collaborative partnerships to achieve growth.

title: Here are the top 10 self-made richest women in India
summary: The Hurun’s India Rich List of 2018 highlights the top 10 self-made richest women in India, led by Biocon's Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw. The list features prominent figures such as PepsiCo's ex-CEO Indra Nooyi and Jayshree Ullal of Arista Network, showcasing women who have built significant wealth through their entrepreneurial ventures and leadership roles. Companies represented include biopharma, networking, healthcare technology, and consumer goods.

title: Indra Nooyi, former CEO of Pepsico, appointed to Amazon's board of directors
summary: Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi was appointed to Amazon's board of directors and its audit committee on February 25, 2019. This appointment follows her extensive career at PepsiCo, where she served as CEO and chairman. In connection with her election, Ms. Nooyi received a restricted stock unit award of 549 shares of Amazon common stock.

title: Amazon adds former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi to board
summary: Amazon.com Inc has appointed former PepsiCo Inc CEO Indra Nooyi to its board of directors, making her the second woman added to the board this month. Nooyi's appointment increases the number of women on Amazon's eleven-member board to five, aligning with the company's new policy to increase diversity. She will be part of the audit committee and has been granted 549 shares of common stock.

title: Amazon just appointed the former CEO of Pepsi to its board
summary: Amazon has appointed Indra Nooyi, the former CEO of PepsiCo, to its board of directors and the audit committee. She was granted 549 shares of common Amazon stock which will vest in equal annual installments starting May 15, 2020. Nooyi served as CEO of PepsiCo from October 2006 to October 2018 and also held leadership roles in finance, corporate strategy, and development after joining in 1994.

title: Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi Joins Amazon’s Board
summary: Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi has been elected to Amazon.com Inc.'s board of directors, joining its audit committee. Her appointment brings Amazon's board to 11 members, continuing a refresh of the panel. This marks the second new board appointee for Amazon this month.

title: Hormel says earnings drop on tax changes, reveals Muscle Milk sale details
summary: Hormel Foods Corp. announced that PepsiCo Inc. would acquire its CytoSport business, maker of Muscle Milk protein shakes, for $465 million. Hormel had originally purchased the business for $450 million in 2014. The article also touches on a drop in earnings for Hormel, attributed to tax changes.

title: PepsiCo Buys Wellness-Focused Muscle Milk in New CEO’s First Move
summary: PepsiCo's new CEO, Ramon Laguarta, has made his first acquisition, purchasing CytoSport, the maker of Muscle Milk and Evolve Protein products, from Hormel Foods Corp. This move signifies PepsiCo's continued diversification into wellness-focused products as consumer preferences shift away from soft drinks. The deal's financial terms were not disclosed but more details are expected during Hormel's upcoming earnings call.

title: Hormel sells CytoSport, maker of Muscle Milk, to Pepsi
summary: Hormel Foods Corp. announced the sale of its CytoSport business, including the Muscle Milk brand, to PepsiCo. Hormel had acquired CytoSport in 2014 for $450 million to expand into non-meat protein sources, but the business experienced a "disappointing year" in 2018 due to product recalls and competitive pressures. The deal is expected to close within the next two months, with PepsiCo leveraging its expertise in the sports nutrition category.

title: Pepsi Buys Muscle Milk in New CEO's First Move
summary: PepsiCo Inc.'s new CEO, Ramon Laguarta, has made his first acquisition by purchasing Muscle Milk from Hormel Foods Corp. for an undisclosed amount. This move signifies an expansion into the sports and wellness products market for Pepsi.

title: Hormel Foods Announces the Sale of CytoSport to PepsiCo
summary: Hormel Foods Corporation announced it has entered into a definitive agreement to sell its CytoSport business, including the Muscle Milk® brand, to PepsiCo, Inc. The transaction is subject to customary closing conditions and is expected to be completed within 30-60 days. Hormel Foods believes PepsiCo's expertise in sports nutrition and long-standing distribution partnership for CytoSport will help grow the dynamic business.

title: Dr Pepper's new home? Frisco set to approve new office building at Dallas Cowboys' Star development
summary: The City of Frisco is poised to approve a deal to provide land for a new corporate office building at the Dallas Cowboys' Star development, which is expected to house Keurig Dr Pepper's local offices. The city plans to sell a 2.49-acre site to Jerry Jones' Blue Star Land at a reduced cost, essentially providing a $2.1 million grant to facilitate the development. This move comes as Keurig Dr Pepper reportedly plans to relocate its offices from Plano's Legacy business park to The Star.

title: PepsiCo’s stock gains as Q4 results match expectations
summary: PepsiCo Inc. reported fourth-quarter 2018 revenue and earnings that met market expectations, leading to a slight stock gain. The company's net income significantly improved to $6.8 billion, driven by income tax benefits, and it expects organic revenue growth of 4% for full-year 2019. PepsiCo also announced a 3% increase in its annualized dividend per share.

title: Ruffles Announces Return As Presenting Partner Of 2019 NBA All-Star Celebrity Game With 4-Point Line 'The RIDGE' To Benefit Special Olympics
summary: Ruffles, the Official Chip of the NBA, is returning as the presenting partner of the 2019 NBA All-Star Celebrity Game, introducing a 4-point line called "The RIDGE." For every shot made from "The RIDGE," Ruffles will donate $4,000 to the Special Olympics, up to $40,000, to promote inclusion in sports. The game will air on ESPN and the ESPN App on Friday, February 15, and Ruffles also ran a "Live Like a Baller" contest for fans to win VIP experiences.

title: Tostitos To Set The (Unofficial) World Record For The Longest Livestream Of A Tortilla Chip Bowl
summary: Tostitos announced its plan to set an unofficial world record for the longest livestream of a tortilla chip bowl, streaming for 53 consecutive hours in celebration of Super Bowl LIII. The "TostitosLiveBowl" will feature NFL legends, fan requests for chip flavors and dips, and opportunities to win Tostitos products based on engagement. This initiative is part of Tostitos' "For Every Kind of Fan" campaign, aiming to unite fans through gameday snacking.

title: First-Ever Frito-Lay U.S. Snack Index Reveals Super Bowl Snacking Picks
summary: Frito-Lay North America announced its inaugural U.S. Snack Index, revealing Super Bowl snacking preferences across the country. The survey found that 9 out of 10 viewers plan to snack during the game, with potato chips and tortilla chips being the most popular choices, though regional preferences vary significantly. Younger consumers prefer spicy and cheesy snacks, and salsa is the overall top dip choice.

title: What that Gillette ad says about the trend in woke advertising
summary: Procter & Gamble's Gillette released a new ad addressing "toxic masculinity" and the #MeToo movement, following a trend of companies taking stances on social issues. The article explores how this "woke" advertising strategy can be successful, citing examples like Nike's Colin Kaepernick campaign, while also warning about failures like Pepsi's and Ram Trucks' ads that were perceived as artificial. Ultimately, the success of such campaigns hinges on authenticity and consistent follow-through.

title: Coca-Cola Takes Its Obesity Philanthropy to China
summary: New research reveals that Coca-Cola deliberately undermined China's efforts to address its growing obesity epidemic by shifting the direction of obesity research in its favor. Through financial support of organizations like the International Life Sciences Institute (ILSI), Coca-Cola promoted exercise as the primary solution to obesity, rather than dietary changes. This influence has significantly impacted China's public health policy, entrenching the idea that physical activity is the main solution.

title: PepsiCo Elects CEO Ramon Laguarta as Board Chairman
summary: PepsiCo's board of directors has unanimously elected CEO Ramon Laguarta as its new chairman, succeeding Indra K. Nooyi. Laguarta's appointment is effective February 1, 2019, making him the sixth chairman and CEO in PepsiCo's 53-year history. This transition follows Nooyi's announcement in August 2018 to step down as CEO and her subsequent retirement plans.

title: PepsiCo Elects CEO Ramon Laguarta As Chairman of the Board
summary: PepsiCo's Board of Directors unanimously elected Ramon Laguarta as the company's Chairman of the Board, effective February 1, 2019. Laguarta, who became CEO in October 2018, succeeds Indra K. Nooyi, who is retiring from the company. This appointment makes Laguarta the sixth Chairman and CEO in PepsiCo's 53-year history.

title: Yum Brands Turns to Former PepsiCo Executive for CFO
summary: Yum Brands Inc. has appointed former PepsiCo Inc. executive Chris Turner as its new Chief Financial Officer, concluding a nearly five-month search. Turner will assume responsibility for finance, corporate strategy, supply chain, and information technology starting August 8. The Louisville, Ky., fast-food company made the announcement on Thursday.

title: PepsiCo Appoints CEOs of Frito-Lay, North America Beverages
summary: PepsiCo has appointed Vivek Sankaran as CEO of Frito-Lay North America and Kirk Tanner as CEO of North America Beverages. These appointments follow the impending retirement of Albert P. Carey, CEO of PepsiCo North America, who will depart in March 2019 after 40 years with the company. PepsiCo CEO Ramon Laguarta praised Carey's leadership and expressed confidence in Sankaran and Tanner to lead their respective divisions.

title: PepsiCo Announces Leadership Appointments
summary: PepsiCo announced the retirement of Albert P. Carey, CEO of PepsiCo North America, effective March 2019, after nearly four decades with the company. Vivek Sankaran will become CEO of Frito-Lay North America, and Kirk Tanner will become CEO of North America Beverages. Ramon Laguarta, PepsiCo CEO, praised Carey's contributions and expressed confidence in the new leadership.

title: CBD drinks: Tilray, Anheuser-Busch InBev partner to research cannabis-infused drinks for the Canadian market
summary: Anheuser-Busch InBev and medical cannabis company Tilray have partnered in a $100 million deal to research non-alcoholic cannabis-infused drinks for the Canadian market, with each company investing $50 million. This alliance follows Canada's legalization of recreational marijuana and marks the latest entry of a major beer company into the burgeoning cannabis industry. The collaboration will explore drinks containing CBD and THC, building on Tilray's international presence and the overall growth of the North American legal cannabis market.

title: The Top 50 snack and bakery companies of 2018
summary: This article lists and discusses the top 50 snack and bakery companies of 2018, highlighting their financial performance, strategic investments, and divestitures. It notes significant changes in ranking and growth drivers for key players like Nestlé, PepsiCo, Campbell Soup Co., Arca Continental, The Wonderful Co., B&G Foods, Quest Nutrition, and J&J Snack Foods Corp. The report emphasizes the overall market size of the grain-based snack and bakery industry in the U.S. and the influential role of these companies.

title: Monopoly and the U.S. Waste Knot
summary: This article discusses the monopolistic control of the U.S. waste and recycling industry by "Big Waste" companies, which prioritize landfills over recycling due to higher profits. It traces the history of the waste industry's consolidation, the rise and stagnation of recycling, and the efforts by local communities to counter this trend. The author proposes strategies for local governments and businesses to decouple from Big Waste and foster more sustainable waste management practices like composting and dual-stream recycling.

title: Kraft Heinz buys paleo brand Primal Kitchen for $200M
summary: Kraft Heinz is acquiring Primal Kitchen, a paleo condiment and sauce brand, for $200 million, with the transaction expected to close in early 2019. Primal Kitchen will operate autonomously under Kraft Heinz's Springboard division, gaining access to supply chain and distribution channels. This acquisition marks Kraft Heinz's continued effort to innovate and expand its healthier product offerings amidst recent sales struggles.

title: The Campbell Soup Company Culture Is About to Change Forever. And Its Story Will Teach You the Lesson of a Lifetime
summary: The Campbell Soup Company, after 150 years, is undergoing significant change due to debt and declining earnings, leading to a settlement with activist hedge fund Third Point LLC. The article highlights how Campbell's struggles, partly stemming from missteps in fresh food ventures and the acquisition of Snyder’s-Lance, offer valuable lessons for entrepreneurs on decision-making, emphasizing research, mentorship, team involvement, intuition, and professional coaching. It stresses the importance of thorough consideration and transparency in business decisions.

title: Big food companies launch 'stealth small brands' to lure consumers
summary: Major food companies are creating "stealth small brands" that mimic startups to appeal to consumers seeking authenticity and specialized products. These brands, often with no visible connection to their parent companies, aim to compete with smaller innovators by offering unique ingredients and packaging. This strategy reflects a shift in consumer preferences towards more personalized and authentic products, even if it raises questions about transparency.

title: PepsiCo to Transfer Listing of Debt Securities to Nasdaq
summary: PepsiCo announced its plan to transfer the listing of several series of its Senior Notes from the New York Stock Exchange to the Nasdaq Bond Exchange. This move, effective December 7, 2018, aims to consolidate its equity and debt listings relationships under one exchange. The debt securities are expected to begin trading as Nasdaq-listed securities on December 10, 2018.

title: Brian Cornell Appointed Non-Executive Chairman of Yum! Brands
summary: Yum! Brands, Inc. announced the appointment of Brian C. Cornell, Chairman and CEO of Target Corporation, as its new Non-Executive Chairman of the Board. He succeeds Robert D. Walter, who is retiring from the role but will remain a board member. Mr. Cornell brings extensive experience from leading retail and global consumer product companies to his new position.

title: PepsiCo taps trending ingredient in plant-based beverage category
summary: PepsiCo is introducing Quaker Oat Beverage in early 2019, leveraging the growing trend of oats in the plant-based beverage category. The product aims to capitalize on oats' health benefits, including qualifying for an FDA heart health claim, and will compete with similar offerings from companies like Danone and Oatly. PepsiCo developed the beverage over two years, focusing on both functional benefits and taste to appeal to a broad consumer base.

title: Coca-Cola to boost its caffeine rush with first Coke-branded energy drinks
summary: Coca-Cola is planning to launch its first Coke-branded energy drinks, "Coca-Cola Energy" and "Coca-Cola Energy No Sugar", which will contain naturally-derived caffeine and guarana extract. This move follows Coca-Cola's recent acquisition of Costa Coffee and the introduction of a "Supersoda" in the Philippines, signaling a strong push into the caffeine market. The decision to enter the energy drink sector, however, has led to arbitration with Monster Beverage Corp., in which Coca-Cola holds a significant stake, over potential violations of a 2015 agreement.

title: PepsiCo Tests Ancient India River Route as Modi Pushes Waterways
summary: PepsiCo is testing an ancient Indian river route along the Ganges for container shipping, aligning with Prime Minister Narendra Modi's initiative to develop waterways. This project aims to shift cargo from congested road and rail networks, reducing transport costs and connecting with coastal ports. India is reviving or planning 111 waterways, with the World Bank-assisted Ganga waterways project slated for completion by 2023.

title: Meet the Inaugural Class of PepsiCo's Nutrition Greenhouse North America
summary: PepsiCo announced the ten emerging food and beverage brands selected for its first North American Nutrition Greenhouse accelerator program. Each startup will receive $20,000 in grant funding and participate in a 6-month business optimization program with personalized mentorship from PepsiCo experts. One company will receive an additional $100,000 at the end of the program based on progress and collaboration.

title: PepsiCo Announces Final Results for Offers to Exchange Certain Outstanding Notes for New Notes
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. announced the final results for its offers to exchange certain outstanding notes for new notes. The results are available on PepsiCo's investor relations website and will be filed with the SEC on a Form 8-K. The new notes are not registered under the Securities Act of 1933.

title: The Pepsi Challenge: PepsiCo Inc. wins competitive bidding process at Appalachian
summary: PepsiCo Inc. has won a competitive bidding process for pouring rights at Appalachian State University, securing exclusive rights to sell its products in campus vending machines, dining halls, and Kidd Brewer Stadium. This five-year contract, with a five-year extension option, also mandates PepsiCo to provide compostable cups, supporting the university's sustainability goals. The deal is expected to generate over $3 million in product sales annually.

title: PepsiCo buys Richmond ‘superfood’ company
summary: PepsiCo Inc. has acquired Richmond-based "superfood" company Health Warrior Inc. This acquisition expands PepsiCo's nutrition portfolio with Health Warrior's low-sugar, plant-based products. Health Warrior's CEO, Shane Emmett, will continue to lead the company, and this deal marks the first investment for PepsiCo HIVE, a new entity focused on smaller, emerging brands.

title: PepsiCo fights for protein with Health Warrior acquisition
summary: PepsiCo has acquired Health Warrior, a plant-based, protein-dense brand, making it the first acquisition for PepsiCo's innovation program, The Hive. This move continues PepsiCo's strategy to expand into healthier snacking options, aligning with the growing plant-based and protein-dense market. The acquisition is expected to accelerate Health Warrior's growth and introduce protein bars to PepsiCo's diverse product portfolio.

title: PepsiCo Announces Acquisition of Health Warrior, Expanding Presence in On-Trend Plant-Based Space
summary: PepsiCo (NASDAQ: PEP) has announced the acquisition of Health Warrior, Inc., a U.S.-based company specializing in plant-based nutrition products. This acquisition aims to expand PepsiCo's nutrition portfolio, offering more options in the growing plant-based category. Health Warrior will operate under The PepsiCo HIVE, a new entity focused on growing emerging brands, while maintaining its current leadership and headquarters.

title: PepsiCo Expands Sustainable Packaging Vision With New 2025 Goal
summary: PepsiCo Inc. has announced an expanded sustainable plastics vision with a new goal to use 25-percent recycled content in its plastic packaging by 2025. This goal includes a specific aim for polyethylene terephthalate (PET) beverage bottles to achieve 33-percent recycled PET content by the same year. To reach this, PepsiCo will collaborate with suppliers and partners, focus on consumer education, and advocate for improved recycling infrastructure and regulatory reform.

title: The CEO of LaCroix infuses his corporate messages with a subtle essence of conservatism
summary: This article reveals how Nick A. Caporella, CEO of National Beverage Corp. (maker of LaCroix), infuses his corporate messages with conservative political commentary, including critiques of former President Barack Obama and support for President Donald Trump. His investor reports often contain cryptic, capitalized declarations that merge spiritual guidance with business success, and he has used corporate statements to subtly express political views on national issues and legal challenges facing his company. The piece highlights specific examples of his political "poetry" dating back to 2009.

title: Frito-Lay, PepsiCo Announce Community Initiative - Southern Dallas Thrives
summary: Frito-Lay and PepsiCo, alongside the PepsiCo Foundation and United Way of Metropolitan Dallas, launched "Southern Dallas Thrives," a community initiative aimed at improving the lives of Southern Dallas citizens. The program focuses on increasing preschool education quality, providing nutritious meals, preparing high school students for college and careers, and offering childcare access to unemployed parents. The PepsiCo Foundation is contributing a $600,000 grant over three years to support these efforts.

title: Kroger names five food trends for 2019
summary: Kroger has identified five key food trends for 2019, including eating styles, gut-healthy foods, low sugar and natural sweeteners, plant-based foods, and regional flavors. These trends reflect consumer priorities in health, wellness, and diverse culinary experiences, and are already influencing product development within Kroger's private brands. The company leverages its extensive industry experience and consumer insights to predict and cater to evolving preferences in the food market.

title: Global survey reveals FMCG companies’ contribution to plastic pollution crisis
summary: A Greenpeace International survey reveals that fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) corporations are major contributors to the plastic pollution crisis, with none planning to reduce single-use plastic production. The report highlights a lack of transparency and commitment from these companies to move away from single-use packaging, instead focusing on recycling solutions that perpetuate the problem. The survey focused on 11 major FMCG companies, including Coca-Cola, PepsiCo, and Nestlé, finding that most are increasing their single-use plastic output.

title: Coca-Cola FEMSA adecuará sus operaciones en Venezuela debido a la crisis
summary: Coca-Cola FEMSA announced plans to "adapt" its operations in Venezuela due to the country's severe economic crisis and hyperinflation, which are impacting production and consumption. This adaptation may include a significant reduction of personnel, with a union leader stating the company indicated a need to cut over 40% of its workforce. The company is in talks with authorities and employees to revise production to suit the current market while reaffirming its commitment to continue operating in Venezuela.

title: Globe Chocolate Craze Hershey's to Send Kisses to India Now
summary: Hershey's is expanding its global presence by introducing its Kisses chocolate brand to the Indian market. The company plans to invest around $50 million over the next five years in India, focusing initially on metropolitan areas and leveraging the festive season for sales. Despite competition from established brands, Hershey's aims to capture a share of the growing Indian chocolate market by offering Milk Chocolate, Almonds, and Cookies and Cream variants of Kisses.

title: PepsiCo Announces Offers to Exchange Certain Outstanding Notes for New Notes
summary: PepsiCo announced offers to exchange certain outstanding notes (Metro Notes) for new notes (New PEP Notes). The exchange offers are available to eligible holders, including qualified institutional buyers and non-U.S. persons, and involve soliciting consents for amendments to indentures and PepsiCo guarantees. The offers are set to expire on November 7, 2018, with an early tender deadline of October 24, 2018.

title: PepsiCo Announces Cash Tender Offers for Certain Outstanding Notes
summary: PepsiCo has announced cash tender offers for several series of outstanding notes, including those originally issued by Whitman Corporation, The Pepsi Bottling Group, and PepsiAmericas, as well as its own senior notes. The offers include soliciting consents for amendments to indentures related to "Metro Notes" and their PepsiCo guarantees. The tender offers are set to expire on November 7, 2018, with an early tender deadline of October 24, 2018, allowing holders to receive a "Total Consideration."

title: New Salsa on the Block
summary: Herdez® Guacamole Salsa, a product of MegaMex Foods (a joint venture between Hormel Foods and Herdez del Fuerte, S.A. de C.V.), received the GMA's 2018 Award for Innovation and Creativity. The salsa has seen sales skyrocket, surpassing initial goals by 199 percent and continues to grow rapidly. Its success is attributed to its delicious blend of avocados, tomatillos, and jalapenos, and its appeal to a growing market of Mexican food lovers, including millennials.

title: LaCroix faces lawsuit for allegedly mislabeling its water as natural
summary: LaCroix's parent company, National Beverage Corp., is facing a class-action lawsuit alleging its sparkling water, marketed as "natural," contains synthetic compounds. National Beverage vehemently denies the claims, stating its flavors come from natural essence oils and intends to seek damages for defamation. The lawsuit highlights an ongoing challenge within the food industry regarding the ambiguous definition of "natural" and the increasing scrutiny of ingredient labeling.

title: Indra Nooyi: ‘I want to give the next generation in PepsiCo a chance to lead this great company’
summary: Indra K. Nooyi concluded her 12-year tenure as PepsiCo CEO, expressing her desire to spend more time with family and allow the next generation to lead the company. During her leadership, PepsiCo achieved significant financial growth, expanded its "Good-for-You and Better for You" options, and focused on sustainability. Ramon Laguarta, a 22-year company veteran, will succeed her as CEO.

title: PepsiCo Reports Third Quarter 2018 Results
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. announced the availability of its third-quarter 2018 financial results on its website and filed with the SEC on Form 8-K. The company also webcast an earnings conference call for investors and financial analysts. This release provides information on how interested parties can access the detailed financial results and listen to the conference call.

title: Keurig Dr. Pepper makes premium water play with $525m acquisition of CORE Nutrition
summary: Keurig Dr. Pepper (KDP) has acquired CORE Nutrition for $525 million, marking a significant entry into the premium water category. This acquisition fills a gap in KDP's portfolio and capitalizes on CORE's rapid growth and strong brand appeal, despite some concerns from analysts regarding allied brand relationships post-merger. The deal is expected to close by the end of 2018 and be accretive to KDP's EPS in 2020 and beyond.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper to buy premium water brand CORE Nutrition for $525M
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper is set to acquire premium water brand CORE Nutrition for $525 million, a move that expands its portfolio into healthier beverages following its merger. This acquisition, which includes CORE Hydration and CORE Organic, strengthens Keurig Dr Pepper's position in the growing bottled water market and puts it in direct competition with PepsiCo and Coca-Cola who are also investing heavily in healthier alternatives. The deal is expected to close by the end of the year, further integrating CORE into KDP's distribution network.

title: WPP creates new brand experience agency VMLY&R
summary: WPP announced the creation of a new global brand experience agency named VMLY&R, combining the expertise of VML and Y&R. This new agency will provide integrated digital and creative offerings to clients, led by Jon Cook, current Global CEO of VML. VMLY&R aims to deliver connected brands through a blend of brand experience and advertising, becoming fully operational in early 2019 with over 7,000 employees.

title: Coca-Cola Gets into the Kombucha Trade
summary: Coca-Cola Australia has acquired Organic & Raw Trading Co., the producer of the Mojo kombucha brand, marking Coca-Cola's entry into Australia's fast-growing kombucha market. The acquisition highlights a trend of major beverage companies investing in the health-conscious drink category, following similar moves by Lion and PepsiCo. Kombucha sales are booming globally, with projections for significant market growth by 2025.

title: Caspersen Joins Provident Bank as Executive Vice President, Director of Retail Banking Operations
summary: Provident Bank has announced the appointment of Finn M. W. Caspersen, Jr. as Executive Vice President and Director of Retail Banking Operations. In this new role, Caspersen will lead the bank's retail operations groups, contributing to strategic direction and business development plans. He brings extensive experience in corporate governance, regulatory compliance, and risk management from his previous role at Peapack-Gladstone Bank.

title: Cheetos Restaurant Is The Flamin' Hottest Reservation In Hollywood
summary: Cheetos is opening a new, limited-time restaurant called The Flamin' Hot Spot in Los Angeles, dedicated to the flavor of Flamin' Hot Cheetos. The restaurant, curated by chef Roy Choi, will open from September 18-20 and offer a three-course menu featuring Cheetos-infused dishes. This follows the success of last year's Cheetos restaurant, The Spotted Cheetah, due to overwhelming fan demand for Cheetos culinary experiences.

title: Prologis buys 10-acre Pepsi plant near Mount Baker light rail station
summary: Logistics company Prologis has acquired a 10-acre Pepsi plant situated near the Mount Baker light rail station in Seattle. This purchase aligns with Prologis' strategy to address Amazon.com's increasing demand for in-city distribution space. The acquisition is part of a broader trend of Prologis buying commercial properties with a focus on "last mile" logistics.

title: ETFs Investors can Use to Capitalize on M&A Activity in Israel
summary: This article highlights how investors can capitalize on Israel's growing economy and M&A activity through ETFs. It specifically recommends the VanEck Vectors Israel ETF (ISRA) and BlueStar Israel Technology ETF (ITEQ), detailing their performance and asset allocations. The author notes that increased M&A in both tech and non-tech sectors, fueled by foreign investment, is driving Israel's GDP growth.

title: Coca-Cola makes a $5.1-billion bet on the coffee market
summary: Coca-Cola is acquiring British coffee chain Costa for $5.1 billion, marking its largest acquisition in eight years and a significant diversification into the coffee market. This move aims to expand Coca-Cola's growth beyond sugary beverages and compete in the highly fragmented hot beverages sector, leveraging Costa's global presence and retail platform. The acquisition comes as rivals like PepsiCo, Nestle, and JAB also make strategic moves in the evolving beverage industry.

title: Coca-Cola buys Costa Coffee from Whitbread for £3.9bn
summary: Coca-Cola is acquiring the Costa Coffee chain from Whitbread for nearly £4bn, marking its entry into the rapidly growing global coffee market. This acquisition will make Coca-Cola the UK's largest coffee shop player and diversify its portfolio away from sugary soft drinks. The deal highlights a trend of beverage manufacturers adapting to changing consumer preferences.

title: Coca-Cola takes a plunge into coffee with a $5.1 billion Costa deal
summary: Coca-Cola has agreed to acquire the UK coffee chain Costa for $5.1 billion, including debt. This strategic move aims to diversify Coca-Cola's offerings beyond fizzy drinks and expand into the rapidly growing global coffee market, directly competing with companies like Starbucks and Nestle. The deal, which adds Costa's almost 4,000 outlets, was unanimously approved by Whitbread's board, significantly boosting Coca-Cola's presence in the hot beverages sector.

title: Episode #119: Tom Dorsey, Dorsey, Wright & Associates, “Fundamentals Answer the First Question ‘What Should I Buy?’ The Technical Side Answers the Question ‘When?’”
summary: This article features an interview with Tom Dorsey of Dorsey, Wright & Associates, discussing his approach to investing, which emphasizes Point & Figure charting and relative strength. Dorsey explains how fundamentals answer "what to buy," while technical analysis answers "when to buy," stressing the importance of supply and demand. He also touches on smart indexing, the evolution of ETFs, and applying relative strength to cryptocurrencies, highlighting its potential for automated portfolio management.

title: Beyond SodaStream, PepsiCo Is Eying Israeli Foodtech Startups
summary: PepsiCo is actively seeking new food technologies and has selected three Israeli foodtech startups to participate in its 2018 Nutrition Greenhouse incubator program. These startups include A1C Foods Ltd., Yofix Probiotics Ltd., and The Sprouted Grain Company. This move comes shortly after PepsiCo's agreement to acquire SodaStream International Ltd., indicating a broader interest in expanding its sugar-reduced and health-focused portfolio.

title: Coca-Cola buys Moxie in a bold beverage exit that only took 142 years
summary: Coca-Cola has acquired Moxie, one of the oldest national sodas, for an undisclosed amount, in a move that suggests a possible shift towards niche products or a national push for the beverage. This follows Pepsi's recent acquisition of SodaStream, indicating a trend of large beverage companies buying long-standing fizzy drink brands. Moxie, known for its bitter taste due to gentian root extract, was previously owned by an independent Coca-Cola bottling company.

title: PepsiCo Learned From Coca-Cola’s Soda Flop
summary: PepsiCo's acquisition of SodaStream for $3.2 billion highlights lessons learned from Coca-Cola's failed venture into the home soda-making market with Keurig Green Mountain. Coca-Cola's "Keurig Kold" machine, launched in 2015, proved to be an expensive flop due to high costs, poor performance, and a misalignment with consumer trends toward healthier, lower-sugar beverages. PepsiCo's strategic move with SodaStream, a well-established company aligned with health-conscious trends, demonstrates a different approach to the at-home beverage market.

title: PepsiCo wants to take a bite out of Cheetos competitor
summary: PepsiCo's Frito-Lay brand has filed a cease and desist order against Snack it Forward/World Peas, claiming their Peatos snack food has a name "confusingly similar" to Frito-Lay's Cheetos. This action suggests PepsiCo is protecting its established brand against potential trademark infringement.

title: Pepsi’s SodaStream acquisition won’t solve its biggest problem: fewer people are drinking soda
summary: Wells Fargo analysts suggest that PepsiCo's acquisition of SodaStream, while expanding into healthier categories and the at-home beverage market, won't address Pepsi's fundamental issue of declining soda consumption. They draw parallels between this deal and Coke's prior stake in Green Mountain, implying similar outcomes. The core problem remains fewer people drinking soda.

title: After Pepsi Takeover, Sodastream CEO Says He’ll Keep Speaking His Mind
summary: PepsiCo Inc. announced its acquisition of SodaStream International Ltd. for $3.2 billion, a move to expand its sugar-reduced portfolio. SodaStream CEO Daniel Birnbaum, known for his outspoken political views, stated he intends to remain "challenging" as a subsidiary of PepsiCo. The deal includes PepsiCo's commitment to keeping SodaStream's manufacturing facilities in Israel for 15 years.

title: If Pepsi’s $3 Billion Acquisition of SodaStream Is a Good Idea, Then It’s Really Screwed
summary: PepsiCo announced its acquisition of SodaStream for $3.2 billion, a move that highlights the soda giant's struggle to adapt to changing consumer tastes. While the acquisition reflects PepsiCo's pivot towards healthier options, the article questions the long-term viability of this strategy, suggesting that if SodaStream's model of home-made soda prevails, it could further undermine PepsiCo's core business. The deal is seen as a capstone for departing CEO Indra Nooyi's strategy to diversify PepsiCo beyond sugar-water and snacks.

title: PepsiCo Buys SodaStream for $3.2 Billion to Grow Wholesome Portfolio
summary: PepsiCo announced the acquisition of Israeli company SodaStream for $3.2 billion, aiming to expand its healthier beverage portfolio. The deal, priced at $144 per share, includes a commitment from PepsiCo to keep SodaStream's manufacturing facilities in Israel for 15 years. This acquisition aligns with PepsiCo's strategy to diversify into more sustainable and reduced-sugar products, building on former CEO Indra Nooyi's efforts.

title: PepsiCo Buys Seltzer Rival That Vilified It
summary: PepsiCo has agreed to acquire SodaStream International Ltd. for $3.2 billion, marking a significant step in the beverage giant's strategy to diversify beyond sugary drinks and salty snacks. This acquisition creates an unexpected partnership, as SodaStream has previously criticized PepsiCo and other bottled-water companies for their environmental impact. The deal reflects PepsiCo's efforts to revamp its North American beverage business amid declining demand for traditional sodas.

title: PepsiCo Enhances Healthier Portfolio With SodaStream Acquisition
summary: PepsiCo is set to acquire SodaStream International Ltd. for $3.2 billion, aiming to strengthen its presence in the water and healthier beverage segments and align with its "Performance with Purpose" vision. This acquisition is seen as a strategic move to offer personalized in-home beverage solutions and expand SodaStream's global reach, despite some analyst comparisons to past challenges in the in-home beverage market. The deal, which has been unanimously approved by both companies' boards, is expected to close by January, pending shareholder and regulatory approvals.

title: PepsiCo Enters Into Agreement To Acquire SodaStream International Ltd.
summary: PepsiCo announced an agreement to acquire SodaStream International Ltd. for $144.00 per share in cash, totaling $3.2 billion. This acquisition is part of PepsiCo's strategy to expand its water portfolio and in-home beverage solutions, aligning with its "Performance with Purpose" philosophy. The deal, which represents a 32% premium, is expected to close by January 2019, subject to shareholder and regulatory approvals.

title: PepsiCo to buy SodaStream for $3.2 billion
summary: PepsiCo announced its acquisition of at-home carbonated drink maker SodaStream for $3.2 billion, paying $144 per share. This strategic move allows PepsiCo to expand into the home beverage market and adapt to changing consumer preferences away from sugary drinks and increasing online grocery shopping trends. The deal is expected to close by January, pending shareholder and regulatory approvals, with SodaStream's CEO Daniel Birnbaum remaining with the company.

title: Circle K & Monster Beverage Launch Ultimate Fan Sweepstakes
summary: Circle K Stores Inc. has partnered with Monster Beverage Corp. as the exclusive sweepstakes sponsor for the "Ultimate Fan Challenge" related to the Ultimate Fighting Championship. The sweepstakes will award 300 winners with prizes including the "UFC 3" game, Monster Energy-branded MMA gloves, or a uff.tv pay-per-view pass, entered by purchasing two Monster Energy SKUs. This follows a previous MMA-related sweepstakes collaboration between Circle K and Monster Energy, and PepsiCo's Gatorade is also running a sports-themed sweepstakes at Circle K.

title: Marriott Extends Partnership With PepsiCo, Eyes Sales Growth
summary: Marriott International (MAR) has extended its over 25-year partnership with PepsiCo (PEP), making PepsiCo the official beverage provider for Marriott's legacy brands, now catering to over 6,300 properties. This expanded agreement aims to enhance customer experience, drive incremental sales, and support Marriott's growth strategies through world-class beverage and culinary offerings, and unique loyalty member experiences. The partnership is expected to bolster Marriott's revenue growth and strengthen its position in the hotel industry.

title: Kraft Heinz gives legacy brands a healthy makeover to stay relevant
summary: Kraft Heinz is revamping its legacy brands like Capri Sun, Oscar Mayer, and Kraft Mac & Cheese to be healthier, aiming to appeal to millennials and their preference for clean labels and convenience. This strategy involves removing artificial ingredients and introducing organic options, although the company faces challenges with product reformulations and potential customer backlash, as seen with General Mills' Trix cereal. Despite the high costs and sourcing issues associated with "clean label" changes, major CPG manufacturers hope these makeovers will foster customer loyalty and ensure long-term growth.

title: Coca-Cola piloting Swiss sparkling water in Atlanta
summary: Coca-Cola is testing its Valser sparkling water brand, acquired in 2001, in a pilot project in Atlanta to gauge U.S. consumer interest. This initiative is part of Coca-Cola's strategy to expand its sparkling water portfolio and quickly adapt to changing consumer tastes through innovation, including using crowdfunding platforms for market testing. The company has seen success with Topo Chico, another sparkling water acquisition, and continues to add new flavors to existing water brands, highlighting the competitive and growing nature of the bottled water category.

title: 8 Beverage Leadership Moves We're Watching
summary: This article details eight significant leadership changes within the beverage industry, including the departure of PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi and the appointment of Ramon Laguarta as her successor. It also covers executive changes at Monster Beverage, Boston Beer, Wine & Spirits Wholesalers of America, Peet's Coffee, Hoist, Celsius Holdings Inc., and Borden Dairy, highlighting key appointments and new roles.

title: Heinz Red Ketchup Packets Set to Get a Green Makeover
summary: The Kraft Heinz Co. has announced plans to make 100 percent of its packaging environmentally sustainable by 2025, aiming for recyclable, reusable, or compostable designs. This initiative will impact products like Heinz ketchup packets, Capri Sun pouches, and Kraft Singles wrappings, which are currently difficult to recycle. The company will partner with experts like Environmental Packaging International to find solutions that balance sustainability with food safety and shelf life requirements.

title: Pepsi's Indra Nooyi latest high-profile female CEO to exit
summary: Indra Nooyi, a prominent female and minority CEO in the Fortune 500, is stepping down as PepsiCo's chief executive after 12 years. She led PepsiCo during a period of changing consumer tastes, emphasizing "good for you" options while retaining traditional products. Ramon Laguarta, a PepsiCo veteran, will succeed her as CEO in October, with Nooyi remaining as chairwoman until early next year.

title: Indra Nooyi's Pepsi exit means another female CEO replaced by a man
summary: The article highlights a trend where female CEOs of S&P 500 companies are predominantly replaced by men, citing the departure of PepsiCo Inc CEO Indra Nooyi as a recent example. Data suggests that out of at least 24 female CEOs who stepped down since 2009, all but three were succeeded by a man, leading to a decline in the number of female CEOs in Fortune 500 companies. This trend is attributed to male-dominated corporate boards and the concentration of women in executive roles less likely to lead to a CEO position.

title: IBM’s Rometty Could Be Next Female CEO to Leave
summary: This article discusses the potential departure of IBM CEO Virginia Rometty, following news of PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi's exit. Rometty's position is seen as precarious due to IBM's weak financial results, slow adoption of cloud computing, and a significant underperformance of its stock compared to the S&P 500 and rival tech giants like Amazon and Microsoft. The article suggests that performance, rather than age or retirement, will be the driving factor behind her potential departure.

title: PepsiCo veteran Ramon Laguarta to replace Indra Nooyi as CEO
authors: Siddharth Cavale and Uday Sampath Kumar
summary: Ramon Laguarta has been appointed to succeed Indra Nooyi as CEO of PepsiCo, with his tenure beginning on October 3. Laguarta, a 22-year veteran of the company, will be tasked with navigating changing consumer tastes away from sugary drinks. Nooyi's departure marks a significant leadership change, leaving only a small percentage of female CEOs in Fortune 500 companies.

title: FedEx, IP execs dining with President Trump at golf resort
summary: Executives from FedEx and International Paper are reportedly dining with President Donald Trump at a golf resort. The article highlights past interactions between FedEx and the Trump administration and discusses broader business implications for Memphis companies. Other business leaders, including PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi, were also present at the dinner event.

title: PepsiCo Veteran Ramon Laguarta To Replace Indra Nooyi As CEO
summary: Ramon Laguarta has been appointed to succeed Indra Nooyi as CEO of PepsiCo, effective October 3rd. Laguarta, a 22-year veteran of the company, previously led its European and Sub-Saharan African divisions and was named president last year. Nooyi is stepping down after 12 years as CEO, during which she oversaw significant growth and a reshaping of PepsiCo's portfolio.

title: Indra Nooyi, PepsiCo CEO, is stepping down; Ramon Laguarta to take over as CEO in October
summary: Indra Nooyi, the CEO of PepsiCo for 12 years, is stepping down, with Ramon Laguarta set to take over as CEO in October. Nooyi, a rarity as a woman and minority leading a Fortune 100 company, oversaw the company during a period requiring a shake-up of product portfolios to meet healthier consumer choices. Laguarta, who has been with PepsiCo for over two decades, will become the sixth CEO in the company's history.

title: Indra Nooyi, Pepsi’s First Female CEO, Is Stepping Down
summary: Indra Nooyi is stepping down as CEO of PepsiCo Inc. after 12 years, to be succeeded by Ramon Laguarta in October. Her departure reduces the number of female CEOs in S&P 500 companies and comes as Pepsi's North American beverage unit faces stagnation due to declining soda consumption. Nooyi plans to continue advocating for women in executive positions after leaving Pepsi.

title: Longtime PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi is Stepping Down
summary: Indra Nooyi, the longtime CEO of PepsiCo, is stepping down after 12 years at the helm and 24 years with the company. During her tenure, she oversaw a period of significant change in the food and beverage industry, pushing PepsiCo to adapt to healthier consumer choices. Ramon Laguarta will succeed her as CEO in October, becoming the sixth CEO in PepsiCo's history and continuing the company's tradition of promoting from within.
source: VOA - Voice of America English News
source_domain: VOA - Voice of America English News

title: Woman, minority, trailblazer: Indra Nooyi is leaving PepsiCo
summary: Indra Nooyi, a trailblazing woman and minority CEO, is stepping down from her role as PepsiCo's top executive. Born in India, Nooyi was a rarity on Wall Street as a female and minority leader of a Fortune 100 company. Her departure marks the end of an era for PepsiCo under her leadership.

title: PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi to step aside after 12 years
summary: Indra Nooyi is stepping down as CEO of PepsiCo after 12 years, handing the leadership to Ramon Laguarta. During her tenure, Nooyi navigated shifting consumer tastes, expanded the company into healthier products, and grew revenue by 81% to $63.5 billion. Her leadership also involved fending off an activist investor's attempt to break up the company.

title: PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi stepping down
summary: Indra Nooyi is stepping down as CEO of PepsiCo after 12 years in the position, with Ramon Laguarta named as her successor. Nooyi will remain chairman until early 2019, having served with the company for 24 years. During her tenure, shares of PepsiCo rose approximately 80%.

title: Ramon Laguarta Elected Chief Executive Officer of PepsiCo
summary: PepsiCo's Board of Directors has unanimously elected Ramon Laguarta as the new Chief Executive Officer, succeeding Indra K. Nooyi. Nooyi will step down on October 3rd after 12 years as CEO but will remain Chairman until early 2019 to ensure a smooth transition. Under Nooyi's leadership, PepsiCo delivered significant shareholder returns, nearly tripled dividends per share, and grew net revenue from $35 billion to $63.5 billion.

title: Indra Nooyi to end tenure as PepsiCo CEO
summary: Indra Nooyi is stepping down as PepsiCo CEO on October 3rd after 12 years in the role and 24 years with the company; she will remain chairman until early 2019. Ramon Laguarta, current president of PepsiCo, has been elected by the Board of Directors to replace her as CEO. Under Nooyi's leadership, PepsiCo saw significant growth in shareholder return, dividends, and net revenue, while also expanding its healthier product portfolio and emphasizing corporate sustainability.

title: Indra Nooyi to end tenure as PepsiCo CEO
summary: Indra Nooyi will step down as CEO of PepsiCo on October 3, 2018, after 12 years in the role, though she will remain chairman until early 2019. Ramon Laguarta, PepsiCo's president, has been elected by the Board of Directors to replace her as CEO. Under Nooyi's leadership, PepsiCo saw significant growth in shareholder return, dividends, and net revenue, while also emphasizing corporate sustainability and responsibility.

title: PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi to Step Aside; Veteran Set to Take Helm
summary: Indra Nooyi is stepping down as PepsiCo's CEO after 12 years, handing the leadership to Ramon Laguarta. During her tenure, she navigated changing consumer tastes and expanded into healthier products, increasing PepsiCo's annual revenue to $63.5 billion. Her successor will face challenges including declining market share for core soda brands and the need to ramp up advertising.

title: Pepsi's first female CEO to end 12-year run, replaced by insider
summary: Indra Nooyi is stepping down as CEO of PepsiCo Inc. after 12 years, to be replaced by Ramon Laguarta. Nooyi, the first foreign-born and female CEO of Pepsi, will remain chairman until early 2019. Her departure highlights the scarcity of female CEOs in corporate America and comes as Pepsi navigates challenges in the North American beverage unit.

title: Woman, minority, trailblazer: Indra Nooyi is leaving Pepsico
summary: Indra Nooyi, a notable woman and minority leader on Wall Street, is stepping down as CEO of PepsiCo after 12 years at the helm and 24 years with the company. During her tenure, Nooyi emphasized "good for you" options and resisted calls to spin off the beverage business. Ramon Laguarta, a long-time PepsiCo executive, will succeed her as CEO in October.

title: The Madison Square Garden Company And PepsiCo Announce Historic Partnership
summary: The Madison Square Garden Company (MSG) and PepsiCo announced a new, multi-faceted partnership making PepsiCo one of MSG's official signature marketing partners starting September 1, 2018. PepsiCo will become the exclusive non-alcoholic beverage and salty snack partner across various MSG properties, including Madison Square Garden venues and sports franchises like the New York Knicks and Rangers. This partnership will give PepsiCo broad marketing rights and extensive presence across MSG's assets, featuring their wide portfolio of food and beverage products and creating unique fan experiences.

title: PepsiCo CEO downplays threats to Gatorade’s market dominance
summary: PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi stated that Gatorade's market leadership remains strong despite new competitors and shifting consumer preferences. The company is introducing new products like Gatorade Zero, Gatorade Energy Chews, and G2 to innovate and maintain its dominant position in the sports drink market. Despite a recent sales dip, particularly due to consumers moving towards healthier alternatives, PepsiCo is confident in Gatorade's resilience and capacity for growth.

title: Let’s Be Frank
summary: This article chronicles the journey of Frank Povich, CytoSport's first employee and salesperson, from its humble beginnings selling a single product from a folding table to its acquisition by Hormel Foods. It details how Povich's persistence, the introduction of Muscle Milk, and his dedication to customer relationships were instrumental in the company's growth. The piece also touches on his personal love for sports and continuous self-challenge.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper's first week post-merger brings a defection, an acquisition and new volleys in coffee wars
summary: In its first week post-merger, Keurig Dr Pepper experienced significant changes, including Fiji Water's departure from its distribution network and the acquisition of Big Red soda. The company also announced new coffee partnerships, highlighting the dynamic shifts within the beverage industry following the creation of this new giant. These events underscore the challenges and opportunities for Keurig Dr Pepper's "Allied Brands" strategy.

title: PepsiCo looks to generate buzz with new Hive incubator
